In 5day.io, Add Workflow lets you create a new automation rule that runs automatically inside your project. One click and your team never has to remember those repetitive steps again.
Delete Workflow permanently removes an automation rule from your project. Use it when a rule is outdated, duplicated, or no longer needed - keeps your list clean and tidy.

In 5day.io, Edit Workflow lets you update any existing automation rule to keep it perfectly in sync with your team’s changing process. Tweak the name, logic, or actions in seconds—changes apply instantly across the project.
A Workflow in 5day.io is the smart rule that powers your Automation. It’s the “if this, then that” recipe you create once and let run forever inside a project.

Automation in 5day.io is your team's silent superhero that handles repetitive work automatically. You set up simple rules once, and every time something happens in a project, the system does the rest—no manual clicks, no forgotten steps.
List of Workflows shows every automation rule you’ve created inside the your project - all in one clean screen so you can see what’s running, pause anything, or jump straight to edits.
Actions are the “do this” part - the magic that happens automatically once your trigger + conditions say GO. One click = hundreds of manual steps saved forever.

Conditions are the smart filters that decide if your workflow should actually run after the trigger fires. Without them, every trigger would blindly execute actions. With them, you add precision: "Only if this AND that... OR if this other thing..."
Triggers are the starting point of every automation rule. They watch your project 24/7 and shout “GO!” the second something you care about happens.
In 5day.io, you can easily create and manage clients at the account level to organize your projects better.
In 5day.io, you can delete a client if it is no longer needed in your system.\
In 5day.io, you can easily edit client information, such as the client name and logo, to keep your records up to date.
In 5day.io, Add Custom Field enables you to create tailored data fields to capture project-specific information beyond standard attributes.
The availability of custom field types may vary based on your subscription.
Delete custom field for task and subtasks
In 5day.io, Edit Custom Field lets you refine any existing field’s name, type, options, or settings directly from the Custom Field Library or its associated project/workspace.
Custom fields are additional data fields that you can create and define based on your project's requirements.
To access all custom fields of an account

Space is the second level of organization within a Workspace. It allows you to group related Projects, Sections, Tasks, and Subtasks, making it easier to manage specific departments, teams, or focus areas under a single Workspace.
Space organizes Projects, Sections, Tasks, and Subtasks within a Workspace.
Once a Space is created in 5day.io, users with the appropriate permissions can edit the Space to configure its structure, and settings.

Spaces are the second level in the 5day.io structure, sitting within a Workspace. They act as containers for Projects, Sections, Tasks, and Subtasks, allowing you to organize work by department, team, or specific focus area. Spaces help you streamline collaboration and manage distinct areas of your organization efficiently.
List of Spaces gives you a single, clean screen showing every Space inside the current Workspace - perfect for jumping in, reordering, or managing access in seconds.
The Space Views provide a centralized interface to access and manage all Projects within a specific Space, organized under their parent Workspace.
In 5day.io, Add Subtask lets you break any Task into smaller, actionable steps.
In 5day.io, Add Task lets you instantly create a new unit of work within any project.

Bulk Update lets you select up to 50 Tasks (or Subtasks) at once and change one field across all of them in a single click - saving hours on repetitive edits like updating status, assignee, or priority for an entire project.
Deleting a subtask in 5day.io allows users to permanently remove unwanted or incorrect records from their project.
Deleting a task in 5day.io allows users to permanently remove unwanted or incorrect records from their project.
Duplicate Task creates an exact copy of any Task (with Subtasks, files, and settings) in one click - perfect for reusing templates, repeating sprints, or cloning client deliverables.
Edit Subtask lets you update any field on a Subtask - from title to due date - keeping the parent Task in perfect sync without extra clicks.
Edit Task lets you update any field on a Task or Subtask - from status to due date - keeping everything in sync without opening extra windows.
In 5day.io, a Subtask is a smaller actionable item that breaks down a main task into manageable steps.
In 5day.io, a Task represents a unit of work that needs to be completed within a project. Tasks help organize and prioritize project activities effectively.
List of Subtasks displays every Subtask linked to a parent Task in a clear, expandable view - so you can track progress, assign owner, and manage small steps without leaving the main Task.
Move Task lets you instantly relocate any Task to a different Section or even a different Project - keeping history, files, and automations fully intact.
The Assignee field in 5day.io helps identify the person responsible for completing a task or subtask.

The Budget Type allows to classify each task and subtask as either Billable or Non-billable. This classification plays a key role in tracking and managing project costs, billing cycles, and productivity.
Start Date and Due Date are essential scheduling attributes in 5day.io that define the planned timeline for a task or subtask.

Once the user accesses a task in 5day.io, a detailed panel opens on the right side of the screen. This panel contains complete information about the task/subtask and allows users to view and edit details depending on their permission level.
Estimation in 5day.io helps in defining the expected effort required to complete a task or subtask.

Links allow users to establish a direct relationship between two or more tasks or subtasks within the same project. Linking helps visualize dependencies, track related work, and manage task relationships efficiently.
The Priority field helps teams rank tasks and subtasks based on their urgency or business impact. This ensures that high-priority tasks are addressed first and resource allocation is optimized.

Task Recurrence turns any Task into a self-repeating machine - automatically creating new copies on your exact schedule (daily standups, weekly reports, monthly invoices, yearly audits) without lifting a finger after setup.
Story Points in 5day.io represent a unit of measure used to express the overall effort required to complete a task or subtask.
Tags are custom keywords or labels that you can add to tasks and subtasks in 5day.io to organize, group, and filter work items efficiently.

In 5day.io, Workspace serves as the highest level of organization within your account. It allows you to manage multiple departments, teams, or business units separately while keeping everything connected within the same ecosystem.

In 5day.io, a Workspace is the highest level of organization, containing Spaces, Projects, Sections, Tasks, and Subtasks. Deleting a Workspace removes it and all its associated data, including all Spaces and their contents, from your account. This action is permanent and should be performed with caution.
Once a workspace is created in 5day.io, users with the appropriate permissions can edit the workspace to configure its structure, settings, and users.
Workspace is at the highest level of the 5day.io structure. Spaces, projects, task and subtasks all reside within your workspace.
List of Workspaces gives you a single, clean screen showing every workspace inside the account - perfect for jumping in, reordering, or managing access in seconds.

People at Workspace lets you control exactly who can see and work inside a specific Workspace. Invite or add team members once here - they instantly get access to projects in this Workspace (based on their role and associated permission).

Workspace Details is the one-stop screen to view and update everything that defines your Workspace - from its name and look to who’s in charge. It keeps your Workspace identity sharp and ownership crystal-clear.
Workspace Owner is the single person with ultimate control over the entire Workspace - think of them as the captain who can steer, rename, transfer, or even delete the ship.
The Workspace View provides a centralized interface to access and manage all Projects, organized within their respective Spaces and Workspaces.
You can easily add existing members of your 5day.io workspace to a project using one of two methods. This ensures the right people have access and visibility to collaborate on the project tasks.

A Bar Chart is a graphical representation used to compare data across different categories.
A Doughnut Chart is a variation of a Pie Chart where the center is cut out, creating a doughnut-like shape.
A Line Chart is a graphical representation that displays information as a series of data points connected by straight lines.
A Number Chart is a simple, focused visualization that displays a single key metric as a prominent number.
A Pie Chart is a circular statistical graphic that is divided into slices to illustrate numerical proportions.
The Move Widget feature allows you to reposition widgets on your dashboard based on your layout preferences.
The Dashboard in 5day.io acts as a powerful visual workspace that brings together key project and section-level insights in one view.
A Widget is a customizable building block used inside a Dashboard to display specific project or section related information in a visual format.
Refreshing ensures that your dashboard displays the most up-to-date information from your projects and sections.
The Resize Widget feature allows you to adjust the size of widgets to better fit your data visualization needs.
In 5day.io, every widget supports the ability to filter data based on your specific requirements.
Widgets in 5day.io are categorized based on the type of data you visualize.
The Connect command lets you link Microsoft Teams with your 5day.io account, unlocking real-time notifications and the ability to create tasks directly from any Teams chat.
Turn any Microsoft Teams conversation into an actionable task in 5day.io - without leaving Teams.
Microsoft Teams integration connects your 5day.io account with Microsoft Teams, allowing you to bridge communication and task management in one ecosystem.
The Connect option lets you link Slack with your 5day.io account, unlocking real-time notifications and the ability to create tasks directly from any Slack channel, DM, or group chat.
Create 5day.io tasks directly from Slack - from any message, channel, or DM.
Slack integration connects your 5day.io account to Slack workspace, enabling seamless two-way sync between project updates and team communication.
How to Enable or Disable Notifications

Notifications in 5day.io let you stay in control of how and when you receive updates about your work. Whether it's task assignments, project activity, comments, or reminders — you can customize what alerts you get and where they appear (Web, Mobile, or Email).
"My Work" is your personal command center inside 5day.io.
Time entries can also be deleted directly from the task if a mistake was made or if the log is no longer relevant.

documents.t: Activity Stream is your live, chronological log of every change across Projects, Sections, Tasks, and Subtasks - showing exactly what happened, who did it, and when.
Project Activity Stream is the complete timeline of every change made directly to your Project - from settings tweaks to team updates - giving you an instant snapshot of who did what, when.
Section Activity Stream is the full timeline of every change made to a specific Section - from name tweaks to status shifts - so you always know who touched what and when inside this bucket of tasks.
Task Activity History is the complete, unfiltered log of every single thing that ever happened to a Task or Subtask - from creation to deletion - showing exactly who did what and when.
A Message in the Discussion View allows team members to share their thoughts, updates, or feedback regarding specific projects, sections, tasks, or subtasks.
A delete option allows users to remove message they have posted at the discussion.
An edit option allows users to modify the content of a message they have already posted.
In 5day.io, Discussion refers to the ability to engage in conversations, share comments, and collaborate within projects, sections, tasks, and subtasks.
5day.io offers multiple features to enhance message functionality and improve communication in discussions:
A reply is a response to an existing message, creating a thread under the original message. This allows for more detailed conversations within the same context.
To permanently delete the uploaded file from your account.
Grab the latest version instantly, whether it’s a PDF, image, or spreadsheet.
In 5day.io, Files refer to any digital documents, images, spreadsheets, PDFs, or other project-related assets that are uploaded and associated with projects, sections, tasks, or subtasks.
Attach documents, images, or spreadsheets directly to a project, section, task, subtask, or message.

Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX. tip Use the power of React to create interactive blog posts. For example, use JSX to create an interactive button: <button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button> Click me!

Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin. Here are a few tips you might find useful. Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory. Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml. The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as: 2019-05-30-welcome.md 2019-05-30-welcome/index.md A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images: The blog supports tags as well! And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.
In 5day.io, Add Workflow lets you create a new automation rule that runs automatically inside your project. One click and your team never has to remember those repetitive steps again.
You should have Edit Project permission to manage workflows in the project.

Follow these steps to create your workflow: Go to your project -> click the three dots -> Project Settings -> Workflows Click + Add Workflow Fill in the details: Field Description Name Give it a clear name like “Auto-close completed tasks” or “Alert on overdue”. Icon and Color Pick an icon and color so it’s easy to spot in the list. Description Add a short note about what this workflow does – helps teammates understand later.

This is the brain of your workflow – the exact “if this, then that” logic. Trigger (mandatory): The event that starts the workflow. Certain examples are like: Task status changed Due date passed New comment added Subtask completed. Conditions (optional): Extra checks before running. Certain examples are like: Only if Priority = High Only if Assignee = Marketing Team Only if Tags contain “urgent”. Action (mandatory): What actually happens. Certain examples are like: Change status to Done Assign to Manager Add tag “review-needed” Send notification Move to section “Section 5”. Save your workflow. Your new workflow instantly appears in the List of Workflows and starts working immediately (toggle it off anytime if you want to pause it). That’s it - one workflow, hundreds of clicks saved every week!
Delete Workflow permanently removes an automation rule from your project. Use it when a rule is outdated, duplicated, or no longer needed - keeps your list clean and tidy.
You must have Edit Project permission to delete workflows.
Open your project -> three dots -> Project Settings → Workflows Find the workflow → click the three dots (⋮) next to it Choose Delete Upon the confirmation, workflow will be deleted from project.

The workflow stops instantly - no more triggers or actions. It disappears from the List of Workflows forever. Every past run stays visible in the Activity Stream (so you still have the history). No way to recover it - deletion is permanent. Quick Note Not sure? Just toggle it to Inactive first. You can always turn it back on later. Delete only when you’re 100% sure it’s gone for good. That’s it — one click, zero clutter, happier project!

In 5day.io, Edit Workflow lets you update any existing automation rule to keep it perfectly in sync with your team’s changing process. Tweak the name, logic, or actions in seconds—changes apply instantly across the project.
You should have Edit Project permission to modify workflows in the project.

Open your project -> three dots -> Project Settings -> Workflows Find the workflow you want to change → click on Three dots -> click on Edit (pencil icon). Update whatever you need: Mark as Active/Inactive Click on Toggle button to make your workflow active/inactive. Name of Workflow Make it clearer or rename it completely. Icon and Color Change the look so it stands out better in the list. Description Add or update notes for your teammates. Define a Rule Fine-tune the logic exactly like when you created it: Trigger – change or keep what starts the workflow Conditions – add, remove, or adjust the “only if” checks Action – swap, add, or remove what happens automatically Click Save Workflow Your updated workflow takes effect immediately - no restart needed. All future triggers will follow the new rules, and every change is logged in the Activity Stream. That’s it - one quick edit keeps your project running like clockwork!
A Workflow in 5day.io is the smart rule that powers your Automation. It’s the “if this, then that” recipe you create once and let run forever inside a project.

Ends the daily grind of moving tasks, updating statuses, or chasing people. Makes your team 10x faster without extra effort. Keeps every project consistent - even when different people work on it. Turns chaos into clockwork, every single time.

Lives inside one project (keeps things clean and safe). Super-simple setup: pick a Trigger → add Conditions (optional) → choose Actions. Runs instantly and silently in the background. Logs every single move in the Activity Stream so you always know what happened. You can turn it on/off or edit it any time. In short: one Workflow = hundreds of manual clicks saved. Build a few good ones and watch your project basically run itself.

Automation in 5day.io is your team's silent superhero that handles repetitive work automatically. You set up simple rules once, and every time something happens in a project, the system does the rest—no manual clicks, no forgotten steps.

Stops tasks from falling through the cracks. Saves hours every week on boring updates. Keeps everyone in sync without endless “hey, did you…?” messages. Makes sure nothing gets missed when people are busy or on leave.

Works only inside the project where you create it. Triggers instantly when something changes (status update, new comment, due date passed, etc.). Can check extra conditions before running (“only if priority is High”). Does useful actions: change status, assign people, add tags, send notifications, move tasks. Shows exactly what it did and when in the Activity Stream. Think of it as giving your project a brain that never sleeps. You teach it your rules once, then go focus on real work while 5day.io keeps everything moving perfectly.
List of Workflows shows every automation rule you’ve created inside the your project - all in one clean screen so you can see what’s running, pause anything, or jump straight to edits.
You need Edit Project permission to view and manage the full list.

Project → three dots → Project Settings → Workflows What you’ll see for each workflow Name of Workflow The exact name you gave it. Click the name to open full details. Color and Icon The visual badge you picked - makes it dead easy to spot the right one at a glance. Active / Inactive toggle Green = Active Workflow Grey = paused/ Inactive Workflow Note: Flip the switch anytime - no editing needed Created By Who built it first. Updated By Who last touched it (plus timestamp) - perfect for “wait, who changed this?” moments. Actions (three dots menu) Edit → jump straight into changing trigger/conditions/actions. Delete → removes it forever (you’ll get a warning before delete) That’s your control center: everything in one place, zero hunting around. Turn rules on/off in a click, keep the good ones, ditch the old ones - your project stays perfectly automated without any clutter.
Actions are the “do this” part - the magic that happens automatically once your trigger + conditions say GO. One click = hundreds of manual steps saved forever.

After trigger fires -> conditions pass -> 5day.io instantly runs every action in your list (top to bottom). You can stack as many actions as you want. Actions comes with two categories: Field-update Actions Email Actions

You can set every single field that exists on tasks/subtasks Field Description Status Set a specific Status Priority Set a specific priority Budget Type Set a budget type - Billable/Non-billable Progress Set a progress Estimation Set an Estimation - Support all 5 formats Tags Add/Remove a tag Section Move to a section Assignee Add/Remove assignee Start Date Set a dynamic/custom start date Due Date Set a dynamic/custom due date

Select Email -> Send Email to create a full email that flies out. Field Description To Add single/multiple email addresses to which the email needs to be sent. Cc Add people in Cc. Subject Set a subject for an email Body Add the static & Dynamic content (your task's fields) in email body. Attachment To attach a specific file in email

Conditions are the smart filters that decide if your workflow should actually run after the trigger fires. Without them, every trigger would blindly execute actions. With them, you add precision: "Only if this AND that... OR if this other thing..."

Catch only the tasks that matter (e.g., ignore low-priority stuff). Prevent automation spam (no more 50 notifications for every tiny change). Handle complex real-world rules without creating 10 separate workflows.

After a trigger fires, 5day.io checks your conditions from left to right. AND (default between main conditions): All must be true OR (when you nest): At least one group must be true Conditions apply to the task/subtask that triggered the workflow. Nested Logic This is where it gets powerful. Click + Add Nested to create groups with OR inside AND (or vice versa): Logic Type What it means When to use Example AND (main level) All conditions must be true Strict rules Priority is High AND Assignee is Sarah OR (nested) Any one nested condition is true Flexible options Priority is Highest OR Tag contains "urgent" Nested AND/OR Mix them for pro-level control Complex scenarios (Priority High OR Tag "urgent") AND Due Date is today

Field Type Operators Examples Textbox Equal, Does not Equal, Contains, Does not Contains Task Name contains Blog Dropdown Is One Of, Is Not One Of, Equals, Not Equals, Is Empty, Is not Empty Tags Is Empty Date On or Before, On or After, Equals, Not Equals, Before, After, Is Empty, Is Not Empty Start Date is On or Before 3rd Jan 2025 Time On or Before, On or After, Equals, Not Equals, Before, After, Is Empty, Is Not Empty Time is After 3:00 PM Number Greater Than, Less Than, Greater Than or Equal, Less Than or Equal, Equals, Not Equals, Is Empty, Is Not Empty Estimation is Greater Than 5d Percentage Greater Than, Less Than, Greater Than or Equal, Less Than or Equal, Equals, Not Equals, Is Empty, Is Not Empty Progress is Greater Than 60% Conditions make your automations bulletproof. Start simple (one condition), then nest as you need more smarts.
Triggers are the starting point of every automation rule. They watch your project 24/7 and shout “GO!” the second something you care about happens.

You pick what to watch: Task only / Subtask only / Any (both) You choose when it should fire The moment that event happens -> your workflow wakes up and runs the actions Triggers fire instantly, use your project’s timezone, and never sleep.

Here’s list of triggers, you can use: Trigger What it watches Remarks Task Created When new task added Task Deleted When an existing task gets deleted Status Changes When a status of a task gets changed When a Status changes from: Choose from list of applicable status , including value - Any. Assignee Changes When an assignee gets updated, If multiple assignees are selected, adding a single assignee will trigger the Automation. Task Type Changes When task type gets changed When a task type changes from: Choose from list of applicable task types, including value - Any Budget Type Changes When budget type gets changed Tags Added When a new tag gets changed Tags Removed When an existing tag gets removed Start Date Arrives On the day of start date Due Date Arrives On the day of due date Priority Changes When priority gets changed When a priority changes from: Choose from list of applicable priorities, including value - Any Section Changes When section gets changed When a section changes from: Choose from list of applicable sections, including value - Any Progress Updated When progress is updated Estimation Updated When estimation is updated Story Point Updated When story point is updated

In 5day.io, the Clients feature allows you to manage and track the companies or organizations you are working with. Clients are maintained at the tenant level, meaning they are available across all projects within your account. Adding clients helps you: Track how many projects are associated with each client. Monitor the number of Active Projects (projects still in progress). Get a complete view of your Total Projects for each client.

In 5day.io, the Clients feature allows you to manage and track the companies or organizations you are working with. Clients are maintained at the tenant level, meaning they are available across all projects within your account. Adding clients helps you: Track how many projects are associated with each client. Monitor the number of Active Projects (projects still in progress). Get a complete view of your Total Projects for each client.
In 5day.io, you can easily create and manage clients at the account level to organize your projects better.

Go to Account Settings. Click on Clients from the sidebar. Click the + Add button at the top. In the form that appears: Enter the Client Name (mandatory). Upload a Client Logo (optional). Once you enter the details, the client will be automatically created and listed under the Clients section. ✅ The new client is now available and can be linked to one or more projects within your account.

In 5day.io, you can delete a client if it is no longer needed in your system. Steps to Delete a Client: Go to Account Settings. Click on Clients from the sidebar. You will see a list of all the clients created. Find the client you want to delete. Click on the three-dot menu (⋮) next to the client's name. Select Delete from the dropdown options. A confirmation box will appear asking for final confirmation. Click Confirm to proceed with deleting the client. Important Notes: If a client is associated with any project, it cannot be deleted. You must first remove or reassign the associated projects before deleting the client. Deleting a client is permanent and cannot be undone.
In 5day.io, you can easily edit client information, such as the client name and logo, to keep your records up to date.

Go to Account Settings. Click on Clients from the sidebar. You will see a list of all existing clients. Find the client you want to edit. To edit the Client Name: Click directly on the client’s name. The name field will become editable. Update the name as needed. To edit or change the Client Logo: Hover over the current logo. Click on Remove Logo. Once removed, an Upload Logo option will appear. Upload the new logo. ✅ Changes to the client’s name or logo are automatically saved once updated.

In 5day.io, Add Custom Field enables you to create tailored data fields to capture project-specific information beyond standard attributes. Define the field name, select its type (e.g., text, date, dropdown, etc..), and set options as needed - then save to add it instantly to the Custom Field Library.
Plan Number of Custom Fields Free 10 Growth 100
To manage the custom fields for entire organization, Account Edit permission is required. To manage the custom fields for Project , Project Edit permission is required.

There are two ways to create custom fields in 5day.io: Account Level: In 5day.io, account level custom fields are called as ‘Library of Custom Field’; which has all the fields created/used in entire account. Workspace/Project Level: Custom Fields can be created at workspace & project level; which will also be added into ‘Custom Field Library’. At workspace/project level, custom fields can be created and will be automatically added to library. Fields can be edited at this levels and that will be updated to entire account.

Click User profile icon (Bottom left panel) -> Account Settings -> Custom fields. Open list of custom fields. Click on ‘Add New’ button at top-right corner. 4. Name: Add name of custom field 5. Type: Select type of custom field; other details will vary as per type of custom field. 6. Click ‘Add Field’ button to create configured custom field in account. The new Custom Field is automatically added in your List of Custom Fields.

Click on Project where custom field needs to be added as one of the fields of project. Project -> Three dots -> Project Settings -> project Info At bottom of page, Custom Fields section will appear. Click ‘Add Custom Field’ button at top right corner of custom field section. 5. Name: Add name of custom field 6. Type: Select type of custom field; other details will vary as per type of custom field. 7. Click ‘Add Field’ button to create custom field in Project. The new Custom Field will automatically added in ‘Custom Field Library’ at account level; and it will be associated to the project.

The custom fields added under Workspace -> Task Types, will be available to all Tasks & Subatsks of the specific task type of workspace. So, basically this place will be master place where the custom fields will be added for task types. To add custom field at task type of workspace, Click on the specific workspace where you want to add custom field at Task Type. Workspace -> Three dots -> Workspace Settings -> Customization Under Customization, click on Task Types -> Specific Task Type to add custom field In Task Type, you will have a section of Custom Fields, where you can view list of all added fields. Click on ‘Add Custom Field’ button at Top right corner of custom field section 6. Name: Add name of custom field 7. Type: Select type of custom field; other details will vary as per type of custom field. 8. Click ‘Add Field’ button to create custom field in Workspace -> Task Type. The new Custom Field will automatically added in ‘Custom Field Library’ at account level; and it will be associated to the Workspace -> Task Type. The added custom field will appear under all tasks/subtasks of workspace where this task type has been used. https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7d7fc384-0009-4df9-a95b-f18d45b4df9e The added Custom Field can be viewed at Task List View Task Board View Under Customize of ‘List View’ & ‘Board View’ Under Filters & Group By in all views.
documents.s: Add custom field at Workspace -> Task Type

documents.t: The custom fields added under Project -> Task Types, will be available to all Tasks & Subatsks of the specific project's task types. To add custom field at task type of project, Click on the specific project where you want to add custom field at Task Type. Project -> Three dots -> Project Settings -> Customization Under Customization, click on Task Types -> Specific Task Type to add custom field In Task Type, you will have a section of Custom Fields, where you can view list of all added fields. Click on ‘Add Custom Field’ button at Top right corner of custom field section 6. Name: Add name of custom field 7. Type: Select type of custom field; other details will vary as per type of custom field. 8. Click ‘Add Field’ button to create custom field in Project -> Task Type. The new Custom Field will automatically added in ‘Custom Field Library’ at account level. The added custom field will appear under all tasks/subtasks of project where this task type has been used. The added Custom Field can be viewed at Task List View Task Board View Under Customize of ‘List View’ & ‘Board View’ Under Filters & Group By in all views.
documents.s: Add custom field at Project -> Task Type

documents.t: Custom field can be added directly from Project Views as well. To add custom field at task type of project, Click on the specific project where you want to add custom field at Task Type. Project -> Views (List View/Board View) -> Customize (top right corner in view) -> + New Custom Field. A pop-up will appear to add a new custom field. 6. Name: Add name of custom field 7. Type: Select type of custom field; other details will vary as per type of custom field. 8. Task Type: Select the task type for which the custom field should be associated. 9. Click ‘Add Field’ button to create custom field for Task Type. The new Custom Field will automatically added in ‘Custom Field Library’ at account level. The added custom field will appear under all tasks/subtasks of project where this task type has been used.

The availability of custom field types may vary based on your subscription. 5day.io offers below custom field types: Field Type Description Currency Allow you to input and display monetary values with automatic currency symbols and formatting, ideal for tracking budgets, expenses, or financial metrics in projects and tasks. Date Capture dates, which can be useful for tracking deadlines, milestones, or other time-sensitive information. Date & Time Allows you to specify both the date and time for a particular event or deadline, offering a high level of precision in scheduling. Dropdown Provide a predefined list of options for users to choose from, ensuring consistency in data entry. Email To store and manage email addresses relevant to tasks, projects, or team members. Multiselect Dropdown Provide a predefined list of options for users to select multiple values, ensuring consistency in data entry. Number Ideal for storing numerical data, such as cost estimates or quantities. Percentage Capture values as a proportion (e.g., 25%), perfect for progress indicators, completion rates, or allocation breakdowns in tasks. Radio Button Offer a binary choice, useful for tracking yes/no or true/false information. Rating To assign and track qualitative ratings to task, subtask and projects. It provides a subjective measure to express opinions, priorities, or levels of satisfaction. Rich Text Provides a formatted editor for multi-line content, supporting bold, italics, lists, links, images, and embeds—great for detailed notes, requirements, or specifications. Textbox Allow users to input and store alphanumeric characters. Text Area To capture, store and display extended and detailed text-based information. Time Capture time, which can be useful for tracking durations, deadlines, or scheduled time intervals. URL To include and link external web addresses or URLs.

Go to Project -> Project Settings -> Customization -> Task Type -> Custom Fields. 2. Hover over a custom field and click on more button (Three dots of custom field at the end of its name). 3. Click on Delete.
documents.s: Delete custom field for task and subtasks

documents.t: Click User profile icon (Bottom left) -> Account Settings -> Custom fields. Open list of custom fields. Hover over a Custom Field in the list and click the Delete icon. Warning Deleting a Custom Field from account level will permanently remove from entire account and the places where it is used.

In 5day.io, Edit Custom Field lets you refine any existing field’s name, type, options, or settings directly from the Custom Field Library or its associated project/workspace. Changes sync instantly across all linked tasks, subtasks, and views, ensuring data consistency without rework.

Click User profile icon (Bottom left) -> Account Settings -> Custom fields. Open list of custom fields. Select custom field which you want to edit. You can select custom field via two ways: Click on name of Custom Field to edit details of custom field. Hover over a Custom Field in the list and click the Edit icon. Edit details of Custom Fields. Click ‘Save’ to update all details.
documents.s: Edit Custom Field via Account Settings

documents.t: Go to Workspace -> Workspace Settings -> Customization -> Task Type -> Custom Fields. List of custom fields will appear. Select custom field which you want to edit. You can select custom field via two ways: Click on name of Custom Field to edit details of custom field. Hover over a Custom Field in the list and click the Edit icon. Edit details of Custom Fields. Click ‘Save’ to update all details.
documents.s: Edit Custom Field via Workspace Settings

documents.t: Go to Project -> Project Settings -> Customization -> Task Type -> Custom Fields. List of custom fields will appear. Select custom field which you want to edit. You can select custom field via two ways: Click on name of Custom Field to edit details of custom field. Hover over a Custom Field in the list and click the Edit icon. Edit details of Custom Fields. Click ‘Save’ to update all details. Warning The edited custom field will be updated to all projects, tasks and subtasks where its used.
documents.s: Edit Custom Field via Project Settings

documents.t: Custom fields are additional data fields that you can create and define based on your project's requirements. These fields can store various types of information, such as text, numbers, dates, checkboxes, and more. You can choose where to place these fields in 5day. Custom fields are stored at account level and can be used at multiple places in entire account. Custom Fields can be used to customize projects, tasks & subtasks.

Custom fields are your secret weapon for tailoring 5day.io to your exact workflow - no more forcing square pegs into round holes. They capture unique data like client codes, approval stages, or risk levels, giving every project the precision it deserves. With them, you gain deeper insights, faster decisions, and zero data gaps, turning generic tracking into a custom-fit powerhouse that scales with your team’s needs.

Flexible Types & Placement: Choose from text, dates, dropdowns, numbers, URLs, and more - place fields in projects, tasks, or subtasks exactly where you need them. Central Library with Global Sync: Create once in the Custom Field Library, use everywhere - edits update instantly across all projects and tasks. Granular Control: Add fields at account, workspace, or project; make them required, filterable, or visible in views, boards, and reports. Seamless Integration: Auto-sync with filters, group-by, list/board views, and analytics - your custom data flows effortlessly into planning and reporting.

To access all custom fields of an account Click User Icon (Bottom left panel) -> Account Settings -> Custom Fields List of all custom fields will appear; list will contain: Default custom fields offered by 5day.io. Custom fields created by your account members. List will have below details associated with it Name of Custom Field Type of Custom Field Add Custom Field, Refer ‘Add Custom Field’ for more details. Edit Custom Field, Refer ‘Edit Custom Field’ for more details. Delete Custom Field, Refer ‘Delete Custom Field’ for more details. Search Custom Field: Search any custom field via its 'Name'.

Space is the second level of organization within a Workspace. It allows you to group related Projects, Sections, Tasks, and Subtasks, making it easier to manage specific departments, teams, or focus areas under a single Workspace.
Plan Number of Space Free 5 Growth Unlimited
You can create a new space in multiple ways within 5day.io:
From top/left navigation bar, click on 'Quick Add' Select 'Space' from left bar. Create a space.
You should have a permission to access workspace settings. From left navigation bar, access your workspace -> workspace settings. Go to Spaces and Project. Click 'Add' to create a space.
Go to any of the views (List/Board View) in your account. Workspace Views Space Views Project Views Section Views Click on 'Add' button and create a space.

Field Description Icon & Color Choose a representative icon and color to visually distinguish your space Name Provide a clear and meaningful name of your space. The newly created Space will be visible in the Space List view within its parent Workspace. You can manage, update, or delete the Space based on your assigned role and permissions.
Once the space gets created, each will have a its unique ID to access directly via URL.
To modify the space later, refer to the Edit Space. To explore all created spaces, refer to the List of Spaces.

Space organizes Projects, Sections, Tasks, and Subtasks within a Workspace. Deleting a Space removes it and all its associated data, such as Projects and Tasks, from the Workspace. This action is permanent and should be performed with caution.

There are two main ways to initiate the deletion of a Space Method Navigation Path Description Workspace Settings Workspace -> Spaces -> List of Spaces -> More Menu -> Delete Delete from the central list of all Spaces within a Workspace Space View Space List or Board View -> More Menu (⋮) beside Space name -> Delete Quick access for directly deleting a specific Space.

When you select the Delete option, the following steps occur: Confirmation Prompt: You will be prompted to confirm the deletion to prevent accidental data loss. Permission Check: Only users with ‘Delete permissions’ for the Space can delete it. Data Removal: All associated Projects, Sections, Tasks, and Subtasks within the Space are permanently deleted. Quick Note Deleting a Space is irreversible. Ensure you back up any critical data before proceeding. If you need to preserve specific Projects or Tasks, consider moving them to another Space first. For more details refer Move Project.
To add a new space , refer to the Add Space. To explore all created spaces, refer to the List of Spaces.

Once a Space is created in 5day.io, users with the appropriate permissions can edit the Space to configure its structure, and settings. Editing a Space helps maintain the accuracy, flexibility, and scalability of your Space organization.

There are two main ways to open the Edit Space panel Method Navigation Path Description Space Settings Workspace -> Spaces -> List of Spaces -> Edit Edit from the central list of all Spaces within a Workspace Space View Space List or Board View -> More Menu (⋮) beside Space name Quick access for directly editing a specific Space

When you access the Edit option, you can perform the following actions depending on your permissions: Update Space Details: Modify the Space name, icon, or color. Add Project: Add a new Project within the Space. For more details refer Add Project Delete Space: Delete selected space. For more details refer Delete Space
To add a new space , refer to the Add Space. To explore all created spaces, refer to the List of Spaces.

Spaces are the second level in the 5day.io structure, sitting within a Workspace. They act as containers for Projects, Sections, Tasks, and Subtasks, allowing you to organize work by department, team, or specific focus area. Spaces help you streamline collaboration and manage distinct areas of your organization efficiently. For example, within a Workspace representing your organization, you might create Spaces for departments like “Marketing,” “Engineering,” or “HR.” Each Space can then house relevant Projects and tasks tailored to that department’s goals. Quick Note When you create a Workspace, you can start adding Spaces immediately. Each Space is independent within its Workspace, and data like tasks or reports cannot be shared between Spaces.

A Space can help you: Organize Projects and tasks by team, department, or objective. Provide clarity by separating unrelated workstreams. Enable focused collaboration within specific areas of your Workspace.

Project Grouping: House multiple Projects under a single Space for better organization. Customized Access: Assign team members to specific Spaces with defined roles (e.g., Viewer, Editor). Navigation: Easily switch between Spaces within a Workspace using the sidebar.
List of Spaces gives you a single, clean screen showing every Space inside the current Workspace - perfect for jumping in, reordering, or managing access in seconds.
Go to Workspace -> three dots -> Spaces and Projects OR Go to Workspace Views -> List/Board View -> List of Spaces and its associated projects will appear.

Field Description Icon & Color Choose a representative icon and color to visually distinguish your space Name Provide a clear and meaningful name of your space. Count of Projects Provides total count of projects associated to space.
Drag-and-drop to reorder (visual hierarchy matters!) Click any Space name → instantly load its Space View (List or Board) Search bar -> To search a specific section. Filter by owner or project count.
To add a new space , refer to the Add Space. To explore all created spaces, refer to the List of Spaces.

In 5day.io, a Space is a unit nested within a Workspace - typically used to group related projects, departments, or modules. Just like Workspace, Space management is governed by user roles and their associated permission sets. These permissions ensure the right people have the right level of access, from visibility to full management rights, over each Space within a Workspace.

Permission Type Description View Controls which space user can view in the workspace. Add Controls whether user is allowed to create new space. Edit Controls the ability to manage and update space. Delete Controls the ability to delete space. Each of these permissions has granular levels like All, Own, Related, or None depending on how much access a user should have.

Permission Level Description All Applies to all spaces in the workspace, regardless of ownership or membership. Related Applies to all the associated project's spaces where user is either the project owner or a project member. None The user does not have any access for the selected action

| Type | All | Related | None | |--|--| -- | -- | -- | | View | Can view all spaces in the workspace| Can view only project associated spaces where you are either project owner or project member | | Add | Can create new space| - | Cannot create new space| | Edit | Can edit all spaces| Can edit project associated spaces where you are either project owner or project member | Cannot edit any space| | Delete | Can delete any space in workspace| Can delete project associated spaces where you are either project owner or project member | Cannot delete any space. | Note: “Space Edit” permission grants access to modify the core settings of a Projects, including timesheets, workflows, and task types.

Account Owner or Admins should have All permissions for full control. Department heads or project managers can be given Related permissions based on their roles in organization. General team members should typically have None for sensitive actions like editing or deleting workspaces. Ensure only limited users have Delete permissions to prevent accidental data loss.

The Space Views provide a centralized interface to access and manage all Projects within a specific Space, organized under their parent Workspace. Available to all accounts regardless of subscription plan. Space Views offer two display options - List View and Board View - to suit different workflow preferences. This guide explains how to access and use these views to navigate, organize, and customize your Space data.

To access the Space Views, follow these steps: After Login -> Navigate to Projects: Click the Project icon in the primary panel. Structure View: Displays a list of all Workspaces in the secondary panel, with the hierarchy data (Spaces, Projects, Sections, Tasks, Subtasks) of the first Workspace loaded in the Right Panel. Structure View -> Select a Space: You will be redirected to a list of all Projects of the first Space within the selected Workspace, organized by their hierarchy (Space > Project). Load Space Views: Upon selecting a Space in Structure View, the Right Panel will load the Space View, with List View as the default.
Space Views offer two display modes: List View and Board View. Both views provide identical functionality, differing only in their visual presentation.
List View displays Projects in a structured, hierarchical list within the selected Space. Each Project is accessible with a single click, providing a clear and compact overview.

Board View presents Projects as visual cards on a Kanban-style board within the selected Space. Each card represents a Project and can be clicked to access its details, offering an interactive and visual workflow.

Feature Description Add Add a new Project directly from the view. Click the “+ Add” icon next to the Space. Refer: Add Project Guide Search Search for a specific Project by its ID or Name using the search bar at the top. Filter Apply filters to display specific datasets (e.g., Projects by owner, Budget Type, or Clients). Click the filter icon to select criteria. Sort Sort the list of Projects by parameters like name, date, or number of tasks. Click the sort icon to choose options. Group By Group Projects by criteria such as client, or budget type. Select “Group By” from the view options. Customize By default, completed (Done) Projects are hidden. Enable the “Show Completed Projects” option in the customize menu to display them. Quick Note Features like search, filter, sort, and group by are applied to the current view and reset when you switch Workspace.
To add a new space , refer to the Add Space. To explore all created spaces, refer to the List of Spaces.

In 5day.io, Add Subtask lets you break any Task into smaller, actionable steps. Open a Task, click + Add Subtask, enter a concise title, and set assignee, due date, or notes as needed. Your Subtask instantly nests under the parent task.
Subtask is available in all subscription plans. Subscription Plan Plan Number of Task Free 1000 Growth Unlimited
Users must have Add Task permission to add new task or subtask. If not allowed, the system will restrict task creation actions. Refer Roles and Permission for more details.

Before creating or managing subtasks, ensure the Subtask feature is enabled at the Project. Navigate to: Project Settings → Features → Subtask. Toggle ON to activate the subtask functionality. Once the feature is enabled, subtasks can be created in the following ways:

If a task does not have subtasks so far: Hover over the task to reveal the Add Subtask icon. Click the icon, enter the title of the subtask, and it will be created. If a task already have subtasks: A subtask icon with a count will appear beside the task. Click the icon to view the existing list of subtasks. Click ‘Add Subtask’ at the bottom of the list to create a new one. Subtask creation follows the same flow as creating a main task (Title mandatory; optional fields can be filled as needed).

Two ways are available inside the Task Details panel: Through More Menu Click on the More icon from the Task Details panel/List View Task Row/Board View Task Card. Select Add Subtask from the dropdown menu. You will be redirected to the Subtask list view. Enter the title for the subtask and it will be created. Through Subtask Tab Open the Task Details panel. Navigate to the Subtasks tab. Click ‘Add Subtask’ at the bottom. Enter the title and create the subtask seamlessly. Both options offer an easy and fast way to manage your subtasks within the parent task structure.

All fields available in a subtask are identical to a main task. For detailed field descriptions, refer Task Details. ⚡ Tip: In 5day.io, you cannot create a subtask under another subtask. Subtasks are always one level beneath a main task to keep project hierarchies clean, manageable, and organized.
To modify the Subtask, refer Edit Subtask. To explore all subtasks of main task, refer List of Subtasks.

In 5day.io, Add Task lets you instantly create a new unit of work within any project. Simply click + Add Task, enter a clear title, and optionally set assignee, due date, priority, and labels. Your Task is live in seconds - ready for Subtasks, tracking, and team collaboration.
Task is available in all subscription plans. Subscription Plan Plan Number of Task Free 1000 Growth Unlimited
Users must have Add Task permission to add new task or subtask. If not allowed, the system will restrict task creation actions. Refer Roles and Permission for more details.
5day.io offers multiple flexible ways to add tasks:

Quick Add is a fast-access creation method available from the primary navigation panel. Steps to create task Click on the Quick Add (+) icon. Select Task. Fill in the required fields: Task Name and Location Fill optional details if needed (Priority, Tags, Assignees, etc.). Click on Add.
Navigate to a project or section's List View. Click Add Task at the top or within a group. Provide a Task Title and press Enter or Save. Task is created immediately.

Navigate to a project or section's Board View. Select the column (default - status) you want to add a task to. Click + Add Task Provide a Task Title and press Enter or Save. Task is created immediately.
Within a project or section page, use the standard Add button. This method works the same way as Quick Add.

Tasks can be created in bulk by Importing an Excel file. Navigate to the Import Tasks option. Upload the formatted file and map fields as needed. Refer to the Import Task Help Guide for step-by-step instructions.
Tasks can also be created directly from the My Work page. Click Add Button and follow the same steps (Title, Location).
To modify the task, refer Edit Task. To explore all tasks, refer List of Tasks.

Bulk Update lets you select up to 50 Tasks (or Subtasks) at once and change one field across all of them in a single click - saving hours on repetitive edits like updating status, assignee, or priority for an entire project.

You should have Edit Permission in Task under Roles and Permission. Below are further details on Edit permission. Permission Level Description All Applies to all tasks in the project, regardless of ownership. Own Applies only to tasks where user is Owner. Related Applies to tasks in which user is added as Project Owner or Project member None The user does not have any access for the selected action

In List View or Board View: -> Click the checkbox next to each Task -> Max 50: system warns if you try more. For Subtasks: Switch to "Show subtasks as separate tasks" mode first (Project Views -> Customization)
Once tasks are selected -> a black bar slides up from the bottom Shows: “X Tasks selected” + buttons for quick actions

Click Edit in the action bar → pick one field to change (e.g., Status, Assignee, Priority, Tags, Due Date, etc..) Set the new value → Apply to All Instant: All selected Tasks update simultaneously - no refresh needed

Field Description Status To update the status in bulk Assignee To add assignee in all selected tasks in bulk Move To move all selected tasks to different project or section Duplicate To duplicate all selected tasks Reschedule To change start and due date of all selected tasks Priority To change priority of all selected tasks Tags To add tags to all selected tasks Estimation To update the estimation to all selected tasks Story Point To update story points to all selected tasks Link To add a reference of a task/subtask as a link to all selected tasks Custom Field To update values of custom field in all selected tasks; supported field types are - Dropdown, Radio Button, Checkbox, Date, Date-Time, Time, Email, URL, Number, Percentage, Currency, Rating Delete To permanently delete all selected tasks
To create a new task, refer Add Task. To create a new subtask, refer Add Subtask.

Deleting a subtask in 5day.io allows users to permanently remove unwanted or incorrect records from their project. Deletion ensures that the subtask is no longer accessible or recoverable once removed. This action is irreversible, so it should be performed cautiously. Both tasks and subtasks have similar deletion processes and are governed by permission settings..

Deleting tasks depends on the permission set assigned to the user: Delete All: User can delete any subtask across the project. Delete Owned: User can delete only subtasks where they are assigned. Delete Related: User can delete subtasks where they are a project owner or member. Delete None: User is restricted from deleting any subtask.
There are multiple ways to delete a Subtask:
Hover over a subtask row/card. Click on the three dots (More option) icon. A dropdown menu will appear. Click Delete from the menu. Confirm deletion to permanently remove the subtask.
Open the subtask you want to delete. On the top-right corner of the Subtask Details page, click the three dots (More menu). Select Delete from the options. Confirm deletion to complete the action.

Navigate to: Task Details → Subtasks Tab → Subtask List. Locate the subtask you want to delete. Click the More option (three dots) beside the subtask. Select Delete Subtask. Confirm deletion to remove the subtask permanently. Quick Note Always double-check before deleting, as this action is irreversible.
To add new subtask, refer Add Subtask. To view all subtask, refer List of subtask.

Deleting a task in 5day.io allows users to permanently remove unwanted or incorrect records from their project. Deletion ensures that the task is no longer accessible or recoverable once removed. This action is irreversible, so it should be performed cautiously. Both tasks and subtasks have similar deletion processes and are governed by permission settings..

Deleting tasks depends on the permission set assigned to the user: Delete All: User can delete any task/subtask across the project. Delete Owned: User can delete only tasks/subtasks where they are assigned. Delete Related: User can delete tasks/subtasks where they are a project owner or member. Delete None: User is restricted from deleting any tasks or subtasks.
There are multiple ways to delete a task:
Hover over a task row/card. Click on the three dots (More option) icon. A dropdown menu will appear. Click Delete from the menu. Confirm deletion to permanently remove the task.

Open the task you want to delete. On the top-right corner of the task Details page, click the three dots (More menu). Select Delete from the options. Confirm deletion to complete the action. Quick Note Always double-check before deleting, as this action is irreversible.
To add new task, refer Add Task. To edit task, refer Edit Task.
Duplicate Task creates an exact copy of any Task (with Subtasks, files, and settings) in one click - perfect for reusing templates, repeating sprints, or cloning client deliverables.
You need Edit task permission in the source Project and Add task permission in the target Project/Section.
Select a Task → click three dots → Duplicate To duplicate multiple tasks -> Select tasks -> Bulk Action Bar -> duplicate, all selected Tasks gets duplicated together in one click.
Open Task -> Task Details panel (right side) -> click three dots (top-right) -> Duplicate

Go to My Work -> find your Task -> click three dots -> Duplicate Works across all your Projects of workspace. Quick Note Task can be duplicated within Projects of same workspace. Task cannot be duplicated to other workspace. Subtask can be duplicated to same task only.

On clicking Duplicate, a smart panel opens: Field Description Task Name Auto-filled with “Copy of [Original Name]” — editable before saving Location Choose: Same Project & Section (default) OR Any other Section OR Any other Project in the Workspace Copy Options Check on/off exactly what to bring over: Subtasks, assignee, priority, tags, discussions, dates, attachments, links Instant: New duplicated task appears immediately — no refresh. Full fidelity: All copied data stays linked (e.g., file attachments, discussion threads). History not copied: Activity Stream starts fresh on the duplicate task. Subtasks included: If checked, they duplicate with same nesting and settings. Duplicate Subtask: The subtask can be duplicated in the same task.
To create a new task, refer Add Task. To create a new subtask, refer Add Subtask.
Edit Subtask lets you update any field on a Subtask - from title to due date - keeping the parent Task in perfect sync without extra clicks.

You should have Edit Permission in Task under Roles and Permission. Below are further details on Edit permission. Permission Level Description All Applies to all tasks in the project, regardless of ownership. Own Applies only to tasks where user is Owner. Related Applies to tasks in which user is added as Project Owner or Project member None The user does not have any access for the selected action

Method Ways to Edit List View - Columns Go to Project/Section -> Find your subtask in list view -> Go to the column which you want to edit -> type or pick new value -> hit Enter Board View - Cards Go to Project/Section -> Find your subtask in board view -> Go to the field which you want to edit -> type or pick new value -> hit Enter Task Details View Go to Project/Section -> Find your task in view OR Search your subtask via ID/Name from Global Search -> Click on task -> Task Details will open -> Go to Subtasks -> List of all subtasks will appear -> Select your specific subtask -> Opens Subtask details view -> type or pick new value -> hit Enter Bulk Update Go to Project/Section -> Select multiple subtasks -> Choose the field which you would like to edit -> type or pick new value My Work Go to My Work -> Find your subtask in list view -> Go to the column which you want to edit or click on subtask -> type or pick new value -> hit Enter Quick Notes Auto sync: All updates will be saved instantly; no manual Save required.
To create a new task, refer Add Task. To create a new subtask, refer Add Subtask.
Edit Task lets you update any field on a Task or Subtask - from status to due date - keeping everything in sync without opening extra windows.

You should have Edit Permission in Task under Roles and Permission. Below are further details on Edit permission. Permission Level Description All Applies to all tasks in the project, regardless of ownership. Own Applies only to tasks where user is Task Owner. Related Applies to tasks in which user is added as Project Owner or Project member None The user does not have any access for the selected action

Method Ways to Edit List View - Columns Go to Project/Section -> Find your task in list view -> Go to the column which you want to edit -> type or pick new value -> hit Enter Board View - Cards Go to Project/Section -> Find your task in board view -> Go to the field which you want to edit -> type or pick new value -> hit Enter Task Details View Go to Project/Section -> Find your task in view OR Search your task via ID/Name from Global Search -> Click on task -> Task Details will open -> Edit the task Bulk Update Go to Project/Section -> Select multiple tasks -> Choose the field which you would like to edit -> type or pick new value My Work Go to My Work -> Find your task in list view -> Go to the column which you want to edit or click on task -> type or pick new value -> hit Enter Quick Notes Auto sync: All updates will be saved instantly; no manual Save required.
To create a new task, refer Add Task To edit subtask, refer Edit Subtask

In 5day.io, a Subtask is a smaller actionable item that breaks down a main task into manageable steps. It helps organize and track progress at a finer level. Subtasks inherit most of their characteristics from the parent task and maintain close association with it. Subtasks can be assigned individually, prioritized, and tracked separately. However, subtasks cannot have their own subtasks - they are always one level below the main task. This enables clear hierarchy and simple task organization without overcomplication.

Subtasks are the secret sauce that turns big, intimidating Tasks into bite-sized wins - making progress feel real and momentum unstoppable. Here’s why they’re a game-changer in 5day.io: Breaks Down Complexity: A Task like “Launch Website” sounds scary - Subtasks turn it into “Design homepage → Write copy → Test on mobile,” so nothing feels overwhelming. Boosts Clarity & Ownership: Each Subtask can be assigned to a specific person with a clear deadline, so everyone knows exactly what they’re responsible for - no more “I thought you were doing that.” Enables Parallel Work: Subtasks let teams move fast in sync, without stepping on toes. Improves Accuracy in Tracking: See real-time progress roll up to the parent Task.

5day.io Subtasks are lightweight but mighty, packed with smart features to keep execution smooth and satisfying: Nested Hierarchy: Live directly under a parent Task - drag, drop, indent, or outdent with one click to restructure on the fly. Independent Assignment & Due Dates: Assign a Subtask to a different person than the parent Task, set unique deadlines, and get personal reminders - perfect for cross-functional handoffs. Status & Progress Sync: Mark Subtasks as To Do, In Progress, or Done - watch completion percentages. Comments & Attachments: Discuss, @mention, or attach files per Subtask - keep context close to the action, no digging through endless threads. Time Tracking: Log time spent on individual Subtasks for accurate effort reporting - great for client billing or personal productivity insights. Bulk Actions: Select multiple Subtasks to update status, reassign, or delete in one go - save clicks, crush repetition. Roll-Up Reporting: Subtask data feeds directly into Task analytics - see who’s overloaded, what’s delayed, and what’s crushing it - all in one dashboard. Subtasks aren’t just smaller Tasks - they’re precision tools for focus, flow, and flawless delivery. Use them well, and you’ll wonder how you ever managed without them.

In 5day.io, a Task represents a unit of work that needs to be completed within a project. Tasks help organize and prioritize project activities effectively. A Subtask is a smaller actionable item under a Task, designed to break down larger tasks into manageable steps for easier tracking and execution. Both Tasks and Subtasks are important elements for efficient project management, enabling users to divide, assign, and monitor the work across different levels.

Tasks are the backbone of any successful project in 5day.io, serving as the foundational building blocks that transform high-level project goals into actionable reality. Here's why they matter: Clarity and Focus: In a fast-paced work environment, Tasks provide a clear roadmap, helping teams understand exactly what needs to be done, by when, and by whom - reducing confusion and preventing scope creep. Prioritization and Efficiency: By assigning due dates, dependencies, and priorities, Tasks ensure critical work gets attention first, allowing teams to allocate resources wisely and hit deadlines without burnout. Accountability and Collaboration: Tasks foster ownership - whether solo or team-based - making it easy to delegate, track progress, and celebrate wins, which boosts morale and strengthens team dynamics. Scalability for Growth: As projects evolve, Tasks enable seamless scaling; what starts as a simple to-do can expand into subtasks, keeping everything organized even as complexity increases. In essence, without Tasks, projects risk becoming chaotic wish lists. They empower users to execute with precision, turning ambition into measurable results and driving overall productivity sky-high.

5day.io's Tasks are designed with intuitive, powerful features to streamline your workflow. Here are the standout ones: Creation and Customization: Easily create Tasks with rich details like descriptions, attachments, labels, and custom fields - tailor them to fit your project's unique needs right from the start. Assignment and Collaboration: Assign Tasks to individuals or teams, set permissions for editing/viewing, and enable real-time message or @mentions for seamless feedback loops and issue resolution. Progress Tracking: Use built-in status updates (e.g., To Do, In Progress, Done), time estimates, and automated notifications to monitor completion rates and spot bottlenecks early. Integration with Subtasks: Break down any Task into nested Subtasks for granular control, with roll-up reporting that shows how subtasks contribute to the parent Task's overall progress. Reporting and Analytics: Generate insights like completion timelines, workload distribution, and performance metrics—exportable for stakeholder updates or retrospectives. These features make Tasks not just a tool, but a smart companion that adapts to your rhythm, saving time and amplifying impact.
List of Subtasks displays every Subtask linked to a parent Task in a clear, expandable view - so you can track progress, assign owner, and manage small steps without leaving the main Task.
You should have ** View Permission** to view all the subtasks associated to a task.

Open any Task -> Task Details panel (right side) Click the Subtasks tab All subtasks appear in a full list -> regardless of status (New, In Progress, Done) Best for deep management: add, reorder, bulk edit, or open full subtask details.

Each Task row shows a Subtask icon; when it has subtasks associated. Click the icon -> expand to show the List of Subtasks To include/exclude Completed subtasks: -> Click three dots (top-right of the view) -> turn on Show completed subtasks

Each Task card shows a Subtask icon; when it has subtasks associated. Click the icon -> expand to show the List of Subtasks To include/exclude Completed subtasks: -> Click three dots (top-right of the view) -> turn on Show completed subtasks

If "Show subtasks as separate tasks" is enabled in Project/section views settings (three dots beside group by) -> All subtasks appear as independent rows/cards in List View and Board View -> No need to expand — they live alongside regular Tasks -> Still linked to parent Enable it: List/Board View Settings -> More Icon (three dots beside group by) -> toggle Show subtasks as separate tasks
documents.s: Show Subtasks as Separate Tasks (List View/Board View Settings)

documents.t: To create a new task, refer Add Task. To create a new subtask, refer Add Subtask.
Move Task lets you instantly relocate any Task to a different Section or even a different Project - keeping history, files, and automations fully intact.

You should have Edit Permission in Task under Roles and Permission. Below are further details on Edit permission. Permission Level Description All Applies to all tasks in the project, regardless of ownership. Own Applies only to tasks where user is Task Owner. Related Applies to tasks in which user is added as Project Owner or Project member None The user does not have any access for the selected action
Select a Task → click three dots → Move To move multiple tasks -> Select tasks -> Bulk Action Bar -> Move, All selected Tasks move together in one click.
Open Task -> Task Details panel (right side) -> click three dots (top-right) -> Move

Go to My Work -> find your Task -> click three dots -> Move Works across all your Projects of workspace. Quick Note Task can be moved within Projects of same workspace. Task cannot be moved to other workspace.
To create a new task, refer Add Task. To create a new subtask, refer Add Subtask.

In 5day.io, task management capabilities are controlled through user roles and permission sets. These define what each user can view, create, edit, or delete in the project environment. Understanding these permissions ensures the right level of control is maintained across different user roles — such as Admins, Managers, or Collaborators — while keeping the project secure and structured.

Permission Type Description View Controls which tasks user can view in the project. Add Controls whether user is allowed to create new task. Edit Controls the ability to manage and update task. Delete Controls the ability to delete task. Each of these permissions has granular levels like All, Own, Related, or None depending on how much access a user should have.

Permission Level Description All Applies to all tasks in the project, regardless of ownership. Own Applies only to tasks where user is Task Owner. Related Applies to tasks in which user is added as Project Owner or Project member None The user does not have any access for the selected action

Type All Own Related None View Can view all tasks in the project - Can view only tasks where user is task owner - Add Can create new task - - Cannot create new task Edit Can edit all tasks Can edit only task where user is task owner Can edit tasks where user is project owner or project member Cannot edit any task Delete Can delete any task Can delete only tasks where user is task owner Can delete tasks where user is project owner or project member Cannot delete any task Note: “Task Edit” permission grants access to modify all the details associated to task and subtask.

Account Owner or Admins should have All permissions for full control. Department heads or project managers can be given Edit - Related permissions based on their roles in organization. General team members should typically have Edit - Own for sensitive actions like editing or deleting workspaces. Ensure only limited users have Delete permissions to prevent accidental data loss.

The Assignee field in 5day.io helps identify the person responsible for completing a task or subtask. Assigning tasks ensures clarity of responsibility, improves collaboration, and provides better visibility across the team. When a task or subtask is assigned, the user is notified and can easily track it under My Work or the respective project views. In 5day.io, a task can be assigned to a single person or to multiple people if the project setting Multiple Assignee is enabled. Subtasks, however, can be assigned to only one person. Before assigning, the user must be part of the project.
Assignment of tasks and subtasks is controlled through the Edit Task permission set Refer to Roles and Permission for more details.

Open the task or subtask you want to assign. In 5day.io, tasks can be assigned to multiple people if the Multiple Assignee feature is enabled at Project Settings → Feature → Multiple Assignee. If the feature is not enabled, a task can be assigned to a single person only. Subtasks can always be assigned to a single person only. A user must be part of the project team before being assigned.

Task/Subtask Details Open the Task or Subtask Details panel. Locate the Assignee field. Click on ‘+ Add’ button; a list of project members will appear. Select one or multiple people (based on feature availability). Once selected, they will be assigned and notified. List View / Board View​ Make sure the view is not grouped by Assignee. If the Assignee field is not available, click Customize, enable Assignee, and adjust the display order as needed. Save the view. Click on Assignee/Add Assignee field against the task/subtask. Select users to assign. My Work​ Navigate to My Work. Click on a task to open the Task Details page. Click on the Assignee field to select users. Assigned users will be notified accordingly. Bulk Update​ Select multiple tasks or subtasks you wish to update. Click on the Bulk Update bar that appears. Choose the Assignee field. Select the users from the list. Update assignees for all selected tasks/subtasks in one go. Quick Add (While Creating a Task)​ During task creation via Quick Add, after filling Name and Location, you can assign users immediately. Select from the list of available people. Assigned users will be notified once the task is created.
documents.s: Ways to Assign or Update Assignee

documents.t: Task/Subtask Details​ Hover over the assigned user’s image in the Assignee field. A Remove icon will appear at the top right corner. Click to remove the assigned user. List View / Board View​ Click on the Assignee field for the task/subtask. A list of assigned users with a Remove option will appear. Remove users one by one or all at once. Quick Note Tasks can be assigned to multiple people if the Multiple Assignee feature is enabled. Subtasks can only be assigned to one person. Make sure the person is part of the project team before assigning.
To explore about statuses, refer Task Status. To explore about estimation, refer Task Estimation.

The Budget Type allows to classify each task and subtask as either Billable or Non-billable. This classification plays a key role in tracking and managing project costs, billing cycles, and productivity. Budget Type helps ensure that the time logged against tasks is categorized appropriately, offering better financial insights and reporting accuracy. It provides clarity on which efforts are chargeable to clients and which are internal or overhead efforts.
This feature is available in all subscription plans.
The Budget Type can be edited only by users who have appropriate Task Edit Permissions, based on their roles. Refer Roles and Permission for more details.

To access the Budget Type field, the feature must be enabled at the project - Project Settings -> Features -> Enable 'Budget Type' Once enabled, each task and subtask will display a Budget Type field. Available values are: Billable Non-billable Only one value can be selected at a time. The default value of each task and subtask is inherited from the Project Budget Type setting. Below are the ways to access Budget Type for Task & Subtasks:
Open the task or subtask. Locate the Budget Type field. Click the field and select the desired value (Billable or Non-billable).

Make sure Group By is not set to Budget Type. If Budget Type is not visible: Click on Customize. Find and enable the Budget Type field. Optionally, adjust its display position via drag and drop. Once added, the field will appear in the view. You can click and update the value directly. Save the view to retain settings.
Go to My Work. Open the required task/subtask. Locate and update the Budget Type field.
While using the Quick Add function to create a new task: After entering the task name and location, access the Budget Type field. Select Billable or Non-billable as required.
To explore about statuses, refer Task Status. To explore about Assignee, refer Task Assignee.

Start Date and Due Date are essential scheduling attributes in 5day.io that define the planned timeline for a task or subtask. The Start Date indicates when work is expected to begin, while the Due Date represents the target completion deadline. These dates help teams plan, prioritize, and execute work more effectively. Each task and subtask comes with its own independent date range. Dates play a vital role in generating views, filters, workload balancing, and time-sensitive reports across the system. They also directly influence status indicators like Overdue.
