The ability to assign or edit dates is governed by the Edit Task permission set: Edit All – User can assign/change dates for any task or subtask. Edit Owned – User can manage dates only for tasks/subtasks they own. Edit Related – User can update dates for tasks within their associated projects. Edit None – User cannot add or modify dates. Refer Roles and Permission for more details.

Every task and subtask in 5day.io includes Start Date and Due Date as default fields. These fields are non-removable and are part of the core task framework. The date format displayed is based on user preference and can be configured via: My Profile → Display Settings → Date Format. Dates are validated automatically: Due Date cannot be earlier than Start Date. It’s recommended to align task dates within the parent project’s date range for consistency.
Open a Task or Subtask Details. Locate the Start Date and Due Date fields. Select dates using the system calendar and save the task.

If dates are not visible in the selected view, click Customize. Enable Start Date and Due Date from the list of fields. Reorder fields using drag and drop, then save the view. Click into the field to select and assign a date.
Navigate to My Work. Select the task you wish to update. In the detail view, add or update Start Date and Due Date accordingly.

Select multiple tasks/subtasks in list or board view. Click Bulk Update from the action toolbar. Choose either Start Date or Due Date as required. Apply the date; all selected tasks/subtasks will be updated with that value.
While creating a new task, after adding name and location, locate the Date field. Select the Start Date and Due Date from the date picker.
Note: Start Date and Due Date cannot be entirely removed, but values can be cleared.
Open the task/subtask and clear the existing date from the field.
Click into the date field and clear the selection if previously added.
Access the task from My Work and remove the date fields by clearing their content.

A task or subtask is considered Overdue when the Due Date has passed, and the item is not marked as Completed. Generic Points If a task’s Due Date has passed and its status is still Open, In Progress, or any other non-final state, the system will automatically tag it as Overdue. This tag will be visible across the platform in: List View Board View Task/Subtask Detail View My Work (Refer to the “My Work” help guide for details on filtering Overdue items.) Quick Notes Due Date cannot be earlier than Start Date. For effective planning, align task dates with their parent project’s timeline. Tasks with missed Due Dates that are not marked as Completed will automatically reflect Overdue status. Other References​

Once the user accesses a task in 5day.io, a detailed panel opens on the right side of the screen. This panel contains complete information about the task/subtask and allows users to view and edit details depending on their permission level. Please Roles and Permission to Edit Task & Subtask The Task Details Panel is divided into three major sections:

The Task Header provides instant context with task location, overdue alerts, editable title, expand/collapse controls, a More actions menu and a close button to exit the panel. Field Description Task Location Displays the project and section where the task is located. Helps users know where the task belongs. Overdue If the due date has passed and the task is not completed, an overdue icon will be shown. Title Displays the title of the task/subtask. The title can be edited if permission allows. Expand/Collapse Allows the task panel to be expanded to full screen or collapsed for easier navigation. More Provides access to additional actions like Duplicate Task, Move Task, Delete Task, etc. Close Closes the Task Details Panel and returns to the previous view.

The Task Details Tabs organize everything in one place - edit core fields in Task Details, manage Subtasks, discuss in Discussion, attach files in Files, and review full history in Activity Stream. Tab Description Task Details Displays and allows editing of the core fields of the task (description, status, dates, assignees, etc.). Subtasks View and manage the list of subtasks associated with the main task. Refer ‘Subtask’ for more details. Discussion Collaborate by adding comments, notes, or important discussions related to the task. Refer ‘Discussion’ for more details. Files Manage files and attachments related to the task. Refer ‘Files’ for more details Activity Stream Displays the activity history such as status changes, edits, comments, and file uploads. Refer ‘Activity Stream’ for more details.

Task Fields let you define every detail of task - all editable based on permissions. Field Description Task Description Add or update the detailed information regarding the task. Status Current status of the task (e.g., Active, Completed, On Hold). Refer ‘Status’ for more details. Progress Shows task completion percentage based on manual update. Refer ‘Progress’ for more details. Assignee List of people assigned to work on the task. Refer ‘Assignee’ for more details. Start Date The date when the task is scheduled to start. Refer ‘Dates’ for more details. Due Date The deadline date by which the task needs to be completed. Refer ‘Dates’ for more details. Tags Custom labels to categorize or filter tasks easily. Refer ‘Tags’ for more details. Estimation The estimated time (HH:MM) needed to complete the task. Refer ‘Estimation’ for more details. Section The section within the project where the task is organized. Refer ‘Section’ for more details. Priority Priority level assigned to the task (e.g., Highest, High, Medium, Low). Refer ‘Priority’ for more details. Task Type Type of task such as Enhancement, Bug, Feature, etc. Refer ‘Task Type’ for more details. Story Point Used mainly in Agile projects to estimate the effort required. Refer ‘Story Points’ for more details. Budget Type Categorizes task as Billable/None-billable. Refer ‘Budget Type’ for more details. Link A system-generated direct link to share the task. Refer ‘Link’ for more details.
To add new task, refer Add Task To edit task, refer Edit Task

Estimation in 5day.io helps in defining the expected effort required to complete a task or subtask. It is a numeric value based on selected time units and serves as a planning tool for better workload management, tracking, and forecasting. Estimation values are individual for tasks and subtasks and are not interlinked. You can configure different duration formats based on your preference. This allows teams to plan and distribute their work more efficiently and transparently across the project.

Assignment of estimation values is controlled through the Edit Task permission set: Edit All – User can set estimation for any task or subtask. Edit Owned – User can set estimation for tasks/subtasks they own. Edit Related – User can set estimation for tasks/subtasks related to their projects. Edit None – User cannot set or modify estimations. Refer to the Permission Set Guide for more details.

To enable the Estimation field for tasks and subtasks, the Time Estimates feature must be turned on at Project Settings → Features → Time Estimates. Once enabled, the estimation field becomes available for all tasks and subtasks. Estimation can be added and viewed in different formats, which can be configured from My Profile → Display Settings → Duration Format. Supported Duration Formats: Clock (hh:mm) – Display estimation as hours and minutes format, e.g., 02:30. Days (dd.dd) – Display estimation in decimal format of days, e.g., 1.50 days. Days, Hours, Minutes – Break estimation into days, hours, and minutes separately. Hours (hh.hh) – Display estimation in decimal format of hours, e.g., 5.75 hours. Hours, Minutes – Display estimation specifically in hours and minutes fields. The selected format applies across all views where estimation is used.

5day.io also provides flexibility where, if a task is assigned to multiple people, estimation can vary individually for each assignee. To enable this, turn on the Assignee Wise Estimation feature from Project Settings → Features → Assignee Wise Estimation. Once enabled, the system will ask for handling already created tasks: Split the estimation equally – Divides existing estimations equally among all assignees. Disable equal division – Keeps current estimations unchanged; users can manually configure later. Going forward: You can configure a different estimation value for each user assigned to a task. If needed, you can choose not to apply assignee-wise estimation at the individual task level by disabling the Estimates by Person option during editing. This provides complete flexibility to manage estimations either collectively or individually based on project needs.
Open the Task or Subtask Details panel. Locate the Estimation field. Add a value as per your selected duration format.

If the Estimation field is not visible, click on Customize. Find and enable the Estimation field and adjust the display order if needed. Save the view. Click on the Estimation field for the task/subtask. Add a value as per the selected format.
Navigate to My Work. Click on the task to open the Task Details page. Add the estimation value accordingly.

Select multiple tasks/subtasks where estimation needs to be added. The Bulk Update option will appear. Click on Estimation. Enter the desired estimation value. The value will be applied to all selected tasks and subtasks.
While using Quick Add for task creation, after entering the Name and Location, you can assign an estimation immediately. Add the value based on your preferred duration format.
Applicable only for tasks where multiple assignees are available. During estimation entry, enable the flag Estimates by Person. Assign individual estimation values separately for each assigned user.
Open the Task or Subtask Details panel. Clear the estimation field to remove the value.
Locate the Estimation field. Clear the value directly from the list or board view.

Open the task from My Work. Access the Estimation field and remove or clear the value. Quick Note Estimation helps plan and forecast project timelines more efficiently. Estimation values are based on user-specific duration formats configured at profile settings. Only users with appropriate task editing permissions can assign or update estimations.

Links allow users to establish a direct relationship between two or more tasks or subtasks within the same project. Linking helps visualize dependencies, track related work, and manage task relationships efficiently. This is especially useful in complex projects where multiple tasks are interconnected or dependent on each other. A linked task offers a clear view of associated work and encourages collaboration across teams. When a task is linked to another, the connection is visible in both directions - meaning, if Task A is linked to Task B, both tasks will show this association in their respective details.
Task Linking is available under the Growth Plan.

The ability to link tasks depends on the Task Edit permission assigned to your role. Only users with the appropriate edit access can add or remove task links. Refer Roles and Permission for more details.
You can add links to tasks through several interfaces in 5day.io. Here's how:

Open the task or subtask detail page. Locate the "Link" field under task details. Click "Add Link" – the system will display a list of tasks and subtasks from the same project. Select one or more tasks to link. The selected tasks will now be linked and reflected in both task views.

View Access Method List View Click on the More (****⋮) icon at the end of the task row Board View Click on the More (****⋮) icon at the top of the task card Task Details View Click on the More (****⋮) icon at the top-right of the task detail panel Once you click Add Link, the system will show all linkable tasks and subtasks within the same project. You can select one or multiple to create the link.
documents.s: From List View / Board View / Task Details More Menu

documents.t: Navigate to My Work from the main menu. Click on the relevant task to open its detail page. Use the Link field as described above to add links to other tasks or subtasks.

Select multiple tasks or subtasks from the list or board view. The Bulk Update bar will appear. Choose the Link field within bulk update. Select one or more tasks/subtasks to link. The selected links will apply to all selected tasks.

While using the Quick Add option to create a task, enter the task name and select its location. Select the Link field during creation. Choose from the list of available tasks or subtasks in the same project. Upon selection, tasks will be linked immediately after creation.

Once a link is created between two tasks, it becomes mutually visible—both the source task and the linked task will reflect this association in their details. This ensures transparency and better navigation across related work items.

To remove an existing link from a task, use any of the following views: Method Steps Task/Subtask Details Open the task -> Locate the Link section -> Click the Remove icon beside the linked task List View / Board View Open the More Menu (⋮) -> Select Edit or open Task Details -> Remove links via the Link section My Work Open task from My Work → Use the same Link section to remove any unwanted linked tasks
To add new task, refer Add Task To edit task, refer Edit Task

The Priority field helps teams rank tasks and subtasks based on their urgency or business impact. This ensures that high-priority tasks are addressed first and resource allocation is optimized. Each task and subtask can carry a priority label that reflects its relative importance within a project. Priority settings enhance visibility, planning, and focus across teams. These values are configurable at the workspace and project, giving you control over what priority levels are available and how they’re applied.
This feature is available in all subscription plans of 5day.io.
The ability to assign or edit Priority values depends on the Task Edit Permissions of the user’s role.

Priorities are configured at the Workspace settings and inherited by projects. Go to: Workspace Settings → Customization → Priority. Here, a list of pre-configured priorities is available to every workspace. These priorities will automatically apply to new projects created in the workspace. Users can rename, enable/disable, or set a default priority. To enable Priority within a specific project: Go to: Project Settings → Features → Enable 'Priority' Once enabled, go to: Project Settings → Customization → Priority. The list of priorities from the workspace will appear. Users can: Change names of the priorities. Enable/disable individual priorities (only enabled priorities will be selectable in tasks/subtasks). Set a default priority, which will auto-assign to all newly created tasks/subtasks.
Open the task or subtask. Locate the Priority field. Click the field to view all available priority options. Select the desired value to update.

Ensure the view is not grouped by Priority. If the Priority field is not visible: Click Customize. Enable the Priority field and adjust its position using drag-and-drop. Once enabled, the field appears in the view. Click on it to assign or change the priority value. Save the customized view for reuse.
Navigate to My Work. Click on the desired task or subtask to open its details. Update the Priority field as needed.
Select the tasks/subtasks to update. A Bulk Update option will appear. Choose Priority and assign a new value to apply it across all selected items.
While using Quick Add to create a task: After entering the task name and location, access the Priority field. Select the appropriate priority level before saving.

Task Recurrence turns any Task into a self-repeating machine - automatically creating new copies on your exact schedule (daily standups, weekly reports, monthly invoices, yearly audits) without lifting a finger after setup.
You need Edit task permission in the source task and Add task permission to create recurred tasks.
Select a Task → click three dots → Set Recurrence
Open Task -> Task Details panel (right side) -> click three dots (top-right) -> Set Recurrence
Go to My Work -> find your Task -> click three dots -> Set Recurrence

When you open Set Recurrence, a powerful yet simple panel appears: Field Description Frequency Pick how often the Task repeats — the heartbeat of your recurrence. Daily/Weekly/Monthly/Yearly: Daily -> Repeat Every On selected days (☑ Mon–Sun) or Every X days (1, 2, 3…) Choose specific weekdays or a fixed gap in days. Weekly -> On Select one or more days of the week to trigger. Weekly -> Repeat Every Set the interval between weekly cycles (e.g., every 2 weeks). Monthly -> On Anchor to a date or relative weekday in the month. Monthly -> Repeat Every Define how many months to skip between repeats. Yearly -> On Pin to a calendar date or floating weekday. Yearly -> Repeat Every Set the gap between yearly instances. Start Date Calendar picker. First recurrence runs on or after this date — your launch point. Ends On Never / On specific date / After X occurrences. Stop forever, on a fixed date, or after a set count. Skip Holidays and Weekoffs Auto-shift to next valid workday — no Tasks on closed days.
Every recurred Task displays a 🔄 recurrence icon in List, Board, and Task Details views.

Open any instance -> click three dots -> Edit Recurrence Change settings (frequency, fields to copy, etc.) -> Save All future instances update instantly with new rules. Past instances remain unchanged (history preserved).
documents.s: Edit Recurred Task (Updates All Future Tasks)

documents.t: Open any instance -> three dots -> Delete Recurrence Confirm → entire series stops. All future Tasks are deleted. Past Tasks stay with full history and data.
documents.s: Delete Recurred Tasks (Cancels All Future Tasks)

documents.t: To create a new task, refer Add Task. To create a new subtask, refer Add Subtask.

Story Points in 5day.io represent a unit of measure used to express the overall effort required to complete a task or subtask. Unlike time-based estimation, story points are abstract and typically based on complexity, risk, and uncertainty. They help teams evaluate work comparatively and prioritize tasks more effectively. This method is especially beneficial for agile project management. Story Points are numeric values (e.g., 1, 2, 3, 5, 8…) and are used to maintain consistent relative sizing across tasks. Each task and subtask maintains its own individual story point value.

Assignment of Story Points is governed by the Edit Task permission set: Edit All – User can assign story points to any task/subtask. Edit Owned – User can assign story points only to tasks/subtasks they own. Edit Related – User can assign story points to tasks/subtasks linked to their projects. Edit None – User cannot assign or edit story points. Refer Roles and Permission for more details.

To use story points, the Story Points feature must be enabled from Project Settings → Features → Story Points. Once enabled, the Story Points field will be available for all tasks and subtasks. The field accepts numeric values, and there is no predefined limit on value range. Story Points are independent between tasks and subtasks, and changes in one do not affect the other.

Task/Subtask Details​ Open the Task or Subtask Details panel. Locate the Story Points field. Enter a numeric value as per your sizing convention (e.g., 3, 5, 8, etc.)." List View / Board View​ If Story Points is not visible on the view, click Customize. Enable the Story Points field and adjust display order if necessary using drag and drop. Save the view. Locate the Story Points field for a task or subtask and enter the desired value. My Work​ Navigate to My Work. Click on the desired task to open Task Details. Add the Story Points value as described above. Bulk Update​ Select multiple tasks/subtasks from any list or board view. Click on Bulk Update from the action bar. Choose Story Points from the update options. Enter a numeric value. All selected tasks/subtasks will be updated with the entered story point value.

While creating a task using the Quick Add method, after entering the Name and Location, navigate to the Story Points field. Enter the numeric value. The story points will be saved along with the task.

Task/Subtask Details​ Open the task/subtask detail page. Locate the Story Points field and clear the entered value. List View / Board View​ If the field is visible, you can click and clear the story point value directly. My Work​ Open the task from My Work. Access the Story Points field and remove the assigned value. Quick Note Story Points are commonly used in Agile and Scrum to measure relative effort. This is a numeric-only field and does not correlate directly with hours or days. Only users with the required permissions can assign or update Story Points.

Tags are custom keywords or labels that you can add to tasks and subtasks in 5day.io to organize, group, and filter work items efficiently. Tags are flexible and allow users to classify tasks based on priority, departments, topics, workflows, or any custom criteria. They help in improving searchability, visibility, and context management across projects. There is no limitation to the number of tags you can create or assign. Tags are free-text based and can be edited or updated anytime. To use tags, the Tags feature must be enabled at the project level.

Assignment of tags to tasks and subtasks is controlled through the Edit Task permission set: Edit All – User can assign tags to any task or subtask. Edit Owned – User can assign tags to tasks/subtasks they own. Edit Related – User can assign tags to tasks/subtasks related to their projects. Edit None – User cannot assign or edit tags. Refer to Roles and Permission for more details.

In 5day.io, tags are free-text and flexible. There is no restriction on the number of tags you can create and assign. To enable tagging, the Tags feature must be turned on at Project Settings → Feature → Tags. Once enabled, tags can be added and managed across tasks and subtasks.

Task/Subtask Details​ Open the Task or Subtask Details panel. Locate the Tags field. Click on the ‘+ Add’ button; a list of existing tags will appear. Select an existing tag or create a new tag. The selected tag will be added to the respective task or subtask. List View / Board View​ Ensure the view is not grouped by Tags. If the Tags field is not visible, click on Customize, enable Tags, and adjust the display order. Save the view once customized. Click on the Tags field for the task/subtask. Select an existing tag or create a new tag to assign. My Work​ Navigate to My Work. Select the task you wish to tag; the Task Details panel will open. Add or create a tag in the Tags field. Bulk Update​ Select multiple tasks or subtasks where you would like to add tags. A Bulk Update option will appear on the screen. Click on Tags. Select from existing tags or create a new tag. Apply tags to all selected tasks or subtasks simultaneously. Quick Add (While Creating a Task)​ During task creation via Quick Add, after entering the Name and Location, you can assign a tag immediately. Select an existing tag from the list or create a new one. The selected tag(s) will be assigned as part of the task creation process.

Task/Subtask Details​ Hover over the assigned tag within the Task or Subtask Details panel. A Remove icon will appear beside the tag name. Click on the icon to remove the tag from the task/subtask. List View / Board View​ Click on the Tags field. The list of assigned tags will open along with a Remove icon. Remove tags individually as needed. My Work​ Open a task from My Work. Click on the Tags field. Remove assigned tags one by one through the Remove icon. Quick Note You can create and assign as many tags as needed. Tags help in filtering, grouping, and organizing tasks/subtasks efficiently. Tags are editable only if you have the relevant task editing permissions.
To explore about statuses, refer Task Status. To explore about estimation, refer Task Estimation. To explore about Assignee, refer Task Assignee.

In 5day.io, Workspace serves as the highest level of organization within your account. It allows you to manage multiple departments, teams, or business units separately while keeping everything connected within the same ecosystem.
Plan Number of Workspace Free 1 Growth Unlimited

You can create a new workspace in multiple ways within 5day.io: To create workspace via Quick Add From top/left navigation bar, click on 'Quick Add' Select 'Workspace' from left bar. Create a workspace. To create workspace via Account Settings You should have a permission to access account settings. From top/left navigation bar, click on your personal avatar. Select 'More' from Account Settings panel. Select 'Workspaces' from left panel. Click 'Add' to create a workspace. To create workspace via Workspace Views From top/left navigation bar, click on 'Projects' or press 'p' to create workspace via shortcut key. Click 'Add' to create a workspace.

While creating a workspace, following information is needed: Field Description Icon & Color Choose a representative icon and color to visually distinguish your workspace Name Provide a clear and meaningful name of your workspace The user who creates the workspace automatically becomes the owner of that workspace. Ownership can later be updated through the Edit Workspace, if needed. The newly created workspace will be visible in the Workspace List view. You can edit, or delete the workspace based on your assigned role and permissions.
Once the workspace gets created, each will have a its unique ID to access directly via URL.
To modify the workspace, refer Edit Workspace. To explore all workspaces, refer List of Workspace.

In 5day.io, a Workspace is the highest level of organization, containing Spaces, Projects, Sections, Tasks, and Subtasks. Deleting a Workspace removes it and all its associated data, including all Spaces and their contents, from your account. This action is permanent and should be performed with caution.

There are two main ways to initiate the deletion of a workspace Method Navigation Path Description Account Settings Account Settings -> List of Workspaces -> More Menu -> Delete Delete from the central list of all Workspaces in your account Workspace View Workspace List or Board View → More Menu (⋮) beside Workspace name → Delete Quick access for directly deleting a specific Workspace. Method 1 Method 2

When you select the Delete option, the following steps occur: Confirmation Prompt: You will be prompted to confirm the deletion to prevent accidental data loss. Permission Check: Only users with ‘Delete Workspace permission’ can perform this action. Data Removal: All associated Spaces, Projects, Sections, Tasks, and Subtasks within the Workspace are permanently deleted. Quick Note Deleting a Workspace is irreversible. Ensure you back up any critical data before proceeding. If you need to preserve specific Spaces or Projects, consider moving them to another Workspace first. For more details refer Move Project.
To add a new space , refer to the Add Workspace. To explore all created spaces, refer to the List of Workspaces.

Once a workspace is created in 5day.io, users with the appropriate permissions can edit the workspace to configure its structure, settings, and users. Editing a workspace helps maintain the accuracy, flexibility, and scalability of your workspace organization.

There are two main ways to open the Edit workspace Method Navigation Path Description Account Settings Account Settings -> List of Workspaces -> Edit Edit from the central list of all workspaces Workspace View Workspace List or Board View → More Menu (⋮) beside workspace name Quick access for directly editing a specific workspace Method 1 Method 2

When you access the Edit option, you can perform the following actions depending on your permissions: Add Space: Add a new space under the workspace. Add Project: Add a new project directly within the workspace. Refer: Add Project Guide Add/Invite People: Add/Invite team members to the workspace. Refer: User & Roles Guide Rename: Change the name of the workspace. Workspace Settings: Access detailed workspace configurations (explained below). Pages Description General Info Manage workspace's identity and ownership Icon & Color Choose a visual icon and color theme for easy identification. Name The display name of your workspace. Description A short explanation about the purpose or scope of the workspace. Owner The current owner responsible for workspace administration. Spaces & Projects View and manage all spaces and projects under this workspace. Change their order, navigate, and access related settings. Timesheet Settings Configure time tracking rules, settings, and behavior for this workspace. Refer: Timesheet Module for more. Customization Status Workflow Define the workflow stages of tasks. Refer: Status Workflow Guide Task Types Create and manage types of tasks for better categorization. Refer: Task Types Guide Priorities Define and manage priority levels for tasks. Refer: Priority Settings Guide Sprint Management Configure sprint tracking and agile settings. Refer: Sprint Management Guide Integrations The Integration Centre allows to connect the workspace with third-party apps, tools, or services for seamless operations and enhanced functionality. Explore available integrations based on your plan
To add a new space , refer to the Add Workspace. To explore all created spaces, refer to the List of workspaces.

Workspace is at the highest level of the 5day.io structure. Spaces, projects, task and subtasks all reside within your workspace. It serves as the foundation of any organization's structure, supporting businesses of all sizes. You can define and manage various verticals, geographical locations, and other relevant categories in a highly efficient way using workspaces. For example, if we consider an account as your organization, there will be multiple departments there. These can be your workspaces. But, if you are a small organization, simply and directly create one workspace and start managing your work. In addition to the above, a default workspace will be created automatically with the name ‘Your Account Name’ when you enter the system. Then, depending on your subscription plan, permissions you can manage workspaces in account. Note: Every workspace is independent and separate from others, so viewing or transferring information between them is not possible.
A workspace can help you: Manage multiple projects on a single page. Avoid missing trivial or crucial information. Manage different departments or working areas independently.

Work Organization: Group multiple projects under a single workspace. Centralized Data: Dashboards, documents, tasks, and reports are centric to workspace. Custom Settings: Configure Timesheet rules, Task Types, Status Workflows, and Priorities specific to your workspace. Switch Workspaces: Quickly switch between different workspaces from the top or left navigation.
List of Workspaces gives you a single, clean screen showing every workspace inside the account - perfect for jumping in, reordering, or managing access in seconds.
Go to Account Settings -> three dots -> Workspaces.

Field Description Icon & Color Choose a representative icon and color to visually distinguish your workspace Name A clear and meaningful name of your workspace. Owner Represents the owner of workspace.

Drag-and-drop to reorder (visual hierarchy matters!) Click any workspace name -> instantly load its Workspace View (List or Board) Search bar -> To search a specific workspace. Settings -> To manage the workspace settings. More -> To perform certain actions on workspace like Add Space, Add Project , Add People, Invite People etc..
To add a new workspace, refer to the Add Workspace. To manage settings of workspace, refer to the Edit Workspace.

People at Workspace lets you control exactly who can see and work inside a specific Workspace. Invite or add team members once here - they instantly get access to projects in this Workspace (based on their role and associated permission). Why manage people at Workspace level? One invite = access to current and future projects in this Workspace Keep departments separate Remove someone once = they lose access to everything in this Workspace
You need Edit Workspace permission to invite, add, or remove people.
Go to Workspace -> More Icon (three dots) -> Workspace Settings -> People You’ll see the full list of everyone in this Workspace.

Invite People - Type email -> pick role -> Send Invite Add People - Search existing account users -> click + Add Search/Filter People - Type name, email address, or role -> list updates instantly Sort People - By name, email address, role, status. Remove from Workspace - Click more icon (three dots) next to name -> Remove from workspace -> confirm Quick Note Workspace Owner can never be removed - transfer ownership first (via Edit Workspace) Project Owners in this Workspace can’t be removed until their project ownership is transferred Removing someone from Workspace = instantly blocks them from all projects inside. They keep access to other Workspaces they’re in.
To get more details about workspace owner , refer to the Workspace Owner. To explore about workspace details , refer to the Workspace Details.

In 5day.io, workspace management capabilities are controlled through user roles and permission sets. These define what each user can view, create, edit, or delete within the workspace environment. Understanding these permissions ensures the right level of control is maintained across different user roles — such as Admins, Managers, or Collaborators — while keeping the workspace secure and structured.

Permission Type Description View Controls which workspaces user can view in the account. Add Controls whether user is allowed to create new workspace. Edit Controls the ability to manage and update workspace. Delete Controls the ability to delete workspace Each of these permissions has granular levels like All, Own, Related, or None depending on how much access a user should have.

Permission Level Description All Applies to all workspaces in the account, regardless of ownership or membership. Own Applies only to workspaces where user is listed as the workspace owner. Related Applies to workspaces where user is either the workspace owner or a workspace member. None The user does not have any access for the selected action

Type All Own Related None View Can view all workspaces in the account - Can view only workspaces where you are workspace owner or workspace member Cannot view any workspace Add Can create new workspaces - - Cannot create new workspace Edit Can edit all workspaces Can edit workspaces where you are workspace owner Can edit workspaces where you are a member or owner Cannot edit any workspace Delete Can delete any workspace Can delete only workspaces where you are workspace owner Can delete workspaces where you are workspace owner or workspace member Cannot delete any workspace Note: “Workspace Edit” permission grants access to modify the core settings of a workspace, including timesheets, workflows, and task types.

Account Owner or Admins should have All permissions for full control. Department heads or project managers can be given Own or Related permissions based on their roles in organization. General team members should typically have None for sensitive actions like editing or deleting workspaces. Ensure only limited users have Delete permissions to prevent accidental data loss.

Workspace Details is the one-stop screen to view and update everything that defines your Workspace - from its name and look to who’s in charge. It keeps your Workspace identity sharp and ownership crystal-clear.
You must have Edit Workspace permission to make changes here.
Go to you workspace -> click on more icon (three dots) → Workspace Settings → General You’re now inside Workspace Details

Field Description Icon and Color Pick any icon + color combo to make this Workspace stand out in the sidebar Name Rename the Workspace anytime About Add a short note about purpose, scope, or rules (optional but helpful) Workspace Owner View current owner’s photo, name, and email, refer Workspace Owner for more details. Delete Workspace Permanently remove the entire Workspace + everything inside, refer Delete Workspace for more details.
To get more details about change ownership , refer to the Workspace Owner. To explore about workspace details , refer to the Workspace Details.
Workspace Owner is the single person with ultimate control over the entire Workspace - think of them as the captain who can steer, rename, transfer, or even delete the ship.
Only the current Workspace Owner or account-level admins can change ownership.
Go to your Workspace -> More icon (three dots) -> Workspace Settings -> General Scroll to Workspace Owner section -> you’re now in the owner panel

Action Details View Current Owner See photo, full name, and email (read-only) Change Owner Transfer full control to another eligible team member Quick Notes Only current owner or account-level admins can change the owner New owner must already be in the Workspace with Edit Workspace permission Dropdown only shows eligible users - no invalid picks, no mistakes Transfer is instant - old owner immediately becomes a regular member (unless removed separately) New owner gets full rights: rename, delete, manage people, everything.
To explore about workspace details , refer to the Workspace Details.

The Workspace View provides a centralized interface to access and manage all Projects, organized within their respective Spaces and Workspaces. Available to all accounts regardless of subscription plan. Workspace View offers two display options - List View and Board View - to suit different workflow preferences. This guide explains how to access and use these views to navigate, organize, and customize your Workspace data.

To access the Space Views, follow these steps: After Login -> Navigate to Projects: Click the Project icon in the primary panel. Select View Type (Secondary Panel) Project Views: Displays Projects in a flat list or board, grouped by workspace. Structure View: Displays a list of all Workspaces in the secondary panel, with the hierarchy data (Spaces, Projects, Sections, Tasks, Subtasks) of the first Workspace loaded in the Right Panel Structure View -> You will be redirected to a list of all Projects of 1st workspace of your account, organized by their hierarchy (Space > Project). Load Workspace Views: Upon selecting a Workspace in Structure View, the Right Panel will load the Workspace View, with List View as the default
Workspace Views offer two display modes: List View and Board View. Both views provide identical functionality, differing only in their visual presentation.
List View displays Projects in a structured, hierarchical list within the selected workspace. Each Project is accessible with a single click, providing a clear and compact overview.

Board View presents Projects as visual cards on a Kanban-style board within the selected workspace. Each card represents a Project and can be clicked to access its details, offering an interactive and visual workflow.

Feature Description Add Add a new space or project directly from the view. Click the “+ Add” icon next to the Space. Refer: Add Project Guide Search Search for a specific Project by its ID or Name using the search bar at the top. Filter Apply filters to display specific datasets (e.g., Projects by owner, Budget Type, or Clients). Click the filter icon to select criteria. Sort Sort the list of Projects by parameters like name, date, or number of tasks. Click the sort icon to choose options. Group By Group Projects by criteria such as client, or budget type. Select “Group By” from the view options. Customize By default, completed (Done) Projects are hidden. Enable the “Show Completed Projects” option in the customize menu to display them. Quick Note Features like search, filter, sort, and group by are applied to the current view and reset when you switch Workspace.
To add a new space , refer to the Add Workspace. To explore all created spaces, refer to the List of Workspaces.
You can easily add existing members of your 5day.io workspace to a project using one of two methods. This ensures the right people have access and visibility to collaborate on the project tasks.

Go to the project where you want to add members. Click the three-dot menu (⋮) next to the project name. Select Add People from the dropdown. From the list of existing workspace members, select the users you want to add. Click Add — they’ll immediately be added to the project.

Inside the project, click the three-dot menu (⋮) next to the project name. Select Project Settings. In the Project Settings menu, go to the People tab. Click on Add People. Choose members from the existing list and click Add. ✅ Note: Only existing workspace members can be added to a project. If someone isn't part of your workspace yet, you’ll need to invite them to the workspace first before assigning them to a project.

You can invite people who are not yet part of your workspace directly to a project. They’ll receive an email invitation and be added with the selected role once they join. You can invite them using either of the two options below:
documents.s: Invite New Members to a Project

documents.t: Navigate to the project. Click the three-dot menu (⋮) next to the project name.

Select Invite People. Choose Invite by Email. Enter the person’s email address and select their role (e.g., Member, Manager, Guest). Click Invite. An invitation email will be sent. Once the user accepts the invite, they’ll be able to log in and access the project.

Go to the project and click the three-dot menu (⋮) next to the project name. Select Project Settings. Navigate to the People tab. Click on Invite New. Choose Invite by Email. Enter the email address, assign the role, and click Invite. ✅ The invited person will receive an email with instructions to join. After confirming their email, they’ll be added directly to the project.

You can create a project in two ways in 5day.io: 1. Create From Scratch​ Use this option to manually create a new project from any of the following locations: Where can you add a project from? Workspace Menu: Click on the workspace name in the left sidebar. Then click the three-dot menu (⋮) next to it and choose Add Project to add it under that workspace. Space Menu: Inside a workspace, click on the space name, open the three-dot menu, and choose Add Project to add it under that space. Project Menu: Next to an existing project, click the three-dot menu (⋮) and select Add Project. This will place the new project in the same space as the existing one. Quick Add Button: From the top left navigation bar, click on the Quick Add (+) icon — represented by a plus sign inside a circle. Once the quick add menu opens, click on Project to start creating a new project. Add (+) Button: A cross spaces and workspaces, you’ll find an Add (+) button. Click it, and from the dropdown menu, select Project to start project creation. Tip: The location you choose will pre-fill the workspace/space in the project form automatically. Steps to complete project creation: Choose Set a New Project Fill in the required fields: Project Name – The name of your project Where – (Auto-filled based on where you clicked, but editable) Description – (Optional) A short summary Duration – Start Date and Due Date Click Add to create your project 2. Create a Project Using a Template​ Use this option when you want to save time by creating a project with predefined structure, tasks, and sections. Where can you add a project via template from? Workspace Menu: Click on the workspace name in the left sidebar. Then click the three-dot menu (⋮) next to it and choose Add Project to add it under that workspace. Space Menu: Inside a workspace, click on the space name, open the three-dot menu, and choose Add Project to add it under that space. Project Menu: Next to an existing project, click the three-dot menu (⋮) and select Add Project. This will place the new project in the same space as the existing one. Quick Add Button: From the top left navigation bar, click on the Quick Add (+) icon — represented by a plus sign inside a circle. Once the quick add menu opens, click on Project to start creating a new project. Add (+) Button: A cross spaces and workspaces, you’ll find an Add (+) button. Click it, and from the dropdown menu, select Project to start project creation. Tip: The location you choose will pre-fill the workspace/space in the project form automatically.

Click New Project from any of the locations above. In the project creation form, select the Use Template tab. Choose between: Default Templates – Templates provided by 5day.io for common use cases. Custom Templates – Templates previously saved by your team. Click on a template to preview and select it. Fill in the rest of the details: Project Name Where – Workspace or space (auto-filled, but editable) Description (optional) Start Date & Due Date Click Add to create the project.
documents.s: Steps to Create From a Template

documents.t: Open the Project Navigate to the project you want to save as a reusable template. Click the Three-Dot Menu (⋮) Located next to the project name. From the dropdown, select Save as Template. Fill in Template Details Template Name (required): Give your template a clear name. Template Image (optional): Upload an identifying image or icon. Description (optional): Add a short summary about the purpose or usage. Template Type: Defaults to Project. Choose What to Include in the Template
documents.s: How to Create a Project Template

documents.t: Displayed as checkboxes. Select the elements to carry over into future projects: Client Priority Sprint Management Custom Fields People Dates Copy Sections (Toggle)​ Turn this ON to include your project’s section structure (e.g., "To Do", "Backlog", etc.). Turn OFF to exclude them. Copy Tasks (Toggle)​ When enabled, all project tasks will be included in the template. You’ll also see a set of task-level fields that will be copied along with each task: Status Priority Estimation Assignee Tags Custom Fields Dates Copy Subtasks (Toggle)​ This becomes available only if Copy Tasks is ON. If enabled, subtasks of copied tasks will also be included. 🔔 Important: The fields selected under Copy Tasks (like status, tags, etc.) will also apply to subtasks. Users do not currently have the option to select different fields for subtasks. Click Save Once everything is configured, click Save. Your custom project template is now available for reuse when creating new projects.
To delete a project in 5day.io, follow these steps:

Select the Project: Click on the project name that you want to delete. Open the Three-Dot Menu: Next to the project name, click on the three-dot menu. Click on 'Delete': From the dropdown, select the Delete option. Confirm Deletion: A confirmation box will appear. Click Yes to confirm that you want to delete the project. Project Deleted: Once confirmed, the project will be permanently deleted from the system.

To delete a template you no longer need: Go to Account Settings: Start by accessing your account settings. Open Template List: Navigate to the 'Template List' in the settings. Select Template: Next to each template, there’s a three-dot menu. Click on it and select Delete. Confirm Deletion: A confirmation prompt will appear. Confirm the deletion to permanently remove the template from the system.

If you want to create a similar project without saving it as a template, you can duplicate an existing project for temporary use. Here’s how: Select the Project: Go to the project you want to duplicate. Click on the Three-Dot Menu: Once inside the project, click on the three-dot menu next to the project name.

Choose 'Duplicate Project': From the dropdown menu, click on Duplicate Project. Enter the New Project Name: A confirmation box will appear. Enter the desired name for the duplicated project. Select the Destination: In the Where option, select the space or workspace where you want the duplicated project to be created. Set Start and Due Dates: Choose the start and due dates for the new project.

Choose Details to Copy: There will be a Select details to copy option with checkboxes. Select the details you want to copy, such as: Members Custom fields Subtasks Task attachments Tags Confirm and Duplicate: Once you’ve selected the options, click on the Duplicate button. The new project will be duplicated and saved in the selected space or workspace.
To edit the project information in 5day.io, follow these steps: Go to Project Settings: First, navigate to the Project Settings of the project you want to edit.

Access Project Info: In the Project Settings menu, find and click on Project Info. Edit Project Info: Project Name: You can change the project name by clicking on the project info icon. Project Icon: Upload a custom image or select pre-defined icon and colour/theme for the project icon. Start and Due Dates: Set the start date and due date for the project. Project Status: Choose the current status of the project (e.g., New, In Progress, In Review and Done). Priority: Set the priority level of the project (e.g., High, Medium, Low). Project Prefix: Select a prefix for the project, which will be used for task IDs. Project Owner: Assign the owner for the project. If there are multiple owners, click Add Owner and add additional users. Project Description: Write a description for the project to provide more context or details. Custom Fields: If needed, you can also add custom fields specific to the project. All changes made in the project info section will be saved automatically. Once you’re done, you can return to the project list by clicking the Go Back button.
To edit the details inside a template project: Go to Account Settings: Start by accessing your account settings.

Open Template List: Find the 'Template List' and open it. Select Template: Click on the three-dot menu next to the template you want to edit and select View Template. Modify Project Details: The template project will open, allowing you to modify any details, such as task statuses, assignees, dates, or other saved information. Save Automatically: Once changes are made, click the Back button, and the system will save the changes automatically. You’ll return to the template list.

You can import tasks into a project in 5day.io using two methods. Here's how: Method 1: Importing from the Project List​ Navigate to the Project List: Go to the list of all your projects. Click on the Three-Dot Menu: Next to the project where you want to import tasks, click on the three-dot menu.
Select 'Import': In the dropdown, select Import. This will open the task import dialog.

Download the Sample File: Once the import dialog appears, click on Download Sample File. This will download an Excel file with two sheets: a. Template Sheet: This is where you need to input all the task details. b. Guideline Sheet: This sheet provides guidelines for entering data correctly for each field. Enter Data in the Template: Open the Excel file, and fill in the task details in the Template sheet. Refer to the Guideline sheet if you need help understanding the data format or field requirements. Save the File: After entering the necessary details, save the file. Upload the File: Return to the import dialog and click on Upload from Computer. Select the saved file and click on Import to import the task data into 5day.io. Method 2: Importing from Project Settings​ Go to Project Settings: Navigate to the project settings of the project you want to import tasks into.
View Data Import History: In the settings, you will see an option for Data Import History. Click on 'Import': In the Data Import History section, click on Import to begin the process.

Download the Sample File: Like in Method 1, you can download the Sample File from the import dialog. Enter Data in the Template: Open the downloaded file, and fill in the task details in the Template sheet. Use the Guideline sheet for assistance on field requirements. Upload and Import: After saving the file, go back to the import dialog and click on Upload from Computer. Select your file and click on Import to upload the tasks into the project. Data Import History​

Once the tasks are imported, you can view the import details in the Data Import History section. Here, you will see: Date and Time of import File Imported Imported By (the user who initiated the import) Type (type of import) Status (success or failure) Total Records (number of records in the file) Records Imported (successful imports) Records Failed (failed imports) If there are any issues with the import, the system will display: The records that failed to import You can also download an Excel file listing the records that failed. This allows you to identify and correct any issues with the data.

Projects in 5day.io are how you organize and manage a group of tasks that are part of a larger goal, initiative, or deliverable. Every task you create belongs to a project, making it easier to group related work, assign responsibilities, and track progress in one central place. Use projects to: Group related tasks under one initiative. Set timelines with project start and end dates. Track progress using different views such as List or Board. Collaborate with your team using files, and discussions. Get visibility into all task-level details without losing sight of the big picture. Each project supports additional metadata like project description, client assignment (if enabled), tags, custom fields, and more—so your team has all the context in one place. ✅ Projects form the foundation for execution in 5day.io. Whether you're launching a new product, running a client engagement, or managing an internal sprint, it all starts with creating a project.
The Projects feature is available across all subscription plans in 5day.io. However, the number of projects you can create depends on your subscription tier:
Subscription Plan Project Creation Limit Free Plan Up to 5 Projects Growth Plan Unlimited Projects
documents.s: Project Creation Limits by Subscription Plan

documents.t: Account Owners, Account Admins, and Managers (default roles) can create, access, and manage projects. Custom Role Users with the Add permission enabled for Projects in Security & Permissions can also create projects. ⠀✅ Project creation access is controlled through role-based permissions in Security & Permissions.
documents.s: Who Can Create and Manage Projects

documents.t: Each project in 5day.io includes a set of configurable attributes that help you define the scope and track the status:

You'll be prompted to fill in: Project Name – The name of your project Where – The workspace or space under which the project will be created Description – (Optional) A brief explanation of the project Duration – Start Date and Due Date to set a timeline ⠀

You can further configure: Priority – Choose from predefined levels (e.g., High, Medium, Low) Budget Type – Select whether the project is billable or non-billable Prefix – A short code added to all tasks ID within the project (e.g., MKTG-101) Progress – Track % completion of the project Owner – Assign responsibility to a specific person Description – Update or expand the project summary Client – Tag the project to a specific client. (This option is available only if the Client feature is enabled in Project Settings.) Custom Fields – Add fields like budget, department, or tags as per your needs ⠀These attributes are accessible via the Project Settings menu and can be updated at any time.
To enable or disable project features in 5day.io, follow these steps: Go to Project Settings: First, navigate to the Project Settings of the project you want to configure.

Click on 'Features': Once in Project Settings, click on the Features tab. Enable or Disable Features: In the features list, you'll see a range of features with toggle buttons next to each one. You can toggle on or off the features you want to enable or disable for that particular project. Here is a list of project features that you can enable or disable: Subtasks: Divide large tasks into smaller, manageable parts. Priority: Set task priority levels. Client: Track work for a specific client at the project level. Multiple Assignee: Assign tasks to multiple people. Tags: Use custom tags to organize tasks. Project Finance: Track billable, non-billable, and budget information. Time Tracking: Track time for various types of work. Time Estimates: Track time estimates for tasks. Time Approval: Enforce manual approval for time entries. Overtime: Track overtime hours in timesheets. Story Points: Estimate the effort required to complete tasks. Assignee Wise Estimation: Divide estimated task time among multiple assignees. Custom Fields: Add custom fields to tasks for additional information. Multiple Task Types: Assign and associate multiple task types within a project. Sprint Management: Divide your project into time-boxed sprints (e.g., 2-week periods) to focus on specific goals and track progress within each sprint. Save Changes: Once you've made the necessary modifications, your changes will be saved automatically. Go Back: After you’re done, click the Back button to return to the list of projects.

In 5day.io, you can customize which views are available for your project, such as List, Board, Timesheet, Dashboard, Files, and more. Steps to Enable or Disable Views:​ Open the Project Navigate to the project where you want to update the views.

Sprint Management is enabled by default at the workspace level if your subscription plan (e.g., Growth Plan) supports it. Key Points: Sprint Management allows you to manage sprints across your projects, and (if enabled) use story points for estimation. For each workspace where Sprint Management is enabled, you can configure: Default Sprint Duration: Set how long each sprint should last (e.g., 14 days, 2 weeks). Story Points: Enable or disable the use of story points for tracking task complexity or effort. This gives your team flexibility to define how sprints should work workspace by workspace.
If you don’t want Sprint Management enabled for a specific workspace: Go to Workspace Settings: Navigate to the workspace where you want to disable Sprint Management.
documents.s: Enable or Disable Sprint Management at the Workspace Level

documents.t: Open Customization: Inside workspace settings, click on the Customization tab. Locate Sprint Management: Find the Sprint Management option in the customization panel.
Toggle Off: Use the toggle button to disable Sprint Management for this workspace. ✅ Note: You can re-enable Sprint Management anytime using the same toggle.
Sprint Management in 5day.io helps you manage work in fixed time cycles (sprints), commonly used by agile teams. Here's how you can enable or disable it for any project:
documents.s: Enable or Disable Sprint Management at the Project Level

documents.t: Go to Project Settings Click on the project name → click the three-dot menu (⋮) → select Project Settings. IMAGE​ Open Features Tab In the settings panel, go to the Features section. Enable Sprint Management Turn on the toggle for Sprint Management. Note: When Sprint Management is enabled, Story Points are also enabled automatically.

Configure Sprint Settings Once enabled, a configuration window will appear with the following options: Sprint Duration: Enter the sprint length (in days). Sprint Starts From: Select the date from which sprints should begin. Sprints to Create by Default: Choose how many sprints to generate initially (between 1 and 10). Save Configuration Click Done to save your changes. Sprint Management is now active for your project.

At any point, you can go back to Project Settings → Features, locate Sprint Management, and: Update the sprint duration or start date. Change the number of sprints. Disable Sprint Management by toggling it off.

To move a project in 5day.io, follow these simple steps: Go to the Project: Start by navigating to the project that you want to move. Click on the Three-Dot Menu: Once inside the project, click on the three-dot menu next to the project name.

Select 'Move to': In the dropdown menu, click on the Move to option. Choose the Destination Space: A prompt labeled Where will appear. Here, you can select the space or workspace where you want to move the project. Confirm the Move: Once you’ve selected the appropriate space or workspace, click on the Move project button. Project Moved: Your project will be automatically moved from its current space to the new one.

Overview Project settings in 5day.io provide a central hub for managing and configuring all aspects of a project. From here, users can modify project information, sections, and configure important features, manage integrations, and access various other project-specific settings. How to Access Project Settings To access the project settings: Click on the Project Name: Start by selecting the project for which you want to modify the settings. Open the Three-Dot Menu: Click on the three-dot menu next to the project name.

Select 'Project Settings': From the dropdown menu, click on Project Settings. Modify Settings: In the project settings menu, you can adjust various project configurations like sections, features, and integration settings. Save Changes: Any changes made in the project settings are automatically saved. Once done, you can click the Back button to return to the list of all projects.
To rename a project in 5day.io, follow these simple steps: Open the Three-Dot Menu

Sprint Management in 5day.io is designed to help teams working in sprints (like Agile or Scrum workflows) manage their work in time-boxed iterations. It brings structure to task planning, tracking, and reporting by organizing your project into sprints with clear start/end dates, progress tracking, and detailed reporting.

Sprint-Based Workflows: Break down your project into sprints (typically 1–4 weeks) and manage tasks within each sprint cycle. Story Points & Estimations: Optionally enable story points to estimate task complexity alongside time-based estimations. Both can be used together for better sprint planning. Sprint Settings: Configure: Sprint duration (how long each sprint will last) Sprint start date Sprint creation (e.g., how many sprints you want pre-created) Sprint Analytics & Reporting: Gain insight through sprint-specific charts and dashboards: Sprint Burndown Chart Sprint Burnup Chart Sprint Velocity Chart These visual reports help you monitor sprint progress, forecast completion, and improve team performance over time.
Subscription Plan Sprint Management Availability Free Plan Sprint Management is not available. Growth Plan Sprint Management is enabled by default. Users can turn it on or off at the workspace level.

Templates in 5day.io help you save time and maintain consistency by reusing the structure of frequently repeated projects. Instead of recreating the same setup each time, you can save a project as a template and use it to quickly launch new projects with predefined configurations. Templates are ideal for: Standardized workflows (e.g., onboarding, implementation, hiring) Repeatable task structures across clients or teams ⠀Each project template can store: Template Name Template Image Template Description Optionally copy: Project Details Sections Tasks Details Subtasks Details
You can create a Section in a project using two easy methods:

Go to the project where you want to create a section. Click the three-dot menu (⋮) next to the project name. Select Add Section. In the Add Section form: Project: By default, the current project is selected. You can change this if needed. Section Name: Enter a name for your section. Section Icon: Customize the icon by: Choosing a Color/Theme Selecting an Icon from the provided icon set Click Add to create your section.

Open the project where you want to add a section. Click the Add button (+) located within the project workspace. From the dropdown, select Section. In the form that appears: Project: The current project will be selected by default (editable if needed). Section Name: Enter the section title. Section Icon: Customize by: Selecting a Color/Theme Choosing an Icon from the icon set Click Add to complete the creation.
In 5day.io, sections can be deleted easily using two different methods. Here’s how you can do it:

Open the Project: Click on the project where the section is located. View Section List: A list of all sections within the project will appear. Open the Three-Dot Menu: Next to the section you want to delete, click on the three-dot menu (⋮). Click 'Delete': Select Delete from the menu. Confirm Deletion: A confirmation box will appear. Click Yes to confirm and delete the section.

Expand the Project: Click the arrow icon next to the project name to expand and view all sections. Open the Three-Dot Menu: Next to the section you want to delete, click on the three-dot menu (⋮). Click 'Delete': Select Delete from the menu. Confirm Deletion: A confirmation box will appear. Click Yes to confirm the deletion.
You can edit a section in 5day.io using two simple methods:

Open the Project: Click on the project where the section is located. View Section List: You’ll see a list of all sections within the project. Click the Section Name: Click directly on the name of the section you want to rename. The section name box will automatically become editable. Rename the Section: Enter the new name, and it will be updated automatically—no need to click a save button.

Open the Project: Click on the project where the section is located. Expand the Section List: Use the arrow icon beside the project name to expand and view all sections. Access the Menu: Next to the section you want to rename, click on the three-dot menu (⋮). Click 'Rename Section': Select Rename Section from the menu. The section name will become editable. Enter the New Name: Type the new section name. The change will be saved automatically without needing to click a save button.

Section in 5day.io are a flexible way to organize and group tasks within a project. Think of Section as virtual containers that help you categorize your work according to your team’s needs. For example: In a product roadmap, Section might represent quarters (Q1, Q2, etc.). In a marketing campaign, Section might be grouped by months or milestones. For client projects, Section could be phases like Planning, Execution, and Delivery.

Group Tasks Logically: Section help you break down your project into meaningful segments. You can easily move tasks into Section or assign them to a Section while creating or editing the task. Section-Specific Views: Each Section has its own dedicated space where you can view all tasks under that Section—similar to how you'd manage at the project level. Independent Views and Controls: Within a Section, you can access: List View & Board View: Just like at the project level, tasks in a Section are displayed as a structured list or a card-based board. Dashboard: Each Section can have its own mini-dashboard to track progress and performance. Search, Filter, Sort, Group By & Customize: All the same options you have at the project level are available at the Section level, making it easy to drill down and manage tasks effectively. Section Actions: Similar to projects, Section have their own set of actions like editing, renaming, and deleting. ✅ Pro Tip: Section help keep your projects tidy and make it easier to focus on specific parts of a project without distraction from unrelated tasks.
In 5day.io, you can easily hide or show sections in the structure view to keep your workspace organized and focused. Here’s how to manage section visibility:

Open the Project: Click on the project where the section is located. View Section List: You’ll see a list of all sections within the project. Open the Three-Dot Menu: Next to each section name, click on the three-dot menu (⋮). Hide the Section: Select Hide in Structure View from the menu to hide the section. Show the Section Again: If the section is hidden, the same menu will display Show in Structure View. Click it to make the section visible again.

Expand the Project: Click the arrow icon next to the project name to expand and see all sections. Open the Three-Dot Menu: Next to each section, click the three-dot menu (⋮). Hide the Section: Select Hide in Structure View to hide the section. To Show the Section Again: When you want to make the hidden section visible again, follow Option 1 above. Go into the project, view the list of sections, and from the three-dot menu next to the hidden section, select Show in Structure View.

The Section Details in 5day.io provide a complete snapshot of a section’s key metrics and information. Key Attributes Status Displays the current status of the section: New In Progress Completed Total Tasks Shows the total number of tasks within the section. Total Estimation Displays the combined estimated effort for all tasks in the section. If task estimations (in hours) are added, they are shown here. If Story Points are enabled (e.g., via Sprint Management or as a separate feature), the cumulative story points are also displayed. Users can toggle between time and story points using the available icons. Progress Shows the percentage of tasks completed, automatically calculated based on task completion status. Remaining Work Displays the remaining effort: Shown in hours if using time-based tracking. Shown in story points if story points are enabled and selected. Completed Work Shows the completed effort: Displayed in hours or story points, depending on your selected view. Description A free-text field where you can add notes, context, or any additional details about the section. Note: For Total Estimation, Remaining Work, and Completed Work, you’ll find icons that let you toggle between viewing data in hours (time) or story points. This flexibility helps teams monitor progress using the metric that best aligns with their workflow.
You can access Section Details in 5day.io in two simple ways:

Open the Project: Click on the project where the section is located. View Section List: You’ll see a list of all sections within the project. Click 'Show Details': Next to each section name, there is a Show Details button. Click this button to open and view the section details.

Open the Project: Click on the project where you want to view section details. Expand the Section List: Use the arrow icon beside the project name to expand and view all sections. Access the Menu: Next to each section, you’ll see a three-dot menu (⋮). Click 'Section Details': From the menu, select Section Details to view detailed information for that section.

The Account Settings section in 5day.io is your organization’s central command hub. It’s where you manage and configure everything related to how your workspace functions — from organizational identity to security, user access, and billing. ✅ Think of Account Settings as the control panel for everything organization-wide in 5day.io.

To access your organization’s account settings in 5day.io: Click on your profile icon in the top or bottom navigation bar (depending on your layout). From the dropdown menu, select Account Settings. In the menu, click on the General tab. Once you click on General, you will see your organization’s account settings page, where you can update your account name, description, logo, and other organizational-level details. ✅ Only users with the appropriate access (like Account Owner, Admin, or users with Account Settings manage-level permission) will be able to view or make changes here. From here, you can navigate to other key settings like People, Security & Permissions, Integrations, Billing, and more.

To access your Account Profile: Click on your Profile Icon located at the bottom-left corner of the navigation panel. From the menu that appears, select Account Settings. Inside Account Settings, click on the General tab. Under General, you will find the option for Account Profile. Click on Account Profile to view and manage: Profile Settings (Account Name, Country, Description, Logo, etc.) Display Settings (Time Zone, Language, Layout, Theme, etc.)

Account Profile The Account Profile section in 5day.io is where the Account Owner (or Admins with appropriate permissions) can manage the organisation account level information and can configure how the 5day.io environment looks and behaves for all users across the organization. When a user logs in as an Account Owner, they can access the Account Profile to configure essential details that define the identity, preferences, and appearance of their 5day.io account. The Account Profile is divided into two main sections: Profile Display Each section allows the Account Owner to control different aspects of the account’s setup. The Account Profile is divided into two main sections: Profile Display Each section allows the Account Owner to control different aspects of the account’s setup.

In the Profile section, the Account Owner can manage the organization’s identity and ownership settings. User can: Set Account Name – Define or update the name of your organization as it will appear across the system. Add/Update Country – Specify the country your organization is based in to. View Account URL – See the unique URL assigned to your account. Add/Update Description – Provide a description about your organization or how the account is used. Upload Organization Logo – Add your organization's logo for better branding across the platform. View Account Owner Details – See current account owner information. Change Account Owner – Transfer ownership to another user if necessary.

In the Display section, the Account Owner can configure how the 5day.io environment looks and behaves for all users across the organization. You can set: Default Time Zone – Set the standard time zone for your organization’s work. Default Language – View the language for your account interface. Time Format – Select 12-hour or 24-hour clock format. Date Format – Choose how dates are displayed (e.g., DD/MM/YYYY, MM/DD/YYYY). Duration Format – Define how durations are displayed across worklogs and tasks: Clock (hh:mm) – e.g., 5 hours 30 minutes → 05:30 Days (dd.dd) – e.g., 2.5 days → 2.50 Days, Hours, Minutes (2d 5h 30m) – e.g., 2 days 5 hours 30 minutes → 2d 5h 30m Hours (hh.hh) – e.g., 5.5 hours → 5.50 Hours, Minutes (5h 30m) – e.g., 5 hours 30 minutes → 5h 30m Day Configuration– – Define how many hours are considered a full working day. For example, if you set Day Configuration = 8h, then 8 hours will equal 1 full working day across timesheets. Skin (Theme) – Choose a color scheme or theme for your account's look and feel. Layout – Select between: Left Navigation (sidebar menu) Top Navigation (horizontal top bar menu) These display preferences apply at the organizational level and affect the overall experience for all users inside the account.

To change the Account Owner in 5day.io, users must go to their Account Profile. (Learn how to access your Account Profile Inside the Account Profile: Click on the Profile tab. Under the Account Owner section, you will see the current account owner's name along with the option to Change Owner. Click on the Change Owner button. You will now have two options: Select from Existing Members: A list of all active members will appear. You can select an existing member from this list to make them the new account owner. Invite a Member via Email: If the person you want to assign as the new owner is not already part of your account, click on Invite a Member via Email. Enter the email address of the new member. Once they accept the invitation and join, you can select them as the new account owner. After selecting or inviting the new owner, confirm the change to complete the process.
documents.s: How to Change the Account Owner

documents.t: To change the organization logo in 5day.io, users need to go to their Account Profile. Inside the Account Profile: Click on the Display tab. In the Display tab, you will see the current Organization Logo. Hover over the logo — a pencil (edit) icon will appear. Click on the pencil icon to open logo options. You will see two options: Change Image – Upload a new logo from your computer. Remove Image – Remove the current logo if you want to clear it. After uploading the new image, simply submit to save the changes.

In 5day.io, you can create custom work schedules to define working hours, hybrid work models, and holidays for your team. You can either create a new schedule from scratch or duplicate an existing one to save time.

Go to Work Schedule: Navigate to Account Settings → General → Work Schedule. Click on Add: Inside the Work Schedule section, click the Add button next to the list of existing work schedules to start creating a new one. Enter Work Schedule Name: Give your new work schedule a meaningful name (e.g., "Regular Working Hours" or "US Hybrid Team"). Set as Default (Optional): Enable this option if you want this schedule to become the organization's default working schedule. Define Work Days and Settings: Start of Calendar Week: Choose between Monday or Sunday. Enable Hybrid Work: Assign work location (Home or Office) per day. Optionally allow members to update their hybrid working status manually. Enable or Disable Working Days: Select the days that are active (e.g., Monday–Friday). Set Start and End Times: Define working hours for each active day. Set Daily Location (if Hybrid is Enabled): Choose Office or Home for each working day. Add Holidays: Switch to the Holidays tab. Click Add Holiday, and define the Holiday Name and Holiday Date. Auto-Save: As you set up your work schedule, all changes are automatically saved. No need to manually click any Save button.

If you already have a work schedule similar to the one you need, you can simply duplicate it and make changes instead of creating a new one from scratch. Here’s how: Go to Work Schedule: Navigate to Account Settings → General → Work Schedule. Find the Schedule to Duplicate: Locate the existing work schedule you want to copy. Click the Three-Dot Menu (⋮): Next to the schedule name, click on the three dots. Select Duplicate: Click on the Duplicate option from the menu. Edit the Duplicated Work Schedule: The duplicated schedule will appear immediately. You can modify the work days, hours, hybrid settings, and holidays as needed. Update the Work Schedule Name to reflect the new schedule. All edits are automatically saved as you make changes.

In 5day.io, the Data Import feature allows users to import people and tasks in bulk to save time and streamline onboarding or migration from other systems. Whether you're importing 10 users or 100, or migrating large task lists into projects — the process is simple, efficient, and trackable.
People Import: Add multiple users at once into your organization. Task Import: Bulk upload tasks into specific projects.

Go to Work Schedule: Navigate to Account Settings → General → Work Schedule. Find the Work Schedule to Delete: In the list of work schedules, locate the one you want to remove. Click the Three-Dot Menu (⋮):\ IMAGE​ Next to the work schedule name, click on the three-dot menu icon. Select Delete: From the dropdown menu, click on the Delete option.
