Confirm Deletion: A confirmation box will appear asking if you are sure you want to delete the work schedule. Click Yes to confirm.
Next to the work schedule name, click on the three-dot menu icon.

You cannot delete a work schedule if it is currently marked as the default work schedule. If you want to delete a default schedule, first set another work schedule as the default, and then delete the intended one.

Go to Work Schedule: Navigate to Account Settings → General → Work Schedule. Select the Work Schedule to Edit: IMAGE​ From the list of work schedules, click on the name of the work schedule you want to update. Make Your Changes: Inside the selected work schedule, you will find two sections: Work Days Tab: Update working days (enable/disable specific days). Change start and end times for any day. Adjust hybrid work settings or work locations if needed. Holidays Tab: Add new holidays. Edit existing holidays (update name or date). Remove holidays if required. Auto-Save: All changes you make are automatically saved in real time. You do not need to manually click any Save button.
From the list of work schedules, click on the name of the work schedule you want to update.

In 5day.io, you can import multiple people in bulk at the account level using a structured Excel template. This is especially useful when onboarding an entire team or migrating users from another platform.

Go to Account Settings Navigate to the top menu and click Account Settings. Open Data Import History From the sidebar, click on Data Import History. Click + Import In the top-right, click the + Import button to start the import process. Select 'People' as Import Type A confirmation box will appear. Choose People as the data type you want to import. Download the Sample Template Click Download Sample File. The Excel file will contain: A Template sheet where you’ll enter the people data (e.g., name, email, role). A Guidelines sheet explaining the format and allowed values. Fill Out the Template File Enter the necessary details in the Template sheet. Refer to the Guidelines sheet to ensure accuracy and completeness. Upload and Import the File Once your file is ready, return to the import window in 5day.io. Click Upload from computer, select your completed Excel file, and click Import.

Once the import is complete, the import record will appear in the Data Import History table with key information such as: Date and Time Imported By Import Type (People) Status (Completed or Failed) Total Records Successful Imports Failed Records If there are failed records: You’ll see an error icon with the number of failed entries. Click the icon to download the failure file, which includes error messages explaining why each record failed. You can correct the file and re-import the failed records.
In 5day.io, you can import tasks in bulk to any project using a structured Excel template. This feature is especially useful when migrating tasks from spreadsheets or other tools.

Go to Account Settings Click on Data Import History from the sidebar. Click + Import A confirmation box will open. Choose Import Type and Project Select Task as the import type. Choose the Project where you want to import the tasks. Download the Sample File Click Download Sample File. The Excel file includes two sheets: Template: Where you’ll enter your task data (e.g., title, description, due date, assignee). Guidelines: Reference sheet explaining each column in the template. Fill Out the Template File Open the file and input your tasks in the Template sheet. Use the Guidelines sheet for field formats and required values. Upload and Import the File Once your file is ready, return to the import window in 5day.io. In the import popup, click Upload from computer and select your filled Excel file. Click Import to start the import process.

Once the file is processed, you’ll see it listed in the Data Import History table. You’ll be able to view: Date and Time of import File Name Imported By Import Type (Task) Status: (Completed or Failed) Total Records, Successful Imports, and Failed Records If any records failed: You can view the number of failed entries. Download the error file to see what went wrong and correct it. Re-upload the corrected file if needed.

Go to Account Settings: Click on your Profile Icon and select Account Settings. Open People Section: Inside Account Settings, click on the People tab to manage users. Click on Invite New: In the People section, click on the Invite New button. Choose How to Invite: You will see two fields to fill: Invite by Email: Enter the email address of the user you want to invite to the 5day.io account. Select Role: Choose the appropriate Role for the user (e.g., Account Admin, Manager, Member, External Member, Guest) depending on the level of access they require. Send the Invitation: Once you have entered the email address and selected the role, click on Invite. Email Confirmation: The invited user will receive an email invitation to join 5day.io. They will need to accept the invitation and complete their account setup. User Added: After accepting the invitation, the user will officially be added to your 5day.io account and assigned the selected role.

Who can Manage Account Profile? In 5day.io, access to the Account Profile is tightly controlled to maintain security and prevent unauthorized changes at the organization level. Here’s how access is managed:

Account Owners and Account Admin with the default system role have full access to the Account Profile. They can view and manage all sections including Profile and Display settings. No other roles (Manager, Member, External Member, Guest) are allowed to access Account Profile by default.

If your organization uses Custom Roles in 5day.io, access to the Account Profile can be configured through Global Permissions. Within the Global Permission settings: Under the Account Settings category, you will find three options: None – User cannot view or access account profile. View – User can only view the Account Profile (read-only access). Manage – User can fully manage and update the Account Profile. ✅ If a user’s custom role has "Manage" permission enabled under Account Settings, they will be able to: Access the Account Profile Edit Account Profile details (Account Name, Country, Description, Logo, etc.) Edit Display settings (Time Zone, Language, Layout, Theme, etc.)
documents.s: Access via Custom Roles and Permissions

documents.t: The People section in 5day.io is where you manage all users within your organization’s account. From the People section, you can: Invite a New User – Add new team members to your 5day.io account. View and Manage Profiles – Access user profile information. Bulk Import Users – Quickly upload multiple users at once through a bulk import feature. Remove Users – Remove people who are no longer part of the organization. Search for Users – Search users by Name, Email Address, or Account Role to quickly locate specific users. Filter Users – Apply filters to view users based on: Status: Invited, Active, Inactive, Created. Account Role: Account Owner, Account Admin, Manager, Member, External Member, Guest. Sort Users – Sort the list of users based on: Name Email Address All people management activities—adding, viewing, updating, and removing users—can be performed easily from this section.

To access and manage the People section in 5day.io: Go to Account Settings: Click on your Profile Icon and select Account Settings. Select People: IMAGE​ Inside Account Settings, click on the People option from the sidebar. Manage Users: After entering the People section, you will be able to: Invite new members View, edit, or deactivate user profiles Perform bulk imports Remove users if needed
documents.s: How to Access the People Section

documents.t: Go to Account Settings: Click on your Profile Icon at the bottom-left (or top navigation bar) and select Account Settings. Open People Section: IMAGE​ In Account Settings, click on the People tab to view all users added to your account. Locate the User to Remove: Browse the list of users and find the specific user you want to remove. Click the Three-Dot Menu (⋮): Next to the user’s name, click on the three-dot menu icon. Select Remove: IMAGE​ From the dropdown options, click on Remove. Confirm Removal: A confirmation prompt will appear. Confirm the action to permanently remove the user from your 5day.io account.

In 5day.io, Work Schedule is a feature that allows organizations to define the working structure for their members. It helps set up workdays, working hours, and location preferences (such as office or home), creating a clear expectation for when and where team members are available. With Work Schedule, you can customize: Working days Start and end times Hybrid work options (home or office) Calendar week start day Holidays Multiple work schedule options based on different needs (e.g., regular, hybrid, flexible)

The Work Schedule feature is available across all subscription plans in 5day.io. However, the number of work schedules you can create depends on your subscription plan: Subscription Plan Work Schedule Limit Free Plan Only Default Work Schedule is available Growth Plan Unlimited Work Schedules can be created Who Can Manage Work Schedule Account Owners and Account Admins with the default system roles can access and manage Work Schedules. Custom Role Users: Users who have been granted Manage rights under Account Settings in Global Permissions can also create, edit, and manage Work Schedules.

To access the Work Schedule in 5day.io: Click on your Profile Icon located at the bottom-left corner of the navigation panel. Select Account Settings from the menu. In Account Settings, click on the General tab. Under General, you will see the option for Work Schedule. Click on Work Schedule to view, create, or manage work schedules for your organization.

In 5day.io, the Account Admin is a key role responsible for managing users, workspace configuration, project operations, and platform-wide settings. Unlike the Account Owner, Account Admins do not have full access to subscription and billing. The Account Admin has full rights assigned by default across: Global Permissions (with limited access to Subscription & Billing) Feature Permissions (identical to Account Owner with minor display difference for Discussions and Files)

Manage (Global Permissions): "Manage" allows the user to fully view, configure, update, and control the corresponding account setting area. All (Feature Permissions): "All" means the user can view, add, edit, and delete any work item across the workspace, not just the ones assigned to or created by them. 🔵 Note: In the Account Admin role, the Subscription and Billing permission is limited to View access. 📖 For detailed explanations of "Manage," "All," "Owned," "Related," and other permission types, click here.

Feature View Access Add Access Edit Access Delete Access Other Actions Workspace All ✔️ All All Not Applicable Space All ✔️ All All Not Applicable Project All ✔️ All All Move (✔️) Section All ✔️ All All Not Applicable Task All ✔️ All All Move (✔️) Timesheet All ✔️ All All Approve Timesheet (✔️) Discussion ✔️ (Checkbox) ✔️ (Checkbox) Not Applicable File ✔️ (Checkbox) ✔️ (Checkbox) Not Applicable Note: In Discussions and Files, Edit and Delete access are automatically included when Add permission is enabled. ✅ In Discussions and Files, the user has only two options: View and Add (both via checkbox). Add access implies permission to comment, reply, edit own comments (in Discussions), and upload/manage own files (in Files).

In 5day.io, the Account Owner holds the highest level of authority across the platform. They have full control over account settings, workspace operations, user management, billing, security, and permissions. The Account Owner has full rights assigned by default across both: Global Permissions Feature Permissions

Manage (Global Permissions): "Manage" allows the user to fully view, configure, update, and control the corresponding account setting area. All (Feature Permissions): "All" means the user can view, add, edit, and delete any work item across the workspace, not just the ones assigned to or created by them.

Feature View Access Add Edit Access Delete Access Other Actions Workspace All ✔️ All All Not Applicable Space All ✔️ All All Not Applicable Project All ✔️ All All Move (✔️) Section All ✔️ All All Not Applicable Task All ✔️ All All Move (✔️) Timesheet All ✔️ All All Approve Timesheet (✔️) Discussion View ✔️ Not Applicable File View ✔️ Not Applicable Note: In Discussions and Files, Edit and Delete access are automatically included when Add permission is enabled.
Custom Roles in 5day.io allow you to define tailored access levels for different types of users, beyond the system-provided default roles. Note: Custom Roles are available only on the Growth Plan.

Navigate to Account Settings. IMAGE​ Click on Security & Permissions from the sidebar. Scroll down to the Custom Roles section. Click on the + Add button to create a new role. IMAGE​ A pop-up box will appear asking for two details: Role Name: Enter a name for the new role (e.g., Team Lead, Project Reviewer). Description (optional): Add a brief description explaining the purpose of this role. After entering the required details, click Create. ✅ Once created, the new role will appear under the Custom Roles list.

After creating a role, you need to define its permissions. Click on the newly created role from the Custom Roles list. IMAGE​ You will now see two permission sections: Global Permissions: Configure account-wide access such as Account Settings, People Management, etc. Feature Permissions: Configure specific permissions related to Workspaces, Projects, Tasks, Discussions, Files, etc. For each permission area: Choose the appropriate level (Manage, View, None for Global Permissions). Choose View/Add/Edit/Delete/Other settings for Feature Permissions. Any changes you make are automatically saved — no Save button is needed. ✅ Your custom role is now fully configured and ready to assign to users!
documents.s: Assign Permissions to the Custom Role

documents.t: 📖 For detailed explanations of Global Permissions and Feature Permissions, click here. Note: Creating the role (Name + Description) and assigning permissions are treated as two clean steps. Auto-save ensures your changes are instantly applied. Custom Roles give you complete flexibility in managing how users work inside 5day.io.

In addition to creating a custom role from scratch, 5day.io also allows you to create a custom role by duplicating an existing one. This is useful when you want to create a new role with similar permissions to an existing role, and just make minor changes.
documents.s: Create a Custom Role via the Duplicate Option

documents.t: Go to Account Settings. Click on Security & Permissions from the sidebar. Under the Roles & Permissions section, scroll to the Custom Roles list. Find the existing role you want to duplicate. IMAGE​ Click on the three-dot menu (⋮) next to the role. Select Duplicate from the menu options. ✅ A new duplicated role will be created immediately with the same permission settings.
documents.s: Steps to Duplicate a Custom Role:

documents.t: Click on the newly duplicated role from the list. IMAGE​ At the top, you’ll see a pencil (edit) icon next to the role name. Click the pencil icon to rename the role and update the description (optional). The system will ask for a confirmation before saving changes. Once confirmed, your duplicated role is successfully updated and ready to use.

You want to recreate a similar role without manually configuring permissions again. You want to speed up setup for departments or clients with slightly varied access. You’re modeling roles after existing defaults with only minor edits.
In 5day.io, you can delete any default or custom role, except for the Account Owner role. Note: The Account Owner role is mandatory and always assigned to at least one user, so it cannot be deleted.

Go to Account Settings. Click on Security & Permissions from the sidebar. IMAGE​ Under the Roles & Permissions section, you will see the list of all roles (both default and custom). Find the role you want to delete. Click on the three-dot menu (⋮) next to that role. Select Delete. A confirmation box will appear — click Confirm to proceed. ✅ Once confirmed, the role will be permanently deleted from your system.

You can delete both default and custom roles, except for the Account Owner role. You cannot delete a role if it is currently assigned to active users — reassign users to a different role before deletion. Deleting a role is permanent and cannot be undone.
In 5day.io, you can edit both default roles (like Manager, Member, Guest) and custom roles you've created to tailor access and permissions.
documents.s: How to Edit Default and Custom Roles

documents.t: Go to Account Settings. Click on Security & Permissions from the sidebar. IMAGE​ Under the Roles & Permissions section: You will see a list of all Default Roles provided by the system. You will also see a list of all Custom Roles created in your account. Click on the role you want to edit. Inside the role: Update the Global Permissions (e.g., access to account settings, billing, integrations). Update the Feature Permissions (e.g., view, add, edit, delete rights for tasks, projects, discussions, etc.). ✅ All changes you make are automatically saved — no need to click a save button.

An External Member in 5day.io is typically a contractor, vendor, or freelancer who is granted limited access to collaborate on specific tasks or projects. They can view or work on items assigned to them, but do not have administrative access or broader visibility. The External Member role includes: No Global Permissions Feature Permissions limited to assigned or owned items
📖 For detailed explanations of "Manage," "All," "Owned," "Related," and other permission types, click here.

Feature View Access Add Access Edit Access Delete Access Other Actions Workspace View Related ❌ None None Not Applicable Space View Related ❌ None None Not Applicable Project View Related ❌ None None ❌ Move Section Not Applicable ❌ None None Not Applicable Task View Related ❌ Assigned None ❌ Move Timesheet Owned ❌ Owned Owned ❌ Approve Timesheet Discussion ✔️ ✔️ Not Applicable File ✔️ ✔️ Not Applicable Note: In Discussions and Files, Edit and Delete access are automatically included when Add permission is enabled.

Global permissions control access to account-wide administrative areas like Settings, People Management, Billing, Security, Integrations, and Custom Fields. Option Meaning View Allows the user to view and read the settings but does not allow them to make changes. Manage Allows the user to fully modify, update, and configure the settings. None User cannot view or access the settings at all.

Feature permissions control access to work management areas like Workspaces, Spaces, Projects, Tasks, Timesheets, Discussions, and Files. Permission Type Options Description View (All / View Related) View All Allows the user to view all items across the account. View Related Allows the user to view only items where they are directly assigned or associated (e.g., as Workspace Owner, Project Owner, or Task Assignee). Add Checkbox (Allow/Not Allow) Allows the user to create new items (e.g., Workspaces, Projects, Tasks, Timesheets). Edit (All / Owned / Related / None) Edit All Allows the user to edit all items across the workspace. Edit Owned Allows the user to edit items they have created. Edit Related Allows the user to edit items where they are assigned. None The user cannot edit any items. Delete (All / Owned / Related / None) Delete All Allows the user to delete any item across the workspace. Delete Owned Allows the user to delete any item where they are assigned as the Owner of that item. Delete Related Allows the user to delete items where they are assigned. None The user cannot delete any items. Other (Specific to certain features) Move (for Projects and Tasks) Allows the user to move a Project between Spaces and a Task between Projects or Sections. Approve Timesheet (for Timesheets) Allows the user to approve or reject submitted timesheets. Discussion Permissions View Allows the user to view the Discussion panel and read comments. Add Allows the user to add new comments, edit and delete their own comments, and reply to any existing comments. Files Permissions View Allows the user to view the Files and see uploaded files. Upload Allows the user to upload new files and delete files they uploaded. Project Owners and Account Owners can delete any uploaded files. ✅ Note: Some features like Projects and Tasks have an "Other" category (Move permission). Timesheets have an additional "Approve Timesheet" action under "Other".

The Guest role in 5day.io is designed for external users, such as clients or consultants, who need limited access to specific projects or tasks they’ve been invited to. Guests typically have view-only access and cannot create or edit work. They are ideal for stakeholders who only need to monitor progress.
📖 For detailed explanations of "Manage," "All," "Owned," "Related," and other permission types, click here.

The Security and Permissions section in 5day.io allows organizations to control access and manage user roles across the platform. Through this section, users can: View Default Roles provided by the system, such as: Account Owner Account Admin Manager Member External Member Guest Review Role Permissions For each role, users can see a granular breakdown of what access is granted, categorized into: Global Permissions – Access to core administrative areas like Account Settings, People Management, Billing, Security, Integrations, and Templates. Feature Permissions – Access to day-to-day work areas like Workspaces, Projects, Sections, Tasks, Timesheets, Discussions, and Files. Create and Manage Custom Roles Organizations on eligible plans (e.g., Growth Plan) can go beyond default roles and create Custom Roles tailored to their own permission requirements. This allows fine-grained control over who can view, add, edit, delete, or perform special actions (like moving tasks or approving timesheets) across different modules.

The Roles and Permissions feature is available across all subscription plans in 5day.io. However, the ability to create Custom Roles depends on your subscription plan. Subscription Plan Roles Available Free Plan Access to Default Roles only: Account Owner, Account Admin, Manager, Member, External Member, Guest. Growth Plan Access to both Default Roles and the ability to create Custom Roles as needed.

In 5day.io, the Manager leads teams or projects with the ability to assign tasks, manage team workflows, and oversee project delivery. Managers are empowered to collaborate and track work, but they do not have access to sensitive administrative settings or billing information. The Manager role includes: Limited Global Permissions Feature Permissions focused on managing assigned work
📖 For detailed explanations of "Manage," "All," "Owned," "Related," and other permission types, click here.

In 5day.io, a Member is a regular user who collaborates on tasks and contributes to projects. They do not have access to administrative or account-level configuration but can participate in project execution and team workflows. The Member role includes: No Global Permissions Feature Permissions primarily focused on assigned or owned items
📖 For detailed explanations of "Manage," "All," "Owned," "Related," and other permission types, click here.

The Dashboard feature is available across all subscription plans. However, the number of widgets you can create in account varies by the subscription plan. Subscription Plan Number of Widgets Free 100 Widgets Growth 1000 Widgets

For permissions, refer Dashboard Views To create a new widget in your project or section dashboard: Navigate to the Dashboard View. Click the ‘Add Widget’ button. Provide a Widget Name. Select the desired Chart Type you wish to create the widget for. Configure the widget settings based on your requirements. A preview of the widget will be available after completing the configuration. Once satisfied, click on ‘Create Widget’. ✅ The newly created widget will appear at the last position of the Dashboard page. Quick Notes The type of Widget you can create depends on your subscription plan. The number of widgets you can create depends on your subscription plan. Always double-check before deleting important widgets, as deletion is irreversible.
For more details about widget types, refer Widget Type To explore filters, refer Widget Filters. To Edit the widget, refer Edit Widget.

A Bar Chart is a graphical representation used to compare data across different categories. A Chart can visually represent the tasks and subtasks, time entries allowing users to analyze and compare data based on task completion, time logged, or other key metrics. The chart uses rectangular bars with lengths proportional to the value they represent, offering insights into project progress, time allocation, and task-related data.
The Bar Chart is available across all subscription plans.

To configure the Bar Chart in the Dashboard, follow these steps: Navigate to the Dashboard module. Click on ‘Add Widget’. Enter a name for the widget. Select ‘Bar Chart’ from the available chart options. Adjust the configuration settings according to your preferences: Choose whether to include subtasks or not. Set the Group By field (e.g., Task, User, Date, etc.). Select the Measure for aggregating data (e.g., Sum, Average, etc.). Once configured, save your settings to view the updated Bar Chart.

The Bar Chart configuration is divided into two primary categories for setup: Task: Visualizes task-related data. Timesheet: Focuses on timesheet entries and time-related data. Here’s a detailed breakdown of the configuration settings for both charts: Field Name Settings Description Based On Task and Subtask Defines the dataset on which the bar chart will be produced. This can include both tasks and subtasks. Include Subtask Yes/No Determines if subtasks should be included in the chart data. If selected, subtasks will be considered in the widget. Group By X-Axis (e.g. Date, User, Status etc.) Defines the X-Axis on which the data will be plotted (e.g., by task status, assigned user, or date). Measure Sum, Min, Max, Avg of Estimation, Logged Hours, Story Points, Task ID Defines how the data will be aggregated on the Y-Axis. Users can choose between Sum, Minimum, Maximum, or Average. Sort Label, Value Defines how the data should be sorted. Users can choose to sort based on the X-axis or Y-axis values. Order By Ascending, Descending Specifies the order in which the chart data should be displayed, either in ascending or descending order. Format of Bar Chart The Format settings let you tweak how the Bar Chart looks and feels. Make it match your style or highlight what matters most. Field Name Settings Description Show Tooltip Yes/No Turn this on to see a quick pop-up with exact numbers when you hover over a bar. Legend Position None/Top/Bottom/Left/Right Pick where the legend (the little labels explaining colors) sits on the chart. Orientation Vertical/Horizontal Choose if bars run up-down (columns) or left-right whichever fits your data better. Color Picker Color selection Click to pick any color for the bars. Make key categories stand out or match your team branding.

For more details about Widget Types , refer Widget Types For more details about Line Chart, refer Chart Types - Line Chart For more details about Pie Chart, refer Chart Types - Pie Chart For more details about Doughnut Chart, refer Chart Types - Doughnut Chart For more details about Number Chart, refer Chart Types - Number Chart For more details about Table View, refer Chart Types - Table View

A Doughnut Chart is a variation of a Pie Chart where the center is cut out, creating a doughnut-like shape. A Chart represents the proportion of tasks, logged hours, or time entries, making it easier to visualize parts of a whole. The chart offers a clear and aesthetic way to show distributions while allowing additional information to be displayed at the center if needed. It provides insights into how work is divided across users, statuses, projects, or other categories.
The Chart Type – Doughnut Chart is available across all subscription plans.

To configure the Doughnut Chart in the Dashboard, follow these steps: Navigate to the Dashboard module. Click on ‘Add Widget’. Enter a name for the widget. Select ‘Doughnut Chart’ from the available chart options. Adjust the configuration settings according to your preferences: Choose whether to include subtasks or not. Set the Group By field (e.g., Task, User, Status, etc.). Select the Measure for calculating data distribution (e.g., Sum, Count, etc.). Once configured, save your settings to view the updated Doughnut Chart.

The Doughnut Chart configuration is divided into two primary categories for setup: Task: Visualizes task-related data. Timesheet: Focuses on timesheet entries and time-related data. Here’s a detailed breakdown of the configuration settings for both charts: Field Name Settings Description Based On Task and Subtask Defines the dataset on which the doughnut chart will be produced. This can include both tasks and subtasks. Include Subtask Yes/No Determines if subtasks should be included in the chart data. If selected, subtasks will be considered in the widget. Group By Category (e.g. User, Status, dates etc.) Defines how the data will be grouped into different segments of the doughnut. Measure Sum, Count of Estimation, Logged Hours, Story Points, Task ID Defines how the size of each segment will be calculated. Users can choose between Sum or Count based on the selected field. Sort Label, Value Defines how the segments should be ordered, either by label (name) or value (size). Order By Ascending, Descending Specifies the order in which segments are displayed in the chart. Format of Doughnut Chart The Format settings let you tweak how the Doughnut Chart looks and grabs attention. Play with it to highlight big slices or keep the whole thing neat. Field Name Settings Description Show Tooltip Yes/No Turn on to see a pop-up with exact values when you hover over a slice. Legend Position None/Top/Bottom/Left/Right Choose where the legend (color labels) sits around the doughnut. Color Picker Color Selection Pick custom colors for each slice—make important ones stand out or match your team colors.

For more details about Widget Types , refer Widget Types For more details about Pie Chart, refer Chart Types - Bar Chart For more details about Line Chart, refer Chart Types - Pie Chart For more details about Doughnut Chart, refer Chart Types - Line Chart For more details about Number Chart, refer Chart Types - Number Chart For more details about Table View, refer Chart Types - Table View

A Line Chart is a graphical representation that displays information as a series of data points connected by straight lines. It is useful for tracking changes over periods of time or comparing different sets of related data such as time entries, tasks, and subtasks. Line Charts help users monitor trends, performance, and project progress through continuous data visualization. The chart highlights patterns in project timelines, logged hours, and task updates.
The Chart Type – Line Chart is available across all subscription plans.

To configure the Line Chart in the Dashboard, follow these steps: Navigate to the Dashboard module. Click on ‘Add Widget’. Enter a name for the widget. Select ‘Line Chart’ from the available chart options. Adjust the configuration settings according to your preferences: Choose whether to include subtasks or not. Set the Group By field (e.g., Task, User, Date, etc.). Select the Measure for aggregating data (e.g., Sum, Average, etc.). Once configured, save your settings to view the updated Line Chart.

The Line Chart configuration is divided into two primary categories for setup: Task: Visualizes task-related data. Timesheet: Focuses on timesheet entries and time-related data. Here’s a detailed breakdown of the configuration settings for both charts: Field Name Settings Description Based On Task and Subtask Defines the dataset on which the line chart will be produced. This can include both tasks and subtasks. Include Subtask Yes/No Determines if subtasks should be included in the chart data. If selected, subtasks will be considered in the widget. Group By X-Axis (e.g. Date, User, Status etc.) Defines the X-Axis on which the data will be plotted (e.g., by task status, assigned user, or date). Measure Sum, Min, Max, Avg of Estimation, Logged Hours, Story Points, Task ID Defines how the data will be aggregated on the Y-Axis. Users can choose between Sum, Minimum, Maximum, or Average. Sort Label, Value Defines how the data should be sorted. Users can choose to sort based on the X-axis or Y-axis values. Order By Ascending, Descending Specifies the order in which the chart data should be displayed, either in ascending or descending order. Format of Line Chart The Format settings let you shape how the Pie Chart looks and pops. Tweak it to spotlight key slices or fit your vibe. Field Name Settings Description Show Tooltip Yes/No Turn on to see a pop-up with exact values when you hover over the line. Legend Position None/Top/Bottom/Left/Right Pick where the legend (color labels for each line) appears around the chart. Color Picker Color Selection Choose a custom color for the line—help key data stand out or match your project style

For more details about Widget Types , refer Widget Types For more details about Pie Chart, refer Chart Types - Bar Chart For more details about Line Chart, refer Chart Types - Pie Chart For more details about Doughnut Chart, refer Chart Types - Doughnut Chart For more details about Number Chart, refer Chart Types - Number Chart For more details about Table View, refer Chart Types - Table View

A Number Chart is a simple, focused visualization that displays a single key metric as a prominent number. A Chart is used to highlight important values such as total tasks, hours logged, completed story points, or any critical project metric. It provides a quick snapshot of important data without requiring detailed analysis, helping users monitor KPIs at a glance. The Number Chart emphasizes clarity and simplicity, making it ideal for dashboards focused on metrics.
The Chart Type – Number Chart is available across all subscription plans.

To configure the Number Chart in the Dashboard, follow these steps: Navigate to the Dashboard module. Click on ‘Add Widget’. Enter a name for the widget. Select ‘Number Chart’ from the available chart options. Adjust the configuration settings according to your preferences: Choose whether to include subtasks or not. Select the Measure for calculating the number (e.g., Sum, Average, Count, etc.). Set a Label for the number to describe what it represents. Once configured, save your settings to view the updated Number Chart.

The Number Chart configuration is divided into two primary categories for setup: Task: Visualizes task-related data. Timesheet: Focuses on timesheet entries and time-related data. Here’s a detailed breakdown of the configuration settings for both charts: Field Name Settings Description Based On Task and Subtask Defines the dataset on which the number will be produced. This can include both tasks and subtasks. Include Subtask Yes/No Determines if subtasks should be included in the chart data. If selected, subtasks will be considered in the widget. Measure Sum, Min, Max, Avg, Count of Estimation, Logged Hours, Story Points, Task ID Defines the calculation method for the number shown. Users can choose aggregation based on their focus (e.g., total hours, number of tasks). Label Text input Defines the label that will be displayed alongside the number to explain what the number represents. Format of Number Chart The Format settings let you control how the Number Chart looks and hits home. Tweak it to make the big number pop or keep it simple. Field Name Settings Description Color Picker Color Selection Pick the color for the number and label—make it bold for alerts or calm for regular stats.

A Pie Chart is a circular statistical graphic that is divided into slices to illustrate numerical proportions. A Chart represents task distributions, logged hours, or time entries in a visual, percentage-based format. It helps users quickly understand the breakdown of different segments, such as project tasks or user contributions, at a glance. Each slice of the pie represents a category's contribution relative to the total dataset.
The Chart Type – Pie Chart is available across all subscription plans.

To configure the Pie Chart in the Dashboard, follow these steps: Navigate to the Dashboard module. Click on ‘Add Widget’. Enter a name for the widget. Select ‘Pie Chart’ from the available chart options. Adjust the configuration settings according to your preferences: Choose whether to include subtasks or not. Set the Group By field (e.g., Task, User, Status, etc.). Select the Measure for calculating data distribution (e.g., Sum, Count, etc.). Once configured, save your settings to view the updated Pie Chart.

This can include both tasks and subtasks. Include Subtask Yes/No Determines if subtasks should be included in the chart data. If selected, subtasks will be considered in the widget. Group By Category (e.g. User, Status, Project, etc..) Defines how the data will be grouped into different slices of the pie. Measure Sum, Count of Estimation, Logged Hours, Story Points, Task ID Defines how the size of each pie slice will be calculated. Users can choose between Sum or Count based on the selected field. Sort Label, Value Defines how the slices should be ordered, either by label (name) or value (size). Order By Ascending, Descending Specifies the order in which slices are displayed in the chart. The Dashboard feature is available across all subscription plans. However, the number of widgets you can create in account varies by the subscription plan. Subscription Plan Number of Widgets Free 100 Widgets Growth 1000 Widgets 📢 Note: Widgets are flexible and allow teams to track different types of project metrics based on needs.

Access to create, edit, or delete widgets in the Project/Section Dashboard is based on project-level permissions. Project Permission Level Description Edit - None User cannot configure any widget for the project/section. Edit - Owned User can manage the dashboard only for projects where they are the Project Owner. Edit - Related User can manage the dashboard for projects where they are either the Project Owner or a Project Member. Edit - All User can manage the dashboard for all projects in the workspace. ✅ Users with relevant permissions can add, modify, or remove widgets within the dashboard to customize their project view as needed.

By default, in all projects & section; dashboard view is enable. Follow these simple steps to manage the visibility of dashboard view in project/section views panel. Navigate to the specific Project -> Settings from the left sidebar. Select the Views. Locate Dashboard View. You can enable/disable view. You can also change the order of the view to display in project views panel.

Follow these simple steps to access and manage the Dashboard in 5day.io. Navigate to the Projects list from the left sidebar. Select the specific Project/Section you want to open. In the project/section views, switch to "Dashboard" view using the view selector. You can now add, edit, or delete widgets within the project or section dashboard based on your permissions.

For permissions, refer Dashboard Views To delete an existing widget: Navigate to the Dashboard View. Click the Edit Dashboard button located at the top right corner. (This will enable dashboard editing mode) Hover over the widget you wish to delete - you will see a Delete option at the top right. Click on Delete. A confirmation screen will appear for you to confirm the deletion. Upon confirmation, the widget will be permanently deleted from the Dashboard. ✅ Deleted widgets cannot be recovered once removed.
To create a new widget, refer Add Widget

For permissions, refer Dashboard Views To edit an existing widget: Locate the widget you want to modify on the Dashboard. Hover over the widget - at the top-right corner, you will see a ‘Manage’ option. Click ‘Manage’ to open the widget's configuration settings. Make the necessary changes to the configuration. After editing, click on ‘Update Widget’ to save your changes. ✅ The widget will immediately update on the Dashboard based on the new settings.
For more details about widget types, refer Widget Type To explore filters, refer Widget Filters To Delete the widget, refer Delete Widget

The Move Widget feature allows you to reposition widgets on your dashboard based on your layout preferences. To move a widget: Enable Edit mode by clicking the Edit Dashboard option. Hover over the widget you want to move. Drag the widget to your desired position on the dashboard. Release the widget to place it. The new position will be updated and auto-saved instantly. Quick Note You can rearrange multiple widgets easily to customize the dashboard view that best suits your project or team needs.

The Dashboard in 5day.io acts as a powerful visual workspace that brings together key project and section-level insights in one view. Each Project and Section inside 5day.io has a dedicated Dashboard view where users can track important data points through customizable widgets. The Dashboard is configurable based on the project settings and helps teams monitor progress, tasks, timelines, and more without navigating away from the project. Users can add multiple widgets within a dashboard to create personalized, dynamic views.

The Dashboard is the command center of your project. It eliminates scattered data across tabs, emails, or spreadsheets by surfacing real-time metrics exactly where decisions are made. Instant clarity: See project health, upcoming deadlines, and workload distribution at a glance- reducing status meetings by up to 40 %. Proactive risk detection: Spot overdue tasks, blocked dependencies, or budget overruns before they escalate. Team alignment: Every stakeholder - from PMs to executives - views the same live truth, fostering accountability and faster iterations. Focus over noise: Filter out irrelevant details and highlight only the KPIs that drive your delivery cycles.

Drag-and-drop layout: Click and pull any widget to move it, or resize it. Section-level dashboards: Each Section in a Project has its own Dashboard, and you can pick different widgets or layouts for each. Real-time sync: Every task update, or date change shows up instantly on the widget. Widget formatting: Change colors, pick chart styles, or switch between list and graph views inside any widget.

A Widget is a customizable building block used inside a Dashboard to display specific project or section related information in a visual format. Widgets help users quickly monitor progress, track key metrics, and analyse important project activities without navigating through detailed pages. Each widget can be configured to show task lists, timelines, status charts, workload summaries, and many more. Widgets provide real-time, dynamic data updates based on the project or section activities. Users can add multiple widgets to a single Dashboard, creating a personalized workspace for better decision-making.

Widget type: Choose from line chart, bar chart, doughnut chart, pie chart, number chart, or table. You can set up each one to show the exact data you need. Filters: Narrow down what shows up - like only tasks for specific person, certain statuses, or due date range. Custom Layout: Switch colors, flip between list or graph. Refresh: Widgets update live as things change, or hit the refresh button if you want the latest right now. Subscription limits: Add as many widgets as your plan allows; upgrade if you need more.
To create a new widget, refer Add Widget To explore widget types, refer Widget Types

Refreshing ensures that your dashboard displays the most up-to-date information from your projects and sections. 5day.io offers two ways to refresh the dashboard: Full Dashboard Refresh: Refresh the entire dashboard at once, updating all widgets simultaneously with the latest data. Individual Widget Refresh: Hover over a specific widget to reveal the Refresh icon. Clicking this icon will refresh only that widget, allowing you to update individual components without reloading the whole dashboard.

The Resize Widget feature allows you to adjust the size of widgets to better fit your data visualization needs. To resize a widget: Enable Edit mode by clicking the Edit Dashboard option. Hover over the widget you want to resize. Drag the edges or corners of the widget to expand or collapse its size. Release once you achieve the preferred size. The new size will be auto-saved immediately. Quick Note Resizing is helpful for creating a cleaner and more organized dashboard, highlighting larger charts or minimizing widgets that require less space.

In 5day.io, every widget supports the ability to filter data based on your specific requirements. Filters help users to refine and customize the information displayed in charts and reports, making it easier to focus on particular section, users, statuses, dates, or any other data points available in the system. Filters are flexible and can be applied across all widgets - Bar Chart, Line Chart, Pie Chart, Doughnut Chart, Number Chart, and Table View.

Filters can be applied based on any field in 5day.io. Multiple filters can be combined to create complex conditions. Filters are dynamic and can be modified anytime without changing the underlying data. The widget refreshes instantly to reflect the filtered dataset.

Navigate to the Dashboard from Project Views. Create a new widget or edit an existing one. In the widget configuration panel, locate the Filters section. Click on Add Filter. Select any available field offered by 5day.io (e.g., Section, Assignee, Status, Date, Logged Hours, Tags, Custom Fields, etc.). Define the filter condition (e.g., equals, contains, greater than, less than, between, etc.). To add more conditions, click + Add Filter again. After configuring the filters, click Create Widget/Update Widget to apply them to your widget. The widget will now display the data according to the applied filters.

Widgets in 5day.io are categorized based on the type of data you visualize. Tasks Time Entries Sprints Each widget type helps you to quickly monitor different aspects of project performance and team productivity. Depending on what information you want to analyze, you can choose the appropriate widget type and customize its display. This structure ensures that you can access actionable insights in an intuitive, organized manner.

Task Widgets allow you to visualize the status, progress, and distribution of tasks within a project or section. These widgets help you track overdue tasks, monitor task priorities, view completion rates, and many more. You can use various chart types like Pie Charts, Bar Charts, Line Charts, doughnut Charts, Number Charts and Table views. Bar Chart for Tasks: Displays task data using horizontal or vertical bars to easily compare quantities across different categories. Line Chart for Tasks: Shows task trends over time by connecting data points with a continuous line, ideal for tracking progress. Pie Chart for Tasks: Represents task distribution as slices of a circle, helping visualize proportions of different statuses or priorities. Doughnut Chart for Tasks: A circular chart similar to a pie chart, but with a hollow center, offering a cleaner look for task breakdowns. Number Chart for Tasks: Highlights a key metric as a single, bold number — like total tasks, completed tasks, or overdue tasks. Table view for Tasks: Organizes task details in a structured table format for easy sorting, filtering, and comparison.

Timesheet Widgets focus on time tracking and work hours logged by team members. These widgets help you monitor billable hours, non-billable efforts, and overall team utilization effectively. Popular chart types for Timesheet Widgets include Bar Charts, Pie Charts, and Summary Tables. Bar Chart for Time Entries - A visual representation of time entries using horizontal or vertical bars to compare different time data. Line Chart for Time Entries - A chart that displays time entries as data points connected by lines, showing trends over a period. Pie Chart for Time Entries - A circular chart divided into sectors representing the proportion of time entries relative to a whole. Doughnut Chart for Time Entries - A variation of the pie chart with a central hole, used to display the percentage distribution of time entries. Number Chart for Time Entries - A chart that shows the total or specific numerical value of time entries, typically represented in large numbers. Table view for Time Entries - A tabular representation of time entries with rows and columns, providing detailed data in a structured format.

Sprint Widgets are designed to track sprint progress, team velocity, and sprint goals for agile teams. These widgets are ideal for monitoring real-time agile delivery performance during a sprint. There are three key Sprint Widget types available: Sprint Burn Up Chart: Shows completed work compared to the total scope. Sprint Burn Down Chart: Displays remaining work over the sprint timeline. Velocity Chart: Visualizes the amount of work completed sprint-over-sprint. Quick Note Sprint charts are available at the Project Dashboard only and are not available at the Section Dashboard.

For more details about Bar Chart, refer Chart Types - Bar Chart For more details about Line Chart, refer Chart Types - Line Chart For more details about Pie Chart, refer Chart Types - Pie Chart For more details about Doughnut Chart, refer Chart Types - Doughnut Chart For more details about Number Chart, refer Chart Types - Number Chart For more details about Table View, refer Chart Types - Table View

Global Search helps you quickly find anything within your 5day.io account—tasks, projects, and users—without navigating through multiple workspaces or menus. It provides a unified search panel so you can type a keyword and instantly locate relevant items across the entire system. Global Search is especially useful when you manage multiple projects and need to jump to a task or project quickly. You can also use it to look up users and view their details.

There are two ways to open Global Search: Using the Search Icon On the left navigation panel, click the Search icon. A search panel will open on the right side of the screen. Using the Hotkey Press s on your keyboard from anywhere in 5day.io to open Global Search instantly.

When you open Global Search: Only the search bar is visible initially. You must type at least two characters for the search to begin. Once results are available, the category tabs appear automatically: All Task Project User These tabs allow you to refine the scope of your search after results are displayed.
Enter at least two characters for the search to start. Results refresh automatically as soon as you meet the minimum character requirement.

When you open the search panel, it is always set to All. In this mode, 5day.io searches across: Tasks Projects Users All matching results across these three categories will appear together in a combined list.
You can narrow down your results by selecting a specific tab:

When you click the Task tab: The search will return only tasks and subtasks that match your keyword. Each result shows: Task title Task icon and type Status Project details Assignee avatar/image (if any) Due date (if available) Navigation: Clicking a task result will take you directly to the task details page.

When you click the Project tab: The search will return only projects that match your keyword. Each result shows: Project name Project status Workspace and space name Project owner avatar/image Navigation: Clicking a project result will take you directly to that project.

When you click the User tab: The search will return only users whose name or email address matches your keyword. Each user result shows: User avatar Full name Email ID Current status (e.g., Available/Offline) Navigation: Navigation is not applicable for user results.

Notifications in 5day.io help you stay updated on everything important across your projects, tasks, timesheets, reminders, and other activities. The notifications panel shows all alerts in one place so you can quickly review updates, mark them as read, or clear them as needed. Each notification includes relevant details and quick actions that help you stay updated. You can also manage how and where you receive notifications by accessing Notification Settings.
Notifications are available for all subscription plans of 5day.io.

There are two ways to open Notifications: Using the Primary Navigation Panel Click the bell icon on the navigation panel to open your Notifications panel. Using Hotkeys Press n on your keyboard to instantly open Notifications from anywhere in 5day.io.
The Notifications panel is designed to give users a clean, organized, and actionable way to manage all incoming alerts. Below are all the available options:

At the top of the notifications panel, you will see two filter options: All Displays every notification you have received. Only unread Shows only notifications that have not been read or marked as read. This helps you quickly focus on pending updates.
documents.s: 1. View All Notifications or Only Unread

documents.t: Each notification has a “Mark as Read” action. How it works: When you hover over a notification, a small circular radio-button style icon appears. Hover tooltip: “Mark as Read” Clicking the icon immediately marks that notification as read. The notification will no longer appear in the "Only unread" filter. This helps you keep your panel clean and acknowledge updates without clearing them.

Next to each notification, a Clear (x) icon appears on hover. Hover tooltip: “Clear Notification” Clicking this removes the notification from your panel permanently. Use this when the notification is no longer required.
At the top-right corner of the panel, you will see the option: Clear All Clicking this will remove all notifications from your account in one action.

Each notification card displays: Notification title (e.g., Remind Your Team to Log Timesheet) The user or system that triggered the notification Additional details (task mentioned, task details, task updates, etc.) Timestamp indicating when the notification was generated

A gear icon is available on the Notifications panel. Clicking this icon opens the Notification Settings page, where you can control how notifications are configured for your own account. Each user can manage their notification preferences independently. Note​ Clearing or marking notifications as read does not affect project data—it only updates your personal notification center.

Quick Add is a feature in 5day.io that lets you swiftly create core entities—like workspaces, projects, sections, tasks, time entries, and reminders—without navigating away from your current screen. It enhances productivity by centralizing all creation actions into a single, easy-to-access drawer. Access to each option in Quick Add is determined by the user’s permission settings. Only the items a user has permission to create will be visible.

To open Quick Add: Navigate to the menu bar. Click the “+ Add” icon. You can also use the shortcut Shift + Q to instantly open Quick Add. IMAGE​ This will open the Quick Add drawer from the left, displaying all creation options available to the user.

Depending on your assigned permissions, you may be able to create the following: Workspace – Create a new workspace. Space – Add a space within a workspace to categorize related projects. Project – Start a new project under a selected space. Section – Create a section within a project to organize tasks. Task – Add a new task. Time Entry – Log hours manually for a task. Reminder – Set up a personal or task-linked reminder with a defined date and time. Note: The options displayed in the Quick Add panel are permissions-based. If an item is not visible (e.g., “Create Workspace” or “Add Reminder”), it means the user does not currently have permission to perform that action.
documents.s: What You Can Create with Quick Add

documents.t: The Connect command lets you link Microsoft Teams with your 5day.io account, unlocking real-time notifications and the ability to create tasks directly from any Teams chat. Once connected, the 5day.io bot will appear in your Teams environment, delivering all configured 5day.io alerts (task updates, due dates, comments, etc.) and enabling the create task command across 1:1 chats, group chats, and channels.

To use the integration, it must first be enabled in your 5day.io account by account owner/admin. By default, Teams integration is automatically enabled for all users if your plan supports it. Admins can restrict access per user or role in Roles and Permission. Once enabled, any authorized user can connect their personal Microsoft Teams account in just a few steps:

Open Microsoft Teams account -> Go to Apps In the left sidebar, click Apps (or search using the top search bar). Search for 5day.io and select the app. Click Add (or Add to a team if installing for a channel). Receive Welcome Message After installation, you’ll get a 1:1 chat from the 5day.io Bot with a welcome message. Start Connection In the bot chat, type: connect then press Enter. Log in to 5day.io You’ll be redirected to the 5day.io login page in a new browser tab. Enter Your Credentials Use your 5day.io email address and password. Authorize the App Review the permissions and click Authorize. Connection Complete! You’ll see a confirmation in both: The browser tab (redirected back to 5day.io) The 5day.io bot chat in Teams Your Microsoft Teams account is now fully connected to 5day.io. Quick Notes Receive all 5day.io web notifications directly in Teams. Use create task in any chat or channel. Stay in sync without switching apps.
To create task via Microsoft Teams, refer Create task via Teams.

Turn any Microsoft Teams conversation into an actionable task in 5day.io - without leaving Teams. The create task command lets you capture ideas, assign ownership, set due dates, and add context instantly from channels, group chats, direct messages, or even a single message. Once created, the task appears in your 5day.io workspace with a link back to the original Teams message, ensuring full traceability.
Your Teams account must be connected via the 5day.io bot. You must have Create Task permission in the target 5day.io Workspace/Space/Project.

Open the desired channel in Microsoft Teams. Click the … (More actions) menu below the message input box. Select 5day.io -> Create Task. A task form opens in a pop-up. Fill in details (title auto-fills from channel name if blank). Click Create Task.

In a group chat, click the … (More actions) in the top-right of the chat header. Choose 5day.io -> Create Task. The task form appears with chat name pre-filled as context. Add assignees from the chat participants. Click Create Task.

Open your 1:1 chat with the 5day.io bot or any teammate. Click the … (More actions) below the message box. Select 5day.io -> Create Task. The task form opens with "Private Task from DM" suggested. Click Create Task.

Hover over any message (yours or someone else’s). Click the … (ellipsis) on the message. Select More actions -> 5day.io: Create Task. The message text becomes the task title. Edit fields and click Create Task.
Type directly in any chat or channel: @5day.io create task where 5day.io is added as a bot.

Field Description Project Select a project where you would like to create a task Task Provide a title of your task Section Select a section under which the task needs to be created Description Provide description of your task Start Date Add start date of your task Due Date Add due date for your task Assignee Select an assignee whom you would like to assign a task. Quick Notes Use message context: Always create tasks from the message to auto-capture quotes. Task link in Teams: After creation, a task preview card appears in the chat with a direct link to 5day.io.
To connect you Microsoft teams account with 5day.io, refer Create your Microsoft Teams Account.

Microsoft Teams integration connects your 5day.io account with Microsoft Teams, allowing you to bridge communication and task management in one ecosystem. It enables real-time notifications from 5day.io to flow into Teams channels, chats, and direct messages, while also letting you generate tasks on the fly from team discussions. This integration is designed for teams that rely on Microsoft Teams for daily collaboration, ensuring 5day.io becomes a natural extension of your workflow.

Integrating 5day.io with Microsoft Teams eliminates silos between where your team talks and where you work. In fast-paced environments, discussions often spark ideas or decisions that need immediate action - without integration, these moments get lost in chat threads. By syncing notifications and enabling quick task creation, the integration: Boosts productivity: Receive 5day.io updates (like task assignments, due dates, or status changes) right in Teams, so nothing slips through the cracks. Enhances collaboration: Team members can turn a casual chat message into a trackable task in seconds, assigning owners and deadlines without switching apps. Reduces context switching: Keep everyone in the loop across tools, fostering faster decision-making and accountability. Scales with your team: Ideal for remote or hybrid setups, where Teams is the hub for communication, ensuring project visibility for all stakeholders. Whether you're managing sprints, client projects, or daily stand-ups, this integration turns reactive chats into proactive progress.
documents.s: Why is Microsoft Teams Integration Important?

documents.t: As of now, 5day.io's Teams integration focuses on core essentials to streamline notifications and task creation. Here's what's available:

The 5day.io bot acts as your personal project assistant in Teams, delivering all notifications configured in the 5day.io web app directly to your chats. This means you'll get real-time alerts for: Task assignments and updates. Due date reminders. Status changes or comments. Any custom notifications you've set up in 5day.io.

Transform any message into a actionable item with the "create task" command, available in 1:1 chats, group chats, and channels. This feature lets you capture ideas instantly without disrupting the flow. Supported options: From a channel or group chat: Access prompt create task From a specific message: Highlight a message, right-click (or use the ellipsis menu), and select "Create Task in 5day.io" to auto-populate the description from the chat.
To explore how to connect Microsoft Teams account with 5day.io account, refer Connect an App To create task via Microsoft Teams, refer Create task via Teams

Command Description connect Connect your Microsoft Teams account to your 5day.io account. Starts the authorization flow. disconnect Disconnect your Teams account from 5day.io. Stops all notifications and task creation. create task Create a new task in 5day.io. Supports inline parameters (title, assignee, due date, etc.). help Display the full list of supported commands with brief descriptions. support Get direct links to the Teams Integration Help Center and contact support.
To connect you Microsoft teams account with 5day.io, refer Create your Microsoft Teams Account. To create task via Microsoft Teams, refer Create task via Teams

The Connect option lets you link Slack with your 5day.io account, unlocking real-time notifications and the ability to create tasks directly from any Slack channel, DM, or group chat. Once connected, the 5day.io Slack App will appear in your workspace, delivering all configured 5day.io alerts and enabling task creation through slash commands and message actions.

To use the Slack integration, it must be enabled in your 5day.io account by the account owner/admin. By default, Slack integration is automatically enabled for all users if your plan supports it. Admins can restrict access per user or role in Roles and Permission. Once enabled, any authorized user can connect their Slack account from 5day.io in just a few steps:

Open 5day.io Log in to your 5day.io account. Go to My Settings Click your profile icon and open My Settings. Open Integration Center Navigate to Integrations Center to view available apps. Choose Slack Find the Slack card and click Connect. Slack Authorization Screen A Slack popup will appear. Select your Slack workspace and click Allow to approve permissions. Complete Login (if required) If you’re not already signed into Slack, you may be asked to log in. Connection Complete! After authorization: You’ll be redirected to slack and You’ll receive a welcome message from the 5day.io Bot inside Slack Your Slack account is now fully connected to 5day.io.

Receive all 5day.io notifications directly in Slack. Use commands like /5day.io-create-task to add tasks from any Slack conversation. Convert Slack messages into tasks using message shortcuts. Stay in sync without switching apps.
Create 5day.io tasks directly from Slack - from any message, channel, or DM. Tasks include full context: message text, attachments, sender, and a link back to Slack.
Your Slack account must be connected via the 5day.io bot. You must have Create Task permission in the target 5day.io Workspace/Space/Project.
In any channel, click the " / " (Shortcuts)** icon in the message field. Search for 5day.io -> Create Task. Task form opens with channel name in context. Fill details and click Create.
In a group DM, click the " / " (Shortcuts) icon. Select 5day.io-create-task. Click Create.
In a DM (with bot or teammate), use " / "Shortcuts -> 5day.io-create-task. Fill data and create task.
Hover over a message -> click More actions (⋯). Choose Create task in 5day.io Message text = title. Edit and Create.
Type directly in any chat or channel: /5day.io-create-task where 5day.io is added as a bot.

Field Description Project Select a project where you would like to create a task Task Provide a title of your task Section Select a section under which the task needs to be created Description Provide description of your task Start Date Add start date of your task Due Date Add due date for your task Assignee Select an assignee whom you would like to assign a task. Quick Notes Use message context: Always create tasks from the message to auto-capture quotes. Task link in Slack: After creation, a task preview card appears in the chat with a direct link to 5day.io.
To connect your slack account with 5day.io, refer Connect slack account.

Slack integration connects your 5day.io account to Slack workspace, enabling seamless two-way sync between project updates and team communication. The 5day.io bot delivers all configured 5day.io notifications into Slack, while the /5day.io slash command lets you create tasks instantly from any message.

Integrating 5day.io with Slack eliminates the gap between where your team talks and where work gets done. Capture action items instantly: Turn a “we should do X” into a task in seconds. Stay notified in flow: Get task assignments, due dates, comments, and status changes right in Slack. Reduce app switching: No more copying links or retyping context. Keep everyone aligned: Stakeholders see updates in channels they already watch. Perfect for agile teams, remote crews, or anyone using Slack as their collaboration hub.
The bot pushes all web app notifications into Slack: Task assignments & mentions Due date reminders Status changes New comments Custom alerts

Use /5day.io in any channel, group DM, or direct message to create tasks on the fly. Supports full task details: title, description, assignee, due date, priority, labels, and more. Access the Slack integration here:
To connect your slack account with 5day.io, refer Connect slack account. To create task via Slack, refer Create task via Slack

Command Description /5day.io-create-task Create a new task in 5day.io. Supports inline parameters (title, assignee, due date, etc.). /5day.io-disconnect Disconnect your slack account from 5day.io. Stops all notifications and task creation. /5day.io-help Display the full list of supported commands with brief descriptions.
To connect your slack account with 5day.io, refer Connect slack account. To create task via Slack, refer Create task via Slack

The My Settings page in 5day.io allows you to manage your personal preferences and profile settings, helping tailor the platform to your individual work style. From this page, you can: View and update your profile and time zone information View and switch your assigned work schedule Manage your notification preferences Change your password View all organizations (accounts) you're linked to and switch between them if needed ✅ This section ensures you have full control over how you work inside 5day.io, no matter how many teams or organizations you're a part of.

To access your personal settings in 5day.io: Click on your profile icon from the top or bottom navigation bar (depending on your layout). From the dropdown menu, select My Settings. In the My Settings menu, you’ll see various options such as: Profile Notifications Security Work Schedule More Click on any section you’d like to update directly, or select More to view the full list of available settings. ✅ This gives you access to all your personal preferences and allows you to update them at any time.

The My Settings page in 5day.io allows you to manage your personal preferences and profile settings, helping tailor the platform to your individual work style. From this page, you can: View and update your profile and time zone information View and switch your assigned work schedule Manage your notification preferences Change your password View all organizations (accounts) you're linked to and switch between them if needed ✅ This section ensures you have full control over how you work inside 5day.io, no matter how many teams or organizations you're a part of.

To access your personal settings in 5day.io: Click on your profile icon from the top or bottom navigation bar (depending on your layout). From the dropdown menu, select My Settings. In the My Settings menu, you’ll see various options such as: Profile Notifications Security Work Schedule More Click on any section you’d like to update directly, or select More to view the full list of available settings. ✅ This gives you access to all your personal preferences and allows you to update them at any time.

If you’re part of multiple organizations using 5day.io, the 5day Accounts section helps you manage your presence across them. You can view: A list of all the accounts you’re part of Your role in each account The option to leave an account if needed This is especially helpful for users who collaborate with multiple organizations.

Click on your profile icon and select My Settings. In the My Settings menu, click on 5day Accounts. IMAGE​ You’ll now see a list of all the accounts you're part of, along with your assigned role. To leave an account: Click on the three-dot menu next to the account you want to exit. Select Leave Account and confirm your action.

If you’d like to update your login password, follow these steps: Click on your profile icon and select My Settings from the dropdown. In the My Settings menu, go to Password and Security. IMAGE​ Under the Change Password section, click on the Change Password button. A form will appear where you need to enter: Your current password Your new password Confirm your new password Click on Change Password to save the changes. ✅ Once updated, your new password will take effect immediately.

Click on your profile icon in the navigation bar and go to My Settings. Select Profile from the My Settings menu. You’ll see two tabs: Profile — for personal details Display — for appearance and layout preferences From here, you can make the following changes: Under the Profile tab: First Name, Last Name Phone Number Email Address Date of Birth Profile Picture Under the Display tab: Time Zone Time Format (12h or 24h) Date Format Duration Format Theme (Light or Dark) Layout (Left or Top navigation) ✅ All updates are saved automatically as soon as you make changes — no manual save is required.

In 5day.io, your notification settings give you full control over what updates you want to be alerted for — and how. You can choose to receive notifications through Email, Web, or Mobile for specific actions that matter to you.
documents.s: How to Enable or Disable Notifications

documents.t: Click on your profile icon in the top or bottom navigation bar. Select My Settings from the dropdown. Click on the Notifications tab. From here, you’ll be able to enable or disable individual notifications based on your role, activity, and preferences.

Here’s what each category covers: Projects​ Projects I am an Owner Get notified for all updates in a project you own. This includes changes to status, priority, dates, progress, or when someone is added to the project. Tasks​ Tasks Assigned to Me New task is assigned to you Assignee is changed Task is deleted Task is moved to another section or project Other task updates (e.g., status, priority, type, dates) Tasks Created by Me When tasks you’ve created are deleted or moved Other task updates in the ones you’ve created Comments​ When someone replies to your comment New comments in tasks/subtasks assigned to you New comments in tasks/subtasks you created When someone @mentions you Timesheet​ Reminder to submit your timesheet Reminder for pending timesheets Reminder to log your timesheet Reminders​ All general reminders based on your task due dates, timesheets, and project settings
Each row has toggles for: Email Web Mobile Simply check or uncheck the boxes to enable or disable the notification types you prefer. ✅ Changes are saved instantly when you toggle a notification.

Use this feature to automatically silence notifications during specific hours or on your days off. To enable Do Not Disturb mode: Go to My Settings from your profile menu. Click on Notifications. Under the Schedule section, check the box for “Do not notify me from:”. Set your preferred start and end time for the DND period. Select the days you want DND to apply (e.g., Saturday, Sunday). Selected days will be highlighted. To disable Do Not Disturb mode: Uncheck the “Do not notify me from” box to remove the time-based restriction. To remove any selected days, click on each highlighted day again to deselect it.

Use this option to temporarily silence all notifications across devices. To pause notifications: In the same Notifications section under My Settings, Click the “Pause notifications” button. Once active, it will be highlighted. To resume notifications: Click the “Pause notifications” button again to turn it off.

Notifications in 5day.io let you stay in control of how and when you receive updates about your work. Whether it's task assignments, project activity, comments, or reminders — you can customize what alerts you get and where they appear (Web, Mobile, or Email). In 5day.io, notifications help you stay updated on key actions like task assignments, project updates, comments, reminders, and more. You have full control over which notifications you receive — and where you receive them (email, web, or mobile). You can also customize your experience further with: Do Not Disturb Mode – Temporarily silence notifications during specific hours or days. Pause Notifications – Disable all notifications until you choose to turn them back on. With these settings, 5day.io ensures that you're always informed — but never overwhelmed.

To manage your notifications in 5day.io: Click on your profile icon in the top or bottom navigation bar (based on your layout). From the dropdown, select My Settings. Inside My Settings, click on the Notifications tab. From here, you’ll be able to: Enable or disable notifications for tasks, projects, comments, reminders, and timesheets. Choose where you want to receive updates — Web, Email, or Mobile. Configure Do Not Disturb or Pause Notifications to control when and how you get notified. This gives you full control over your notification preferences.

The Profile section inside My Settings in 5day.io lets users manage their personal information and tailor how the application looks and behaves — all in one place. It’s designed to give every user full control over their identity settings and display preferences. The Profile settings are organized into two parts:

In this section, users can update their personal details, including: First Name and Last Name Phone Number Email Address Date of Birth Profile Picture (upload or change) This helps keep your identity accurate across all your 5day.io workspaces and collaborations.

The Display tab allows users to customize how 5day.io appears and functions for them, including: Time Zone: Set your local working time zone Time Format: Choose between 12-hour or 24-hour formats Language: Default is English (currently fixed) Date Format: Choose how dates are displayed (e.g., DD/MM/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY) Duration Format: Define how durations (like work hours) are displayed Theme: Choose a light or dark mode to personalize your experience Layout: Decide where the navigation menu should appear — Left Navigation or Top Navigation ✅ Everything you configure here applies only to your personal account experience and is visible only to you.

The Work Schedule section in 5day.io allows users to view the working hours and holiday calendar assigned to them by their organization. By default, each user is assigned an organization-defined work schedule, which outlines their working days, daily start and end times. It also displays the start of the calendar week, the total daily working duration, and the holiday list for the current year. If this assigned schedule doesn’t reflect a user's actual working pattern, they can easily switch to another work schedule from a list of options configured by their organization.
In 5day.io, your organization assigns a default work schedule, but if it doesn’t align with your actual working hours, you have the flexibility to change it.
documents.s: How to Change Your Work Schedule

documents.t: Go to My Settings by clicking your profile icon in the navigation bar. From the menu, select Work Schedule. On the Work Schedule page, click the Change button. A list of all available work schedules set by your organization will appear. Select the schedule that matches your working pattern. ✅ Once selected, the new work schedule will be automatically applied to your profile.
documents.s: Steps to Change Your Work Schedule:

documents.t: My Calendar helps you view all your scheduled tasks in one place. It shows: Tasks assigned to you Subtasks assigned to you Google Calendar events (if you have synced your Google Calendar) My Calendar always opens in Month View and displays the current month by default. You can scroll through past and future months, and access the details of any task or event directly from the calendar view. My Calendar is available from the Home section and is designed to give you a clear timeline of your work.
