All users can access My Calendar. Users will only see: Tasks assigned to them Subtasks assigned to them Their own connected Google Calendar events (only if Google Calendar integration is enabled and sync is turned on). Tasks assigned to other team members will not appear in My Calendar.
Click the Home icon from the navigation panel. Select My Calendar from the Home menu. You will now be taken to the monthly calendar view.
My Calendar displays three types of items:
documents.s: What You Will See in My Calendar

documents.t: Tasks assigned to you with valid dates will appear on the relevant day(s). Displayed information includes: Task icon Task title Time (always all-day format: 12:00 AM – 11:59 PM) Date range (for multi-day tasks)
Subtasks work exactly like tasks and follow the same display rules.

These events will appear only when: You have connected your Google account You have enabled sync The selected calendar(s) are checked in the sync panel Each Google event appears with: Event icon Event title Event time (as provided by Google Calendar)
You can switch between months using: < to view the previous month > to view the next month There is no limit — you can scroll infinitely into past and future months.
Click Today to automatically: Jump back to the current month Highlight today’s date with a circle Position the month so today's date is visible
Click on the month name (e.g., “November 2025”) to open a selector and jump to any month.

If Google Calendar integration is active, you will see: Syncing: X Calendar(s) When clicked, a panel opens showing all Google calendars linked to your Google account, such as: Primary Calendar Holidays Each calendar has a checkbox. Checked → Events from that calendar will appear Unchecked → Events disappear instantly from My Calendar For more information, refer to the Google Calendar Integration help guide.

1. Tasks/Subtasks With a Single Date​ If only a due date or only a start date is present, the task appears on that day. 2. Multi-Day Tasks​ If a task spans multiple days (e.g., 02 Nov → 06 Nov), it will appear as: A continuous bar across all days in the date range A single unified bar that stretches across the calendar row 3. All-Day Time Format​ Tasks and subtasks always show: 12:00 AM – 11:59 PM Google Calendar events display their actual time. 4. Items Without Dates​ If a task or subtask has no start date and no due date, it will not appear in My Calendar.
documents.s: How Tasks and Events Are Displayed

documents.t: When you hover over a task or subtask, you will see: Task icon Task title Date(s) Time (all-day) An icon to open the task details When you hover over a Google Calendar event, you will see: Event icon Event title Date and time An icon to open the event in Google Calendar Opening Item Details​
Clicking a task or subtask opens the Task Details view inside 5day.io.

Clicking a Google event opens the Google Calendar event page in a new browser tab. Adding New Items​ In the top-left corner of the calendar, you will find the Add Task button. From here you can: Create a Task Create a Reminder This uses the standard Add Task and Add Reminder flows. Notes and Behaviour Rules​ Calendar is always in Month View. Week numbers are not displayed. My Calendar shows only your own tasks and subtasks.

Reminders in 5day.io help you stay on top of your schedule—whether it's for personal tasks, project deliverables, or team follow-ups. You can create reminders for any important activity and get notified at the right time to take action. Reminders can be created independently or linked directly to a specific task or subtask, offering flexibility to organize your day or plan work-specific updates.

Event Reminders (e.g., personal or meeting alerts): When creating a new standalone reminder, users are shown a simple Date and Time picker to set when the reminder should trigger. Task/Subtask Reminders: When linked to a task or subtask, the Date field includes more contextual options: On due date Before due date After due date Custom date (lets the user manually choose any date) This makes it easy to schedule task-related nudges based on deadlines or key project dates.

Click on the Reminder Icon In the left navigation menu, click the Reminder icon (alarm clock symbol). Open the Reminder Form A modal popup will appear with a form to enter reminder details. Fill Out the Reminder Details Type: Choose the type of reminder: Event – for personal or general reminders. Task/Subtask – if the reminder is tied to a specific work item. Title: Enter the name of the reminder. Description (Optional): Click Add Description to include any notes. Date: Select a specific date for the reminder. Time: You can either manually enter the time (hours, minutes, AM/PM) or pick from preset options (11:00 AM, 1:00 PM, 6:00 PM, 9:00 PM). Click 'Create' Once the details are entered, click Create to save the reminder. IMAGE​
documents.s: Option 1: Create a Event Reminder from the Navigation Menu

documents.t: In 5day.io, you can create reminders that are directly linked to tasks or subtasks. These reminders help ensure you stay aligned with deadlines and follow-ups across your project work. You can create task or subtask reminders using three methods:
documents.s: Option 2: Create a Reminder from a Task or Subtask

documents.t: Go to the relevant Project. Locate the task or subtask in the list. Click the three-dot menu (⋮) next to the item. Select Set Reminder from the menu. IMAGE​
documents.s: Method A: From the Task List View

documents.t: Click on the task to open its detailed view. In the task header, click on the three-dot menu (⋮). Select Set Reminder from the dropdown. IMAGE​
documents.s: Method B: From Inside the Task Panel

documents.t: Click on the Reminder (alarm clock) icon from the left navigation bar. In the popup modal, select the Type as Task or Subtask. Select the relevant task or subtask: Multiple tasks & subtasks can be selected at a time. Selected items will auto-fill the Title field. To remove any selection, click the ‘x’ icon next to the task or subtask name. IMAGE​ Note: For all three methods (A, B, and C), once a task or subtask is selected: You can optionally click Add Description to include notes. For Date, you’ll get contextual options: On Due Date Before Due Date After Due Date Custom Date (allows selecting any specific date) Time can be set manually (hours, minutes, AM/PM) or selected from quick options like 11:00 AM, 1:00 PM, 6:00 PM, or 9:00 PM. Click Create to save the reminder.
documents.s: Method C: From the Reminder Icon in the Navigation Menu

documents.t: Users will receive in-app and/or web notifications at the scheduled reminder time. Note: If a user does not want to receive reminder notifications, they can manage this in the Notifications Settings Panel by disabling reminders.

My Timesheet in 5day.io gives every user a centralized view to track their time logged across projects — whether it’s billable hours, internal work, or time off. It’s designed to help both individuals and managers get a clear picture of time utilization and stay aligned on productivity goals. From this single interface, users can:

Log time entries using the Add Time or Add Bulk Time buttons Switch between multiple views: Day, Week, Month, and List See logged entries by type – Time Entry, Internal Time, and Time Off Search: Look up time entries using task or subtask names, task or subtask IDs, or by people. Group data in List View by Project or Member to easily understand where time is going Users can only view and manage their own time entries by default. However, admins, project managers, or users with permission can change the "Showing for" dropdown to see entries for a specific member or all members. In the List View, additional flexibility is provided: Group by Project: View a breakdown of your timesheet entries across each project Group by Member (for managers): View all entries submitted by each team member Managers can also access the Time Approval tab to review and approve timesheets across different projects, depending on permissions and workspace settings. Whether you're an individual contributor keeping track of your hours, or a manager reviewing timesheets for approvals — My Timesheet keeps everything organized, clear, and easy to act on.

The Day, Week, Month, and List tabs in My Timesheet work the same way as they do in the Project Timesheet View, with one difference: In Project Timesheet, entries are scoped to that specific project. In My Timesheet, members can view their own time entries across all projects they are assigned to. Admins, project managers, or users with the appropriate permissions can switch views to see time entries for other members across Day, Week, Month, or List view. For details on each view (including how to log time, use filters, and read summaries), refer to the [Timesheet View Guide].
My Work is available across all subscription plans of 5day.io without any restrictions.
All users can access My Work, irrespective of their role (Admin, Manager, Member, Guest, etc.). No special permissions are required — it’s a default workspace provided individually to each user.

Click on the ‘Home’ icon located in the left sidebar menu of 5day.io. Upon clicking, you will be automatically redirected to the My Work page. The Home icon serves as the fastest way to view your personal task dashboard.

Each task within My Work is automatically categorized based on its due date. The number of tasks in each category will be displayed in the header for quick reference. Overdue Tasks and subtasks assigned to you that have missed their due date but are still incomplete. This category highlights urgent actions that require immediate attention to stay on track. Today Tasks and subtasks that are due today or are scheduled for completion today. Use this category to plan your daily activities and meet immediate deadlines. Tomorrow Tasks and subtasks that are scheduled for tomorrow, giving you a clear preview of what's next. This helps you prepare in advance for the coming day and organize your work proactively. Upcoming Tasks and subtasks planned for the next 7 days (after tomorrow) are grouped under Upcoming. This view helps you keep an eye on your medium-term workload and plan ahead effectively. Unscheduled Tasks and subtasks that are assigned to you but have no due date yet. Use this category to identify pending work that needs to be prioritized and scheduled.

Along with task visibility, My Work offers powerful utilities to help you manage and organize your workload even better. Search Quickly search through your list of tasks and subtasks by typing keywords. Filter Narrow down your task list by applying specific filters like project name, priority, status, task type, and more. Group By Organize your tasks visually by grouping them by period, status, task type, or priority. Sort Arrange tasks or subtasks in ascending or descending order based on due dates, priorities, status, task type and more. ✅ Pro Tip: Use My Work as your daily starting point to stay organized, prioritize important tasks, and never miss a deadline.

In 5day.io, users can directly add time for any task from within its Task Details view. This method is especially useful when you’re already reviewing or updating a task and want to capture time without switching views. Within the task, you’ll find two main ways to track your time: Add Time Manually Start a Timer Both options are available at the bottom bar of the task details interface.

You can log your time manually by clicking the ➕ Add Time icon in the task details view. This will open the standard Time Entry Form in the Task tab. From here, you can: Select either Duration (drag to set hours) or Time Range (enter start and end time) Confirm the Project and Task Choose whether the time is Billable or Non-Billable Add any relevant Notes Click Add to save the time entry 📎 Want to know more about the Time Entry Form?

If you'd rather let the system track time for you: Click the ▶ Start Timer icon at the bottom of the task The timer begins immediately and will keep running in the background Continue working on your task — the timer remains active as long as the tab is open Once finished, return to the task and click the ■ Stop Timer button The tracked time will be automatically logged under your name for that task

After time is logged (whether manually or via timer), you can view all related entries by clicking the Time Logged field beside the task’s timer bar. This provides a breakdown of all time tracked for that task, including: Date of entry Hours and minutes logged User who logged the time Billable or non-billable time entry

The Bulk Time Entry feature in 5day.io allows users to log time for multiple days in one go, making it easier to catch up on time tracking for past or future dates. This is especially useful for logging time on recurring tasks or internal activities like meetings, planning, or documentation. Bulk Time Entry supports both project-based time entries and internal time logging — all within a unified, calendar-style view.

You can access the Bulk Time Entry form from two locations: From a Project Go to a Project where you have access. Click on the Timesheet tab. In the top-right corner, click on the Add Bulk Time button. From My Timesheet Navigate to My Timesheet from the left sidebar. Click on Add Bulk Time from the top-right of the timesheet view. ✅ You must have timesheet access enabled for the project or workspace to use this feature.
documents.s: How to Access Bulk Time Entry

documents.t: Once you open the Bulk Time Entry modal, you will see:

A weekly calendar view (Monday to Sunday). A user switcher (visible only if you have rights to log time for others). A list of added tasks or internal time categories with input fields beside each date. You can enter time in hh:mm format directly into the date fields.
Click + Add Task. Select the Project and Task for which you want to log time. Click Add. Once added, the task appears as a row in the calendar view, and you can enter time for any day of the week.

Click + Add Internal Time. Select the Workspace (auto-filled based on context). Choose the Internal Time Category (e.g., Meetings, Training). Click Add. The category will be listed with empty time fields next to each day, ready for entry. ℹ️ Internal time entries are used to capture non-project hours like internal meetings or activities.

Date Navigation: Use the left/right arrows to move between weeks. Today Shortcut: Click Today to return to the current week. User Switcher: If you're an admin or project manager, you can log time on behalf of others by selecting their name from the dropdown. Time Validation: Ensure you use the correct format (hh:mm). Save: After entering all required time entries, click Save to log all entries in bulk.
The Day View in 5day.io Timesheet allows you to see time entries laid out in a familiar hourly calendar format. It’s designed to help you visualize how your team is spending time throughout the day.
A vertical timeline from 00:00 to 24:00, showing all hours in a day. All logged time entries for the selected date appear as blocks on the timeline. A summary section will be shown.
You can click and drag on any time block (e.g., 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM) to log new time. This opens the Add Time Entry pop-up, where you can enter task, duration, notes, and select billable/non-billable.

By default, users only see their own time entries. Admins, Project Managers, or users with appropriate permissions can: Change the user from the “Showing for” dropdown View time entries for other team members

Search: Look up time entries using task or subtask names, task or subtask IDs, or by people. Filter: Filter entries by Budget Type (Billable / Non-Billable). Change the Day: Navigate to past or upcoming days using the left/right arrow buttons at the top.
Time entries can also be deleted directly from the task if a mistake was made or if the log is no longer relevant.
documents.s: How to Delete Time Entries for a Task

documents.t: Open the List View or Board View of your project. Click on the task name where the time was logged. In the task, scroll down to the Time Logged section. Click on Time Logged to view all recorded entries. Locate the entry you want to delete. Click on the 🗑️ Delete icon next to it. Confirm the deletion if prompted. ✅ Note: You can only delete your own time entries unless you're a Project Admin, Account Admin, or a user with delete permissions.
documents.s: Steps to Delete a Time Entry:

documents.t: How to Edit Time Entries for a Task You can edit your own time entries directly from the Task Details view. Admins, Project Managers, or users with edit permissions can also update time entries logged by other members.

Go to the List View or Board View of your project. Click on the task name for which you want to edit a time entry. In the task detail panel, scroll down to the Time Logged section. Click on Time Logged to open the list of all time entries. Find the entry you want to edit. Click on the ✏️ Edit icon beside that entry. The Edit Time Entry form will open. Modify the necessary fields (e.g., date, hours, budget type, note). Click Update to save the changes. ✅ Note: You can only edit your own entries unless you have the appropriate permissions.
documents.s: Steps to Edit a Time Entry:

documents.t: Overview The Timesheet View in 5day.io provides a clear, calendar-based overview of all time logged within a project. It helps members and project managers monitor, manage, and analyze time entries across tasks, internal work, and time-off – making time tracking transparent and efficient. Users can switch between Day, Week, Month, or List views to review or log time entries based on their preferred granularity. This view offers visibility into how much time has been logged, by whom, and against which task or internal category. Key highlights of Timesheet View: Flexible Time Views: Toggle between Day, Week, Month, or List views to visualize logged hours. Add Time Easily: Use the + Add Time or + Add Bulk Time buttons to log work quickly. View Time by User: See your own logged time. Project Managers and Admins can view time logged by other team members. Click-to-Log Time: Click or drag across time blocks in Day, Week, or Month views to bring up the Add Time Entry modal and log time directly from the calendar. Search & Filter: Use the search bar to find entries by task name, subtask, or people. Apply filters like Billable or Non-Billable to refine results. Time Breakdown: See totals for Billable, Non-Billable, PTO, Overtime, and Utilization for each user. Supports All Entry Types: Works seamlessly with task time, internal time, and time-off entries. This view is particularly useful for managers to audit logged time across the team and for members to ensure their entries are complete and up to date.

To access the Timesheet View for a project in 5day.io: Navigate to the Projects section in the left sidebar. Click on the project name for which you want to view the timesheet. Once inside the project, look at the top navigation menu (just below the project name). IMAGE​ Click on the Timesheet tab. This will open the Timesheet View for the selected project, where you can view, log, and manage time entries using Day, Week, Month, or List views. 📝 Note: Only users who have access and permissions to the project will be able to access the Timesheet tab. Project Managers or Admins may have additional permissions to view other users’ entries.

The List View offers a clean, summary-style breakdown of time entries for the selected week. It’s ideal for getting a quick snapshot of how much time has been logged by each member and across which tasks. What You Can Do in List View​ Member-wise Summary: Shows each member's name with their total time logged during the selected week. Clicking on a member row expands the list of tasks against which time has been logged. Task Details: For each user, a detailed list of tasks is shown with individual time logs beside them. View for Different Members: Members will only see their own time entries. Admins, Project Managers, or users with proper permissions can switch the “Showing for” selector to: A specific member — to view that individual’s data All Members — to view all team members in an expandable list format 🔍 Note: When viewing "All Members", the summary section will be hidden. Week Navigation: The current week is selected by default. Navigate to past or upcoming weeks using the left/right arrow buttons at the top. Search & Filter: Search: Look up time entries using task or subtask names, task or subtask IDs, or by people. Filter by Budget Type (Billable or Non-Billable) using the top-right filter icon. Summary Panel: A summary at the bottom will display detailed time entry summary.

In 5day.io, when time approval is enabled for a project, admins, project managers, or users with the appropriate permissions can approve or reject time entries submitted by members. You can manage time approvals in two ways:
documents.s: How to Approve or Reject Time Entries

documents.t: Go to the project for which you want to review time entries. Click on the Timesheet tab in the top menu. IMAGE​ Inside Timesheet, switch to the Time Approval tab. Use the Show for dropdown to filter by a specific team member or select All Members to view everyone’s entries. Choose the relevant week range using the date navigation. You will now see: A list of members Each member’s tasks Logged time For each time entry row, you’ll see two icons: ✅ Tick to approve ❌ Cross to reject To approve all time entries for all member, use the Approve All button
documents.s: Option 1: From the Project’s Time Approval Tab

documents.t: Click on My Timesheet from the navigation bar. IMAGE​ Switch to the Time Approval tab. Use the Show for filter to view: A specific team member’s time entries Or All Members, if you want to review everyone’s time entry logs Select the desired week range using the date navigator. You’ll now see: Each project Corresponding Members & tasks Time logged by date under each team member As with the project-level view, each entry row will have: ✅ A tick icon to approve ❌ A cross icon to reject To approve all time entries for all member, use the Approve All button
documents.s: Option 2: From My Timesheet → Time Approval

documents.t: Go to the specific task in a project. IMAGE​ Scroll to the bottom bar and click Total Time Logged. In the time log popup: You’ll see a list of entries with date, status, logged time, and an editable Approved field. To approve or reject: Enter the desired approved time (if you want to adjust) Click ✅ to approve Click ❌ to reject This is especially useful for reviewing or modifying individual entries quickly.
documents.s: Option 3: From Task Details → Total Time Logged

documents.t: Approved time entries are marked with an “Approved” status. Rejected time entries are returned to the member for correction or re-submission. Admins and project managers can also edit logged time before approving, if needed.

The Month View offers a high-level calendar layout, allowing users to quickly visualize all time entries logged across an entire month. What You Can Do in Month View​ Calendar Layout: Displays the selected month in a calendar format, with dates and weekdays clearly marked. See Logged Entries per Day: For each date, users can view a summary of all time entries logged. Each entry displays the task name and duration. Navigate Between Months: Navigate to past or upcoming weeks using the left/right arrow buttons at the top. User Switcher (Showing For): Members will only see their own logged entries. Admins, Project Managers, or users with proper permissions can select and view entries for other team members. Summary Panel: A summary at the bottom will display detailed time entry summary. Search & Filter Options: Search: Look up time entries using task or subtask names, task or subtask IDs, or by people. Filter entries by Budget Type (e.g., Billable / Non-Billable) to refine the view.

The Time Approval feature in 5day.io allows organizations to implement a manual approval workflow for timesheet entries submitted by team members. When enabled, this feature ensures that all time logs must be reviewed and approved by project managers, admins, or users with the appropriate permission set before they are finalized. Once time approval is enabled for a project, members can continue logging time against their tasks. However, those entries will remain in a pending state until reviewed. Approvers will have the option to approve or reject individual time entries or approve all entries in bulk for a project or specific member. Team members can still see the approval status of their entries and resubmit or modify time logs based on feedback, depending on the workspace settings. This approval process adds a layer of oversight and accuracy to project time tracking—ensuring that only validated hours are included in reports, billing, and utilization. Key Highlights:​ Time Approval must be enabled per project in Project Settings > Features. Only users with the "Approve Timesheet" permission (admins, project managers, or custom role users) can approve or reject timesheets. Approvers can manually enter or adjust the approved hours for each time entry while reviewing it. This is done in the 'Approved' column provided alongside the logged hours for each date. This allows approvers to validate and confirm how much of the submitted time is accepted. Members can view their approval status and update or resubmit entries if permitted. Approved timesheet entries are visible across My Timesheet and Project Timesheet views for both members and approvers.

Go to the project where you want to update the time approval setting. Click the three-dot menu (⋮) next to the project name and select Project Settings. In the left menu, click on Features. Locate the toggle for Time Approval. To enable: Switch the toggle ON. Time Approval will be activated for this project. To disable: Switch the toggle OFF. Time entries will no longer require approval.
documents.s: Steps to Enable or Disable Time Approval

documents.t: Time Approval only works if Time Tracking is also enabled for the project. Only users with access to manage project settings (such as Admins, Project Managers, or users with the appropriate custom role permissions) can update this setting. Once Time Approval is enabled, team members will need to manually submit their time entries. Approvers will have the ability to review, approve, reject, or add approved submitted time logs as needed.

1. Submit from Task Details​ Go to the project and open the task where time was logged. IMAGE​ Click on the Total Time Logged section at the bottom of the task. A Time Entries pop-up will open showing all logged entries. For each entry, you’ll see a tick icon beside the row. Click the tick icon to instantly submit that time entry for approval. Note: You can identify unsubmitted time entries by the "To Submit" status. 2. Submit from Project Timesheet (Day, Week, Month, List)​ Open the project where time entries were logged. Click on the Timesheet tab in the top project menu. Switch to any view — Day, Week, Month, or List. IMAGE​ If time entries are pending submission for the selected time period, a Submit All button will be visible. Click Submit All to send all pending entries for approval. 3. Submit from My Timesheet​ Go to My Timesheet from the navigation menu. Inside My Timesheet, switch to any view — Day, Week, Month, or List. IMAGE​ If time entries are pending submission for the selected time period, a Submit All button will be visible.

The Time Entry Form in 5day.io provides a unified interface to log time across different use cases — whether you're tracking time on tasks, logging internal efforts (like meetings or reviews), or recording time off (such as sick leave or vacation). Although this form can be accessed from multiple locations — like Quick Add, My Timesheet, or directly from a task — the layout remains consistent. The form is structured into three tabs, each designed for a specific time logging scenario: Task – For logging time against a task that’s assigned to you Internal Time – For logging time not tied to tasks, such as internal meetings Time Off – For logging non-working time such as sick leave or vacation Note: The options shown may vary slightly depending on where you access the form. For example, accessing from a task will only show the Task tab. Across all tabs, the user can choose how to log time: Duration – Total hours worked (e.g., 2h) Time Range – Specific start and end times (e.g., 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM) This form ensures a consistent time logging experience across your workspace, while adapting to the type of time entry you want to make.

The Task tab in the Time Entry form allows you to log hours against a specific task in a project. This is ideal for tracking time spent on deliverables, meetings, or any billable/non-billable task work. How It Works​ There are two ways to log time under the Task tab: 1. Duration Mode​ Use the slider to drag and select the number of hours worked. The Time Logged field will auto-calculate based on the slider position. 2. Time Range Mode​ Enter a specific Start Time and End Time using hours and minutes. Time Logged is automatically calculated based on the entered range. You can switch between these modes using the Duration or Time Range buttons. Fields in the Task Tab​ Field Description Time Logged Displays the total duration of the time entry. Auto-filled from the slider (in Duration mode) or calculated from start and end time (in Time Range mode). User Defaults to the logged-in user. Admins and project managers can log time for other users if permissions allow. Project* Required. Select the project where the task exists. Task* Once a project is selected, choose the task. Date Select the date the work was performed. Defaults to today. Budget Type Choose whether the time is Billable or Non-Billable. Note Optionally add comments or context for the time entry. ℹ️ Note: If Timesheet Approval is enabled, submitting this form does not automatically send it for approval. You’ll need to do that from My Timesheet.

The Internal Time tab lets users log time for activities not tied to a specific project — such as meetings, training, or internal work. This helps track how internal hours are being spent across your organization.

You can log internal time in two ways: Duration Mode Drag the slider to set how much time was spent. The Time Logged field will update automatically. Time Range Mode Manually input the Start Time and End Time in hours and minutes. Time Logged is auto-calculated based on the entered values. Use the Duration or Time Range toggle to switch between modes.

Field Description Time Logged Auto-filled based on slider or calculated from start and end time. User Defaults to the logged-in user. Admins and project managers with access can select a different user. Workspace* Select the workspace this internal time entry applies to. Type* Choose an internal time category (e.g., Meetings, Interview, etc.). Only categories created under Internal Time are shown here. Date Defaults to today’s date. You can select a different date if needed. Note (Optional) Add a note or comment to describe the internal activity.
documents.s: Fields in the Internal Time Tab

documents.t: The Time Off tab allows users to log time off such as vacations, sick days, or other personal time. This helps maintain a transparent record of availability across your team.
Users can log time off as either: Half Day – Logs approximately half of a workday (based on the organization’s working hours). Full Day – Logs a complete working day.

Field Description User Defaults to the current user. Admins or authorized managers can change this and log time off for others. Workspace* Select the workspace the time off entry applies to. Type* Select a time-off category like Sick Leave, Casual Leave, etc. (Categories must be pre-configured in Workspace Timesheet Settings > Categories). From Start date of the time off. To End date of the time off. If it's a one-day leave, both dates will be the same. Note (Optional) Add context or reason for taking time off.
documents.s: Fields in the Time Off Tab

documents.t: In 5day.io, timesheet-related functionalities such as time entry, tracking, and approval can be configured at the project level based on your team's needs. These features provide flexibility in how you want to manage and track work hours across different types of projects — whether client-based, internal, or billable/non-billable. By default, the following features are typically enabled: Project Finance – For tracking billable and non-billable hours, budgets, and profitability. Time Estimates – To set time estimates per task and manage expected workload. Time Tracking – To log actual hours spent on tasks manually or via timers. Additional timesheet features such as Time Approval, Overtime, and Assignee Wise Estimation can be turned on or off as needed. These settings are only visible to users with permission to manage project settings — typically Project Managers, Account Admins, or users with custom roles granted access to this section.

To enable or disable timesheet-related features for a project: Go to the Project where you want to configure timesheet settings. Click on the three-dot menu (⋮) next to the project name and select Project Settings. In the left sidebar, click on Features. Scroll to see all available features such as: Time-related features like Time Tracking, Time Estimates, Time Approval, Overtime, Assignee Wise Estimation, etc. Use the toggle switches next to each feature to turn them on or off.
documents.s: How to Access Timesheet Features for a Project

documents.t: In 5day.io, you can customize which timesheet-related features should be enabled at the project level to suit the specific tracking needs of your team.
documents.s: Configure Timesheet Features in a Project

documents.t: By default, the following timesheet features are turned on in every project: Project Finance – Track billable, non-billable hours, project budgets, and profitability. Time Estimates – Set and manage estimated hours for each task. Time Tracking – Log actual time spent on tasks manually or via timer. These features offer a solid baseline for basic time management.

The following additional features are available but disabled by default. Project Managers or users with permission can enable or disable them at any time using the toggle switches. ✅ Time Approval​ Enforces a formal approval process for submitted timesheets. Once enabled, project managers or approvers must approve time entries before they're finalized. ⏱ Overtime​ Allows users to log hours worked beyond their regular schedules. Useful for capturing extra billable/non-billable time during crunch periods. Assignee-Wise Estimation​ Allows task estimations to be divided among multiple assignees. Once this feature is enabled, a confirmation prompt appears asking how you’d like the estimation to be handled: Equally divide the estimation by person, or Disable equal division, allowing manual input of effort per assignee.

Overview In 5day.io, all timesheet configuration is managed from the workspace level. Admins can fine-tune how time entries are logged, what’s allowed for past and future dates, and enable key features like overtime tracking or timesheet approval. To access Timesheet Settings: Go to Workspace Settings Click on Timesheet Settings from the left sidebar Under Timesheet Settings, you will find three tabs: Basic Settings Reminders Categories

The Basic Settings tab in Timesheet Settings allows workspace admins to define key preferences for how time logging works across the organization. These settings govern logging behavior for closed projects, tasks, weekends, and holidays, and offer flexibility in handling past and future entries.

Setting Description Allow to add time entry in closed project Enable this toggle if you want users to log time in projects that are already marked as closed. Default: Off Allow to add time entry in closed task/subtask Allows time entries to be logged even when a task or subtask is closed. Default: Off Allow to log time in Choose whether to allow time logging on Weekends and/or Holidays (checkboxes). Time log entry for past dates Toggle this ON to allow time entries for previous dates. You can set the limit in days. Default: 30 days Time log entry for future dates Toggle this ON to allow future time entries. You can set the number of days allowed. Default: 7 days
Setting Description Overtime Enable this toggle to allow tracking of overtime hours. Default: Off

Setting Description Timesheet Approval Enable this toggle if timesheets should be approved by a higher manager. Default: Off Allow to edit time log for approved timesheet Lets users modify time entries even after approval. Default: Off Allow to edit time log for 'Pending Approval' Lets users modify time entries that are pending approval. Default: On

Overview The Reminders tab under Timesheet Settings allows workspace admins to send automated alerts to users and managers to encourage timely time logging and approval actions. You can configure reminder frequency and schedule for each type.

Reminder Type Purpose Frequency Options When Missing Time Entries Sends reminders to users who haven’t logged time. - Never - Daily - Weekly - For Daily: choose time (e.g. 10:00 AM) - For Weekly: select day(s) (e.g. Monday) and time Unsubmitted Time Reminders Reminds users to submit their logged time for approval. - Never - Daily - Weekly - For Daily: choose time - For Weekly: select day(s) (e.g. Monday) and time Pending Approvals Reminds project managers and users with approval rights to review and approve pending timesheets. - Never - Daily - Weekly - For Daily: choose time - For Weekly: select day(s) (e.g. Monday) and time ✅ Who receives Pending Approvals reminders? Users with project manager roles or those granted timesheet approval rights in project settings will get these notifications.

In 5day.io, the Categories tab under Timesheet Settings allows admins to define meaningful labels for time entries. These categories help users accurately log internal activities (like training or meetings) and time-off types (like leaves or holidays), making timesheet reports clearer and more actionable. Categories are grouped into two types: Internal Time: For tracking non-project work like admin time, internal meetings, or training. Time Off: For logging leaves, vacations, or other time-off entries.

You can add custom categories for both Internal Time and Time Off: Action Description Add Category Click the + Add button under either Internal Time or Time Off section. Input Field Enter the name of the category you wish to create. (e.g., "Team Meeting", "Sick Leave") Post-Creation Options Once created, each category can be further customized: → Color A default color is assigned automatically, but you user can update it using the color picker. → Icon Choose from a predefined set of icons to visually represent the category.

Each category entry includes a three-dot menu (⋮) where you can manage it: Option Function Delete Removes the category from the list. Useful if a category is no longer relevant. Edit Color or Icon Click on the color square or icon to make changes as needed. ✅ Note: Categories are immediately reflected in the timesheet logging interface. Users will be able to select from these categories when logging Internal Time or Time Off.

The Summary Section in Timesheet View helps users and project managers quickly understand how time is being distributed across different categories and track overall utilization. This section is available across all Timesheet views — Day, Week, Month, and List — and provides a consistent breakdown of time data regardless of the view.

Total Hours Panel​ Displays total hours logged and splits them into: Billable: Time tagged as billable. Non-Billable: Time that is non-billable. Capacity: The expected available working hours for that user or member. Missing: Hours that haven’t been accounted for (Capacity - Logged Hours). Utilization Panel​ Shows how efficiently time is being used with metrics such as: Utilization %: (Total Logged / Capacity) × 100 Billable %: (Billable / Capacity) × 100 Non-Billable % Internal: Internal time entries (like meetings or training) PTO: Paid time off entries (e.g., sick leave, casual leave) Overtime: Time logged beyond standard hours (if overtime tracking is enabled)
documents.s: What You’ll See in the Summary:

documents.t: In 5day.io, users can easily view all time entries logged against a task directly from the Task Details panel. This allows team members and managers to quickly understand how much time has been spent on a task and by whom. This view provides a transparent breakdown of contributions and helps in reviewing, managing, or auditing worklogs.

To access time entries from Task Details: Open the task from any project view (List, Board, etc.) Scroll to the bottom bar of the task card Click on the Time Logged section to open the Time Entries panel

The Time Entries panel displays the following: User Name: Name of the person who logged the time Total Logged Time: Total time contributed by the user on that task Detailed Breakdown: Date of entry Logged Duration (e.g., 1h 30m) Entry Type (e.g., billable or non-billable) Edit Icon ✏️ (to modify the entry – permission-based) Delete Icon 🗑️ (to remove the entry – permission-based)

Regular Users: Can view their own time entries Project Managers/Admins: Can view all users’ entries on the task They can also edit or delete entries logged by other team members (based on role permissions)

The Week View allows users to see a breakdown of their time entries across a full week, making it easier to track patterns and ensure complete logging. What You Can Do in Week View​ View Weekly Hours: The selected week (e.g., May 12–18) is shown with each day and corresponding logged hours clearly displayed. Click and Drag to Log Time: Users can click and drag on any day’s vertical timeline (hour slots like 01:00, 02:00, etc.) to quickly open the Time Entry form and log hours. Change the Week: Navigate to past or upcoming weeks using the left/right arrow buttons at the top. User Switcher (Showing For): Members will only see their own entries. Admins or Project Managers (with the right permissions) can use the “Showing For” selector to view entries for other users. Summary Section: A summary panel is shown. Search & Filter: Search: Look up time entries using task or subtask names, task or subtask IDs, or by people. Filter entries by Budget Type (e.g., Billable / Non-Billable) to refine the view.

Activity Stream is your live, chronological log of every change across Projects, Sections, Tasks, and Subtasks - showing exactly what happened, who did it, and when. It’s like a project diary that auto-updates, so you never miss a beat on what’s moving (or not).

Spot issues fast: See why a task slipped (e.g., “Due date changed by John on Nov 10”) Build trust: Prove accountability with a full audit trail for retros or client reviews Save time: No digging through emails or chats - everything’s in one searchable spot Learn & improve: Track patterns like “Sarah updates status 3x more than average”

Real-time updates: Changes appear instantly as they happen Who/What/When: Every entry shows user, action (e.g., “Status -> Done”), timestamp Search & Filter: By person, date, type (e.g., “Show only Task updates from last week”)
Plan History Maintained Free 1 day Growth 30 days Scale 180 days
To explore about project history , refer to the Project Activity Stream. To explore about task history , refer to the Task Activity Stream.
Project Activity Stream is the complete timeline of every change made directly to your Project - from settings tweaks to team updates - giving you an instant snapshot of who did what, when.
Plan History Maintained Free 1 day Growth 30 days Scale 180 days
Go to your Project -> More icon (three dots) → Project Settings → Views Toggle Activity Stream to ON/Off (it’s on by default) Go back to Project Views -> click Activity Stream tab.
All users with Project access (View permission or higher) can see the Activity Stream of project.

Activity Type Details Project Details Name, description, icon/color changes and other details of project People Management Users added/removed, role changes Features and Views Feature and views toggles Customization Task Types, Status Workflows, Priorities, Custom Fields, Sections Workflows Workflows created/edited/deleted Integration Connections to Slack, teams, etc. added/updated
Want to see only specific person's changes? Click Filter -> Select a person Instantly shows just his/her updates (e.g., “Sarah updated Status Workflow”) Clear filter -> see all data again

Activity Stream auto-groups entries to keep it scannable: Group Details Today Changes from midnight to now Last 7 days Changes from last week Last 30 days Changes from past week Older than 30 days Everything before that
To explore about task history , refer to the Task Activity Stream.
Section Activity Stream is the full timeline of every change made to a specific Section - from name tweaks to status shifts - so you always know who touched what and when inside this bucket of tasks.
Plan History Maintained Free 1 day Growth 30 days Scale 180 days
Go to your Project -> More icon (three dots) -> Project Settings -> Views Toggle Activity Stream to ON/Off (it’s on by default) Go to Section -> Section Views -> click Activity Stream tab.
All users with Project access (View permission or higher) can see the Activity Stream of project.

Activity Type Details Section Details Name, description, icon/color changes Status & Dates Status (New/In Progress/Done), Start Date, Due Date updates Order & Visibility Drag-and-drop reordering, Hide/Show in hierarchy
Want to see only specific person's changes? Click Filter -> Select a person Instantly shows just his/her updates (e.g., “Sarah updated Status Workflow”) Clear filter -> see all data again

Activity Stream auto-groups entries to keep it scannable: Group Details Today Changes from midnight to now Last 7 days Changes from last week Last 30 days Changes from past week Older than 30 days Everything before that
To explore about project history , refer to the Project Activity Stream. To explore about task history , refer to the Task Activity Stream.
** Task Activity History** is the complete, unfiltered log of every single thing that ever happened to a Task or Subtask - from creation to deletion - showing exactly who did what and when.
Plan History Maintained Free 1 day Growth 30 days Scale 180 days
All users with View Task permission can open the Activity History for both Tasks and Subtasks.
Open any Task → Task Details panel (right side) Click the Activity Stream tab - you’re now in the full history

Activity Type Details Task Created Who created the Task/Subtask + timestamp Task Edited Every field change: Status, Assignee, Due Date, Priority, Tags, Progress, etc. Moved Section or Project change Task Deleted Who deleted + timestamp (Task or Subtask) Workflow Actions Auto-changes from automations
Want to see only specific person's changes? Click Filter -> Select a person Instantly shows just his/her updates (e.g., “Sarah updated Status Workflow”) Clear filter -> see all data again

Activity Stream auto-groups entries to keep it scannable: Group Details Today Changes from midnight to now Last 7 days Changes from last week Last 30 days Changes from past week Older than 30 days Everything before that
To explore about project history , refer to the Project Activity Stream.

Board View provides additional controls that let you fine-tune how tasks, subtasks, and columns are displayed. These settings allow you to show or hide completed work, choose how subtasks appear, and manage or reset your saved Board View layout. These configurations are: User-specific (each user can maintain personal preferences) Project-specific (changes apply only to the currently opened project) The Board View features menu helps every user tailor the Kanban board to match their working and reviewing style.
Navigate to any Project → Board View. Click the three-dot menu (⋮) located in the top-right corner. A menu will open showing all available Board View configuration options.
documents.s: How to Access the Additional Features

documents.t: Below are detailed explanations of every option available in the three-dot menu. 1. Show Completed Tasks​ Controls the visibility of tasks whose Status belongs to any Done stage. Behavior: Enabled (✓) → Completed tasks appear on the board. Disabled → Completed tasks are hidden from all board columns. Notes: This is a visibility toggle only — no data is removed. Useful for decluttering the board when focusing on active work. 2. Show Completed Subtasks​ Works exactly like Show Completed Tasks, but applies to subtasks. Behavior: Enabled (✓) → Completed subtasks appear either: Inside parent task cards Or as separate cards (if “Show Subtask as a Separate Task” is enabled) Disabled → Completed subtasks are hidden from the board. 3. Show Completed Sections​ Sections also have statuses (New, In Progress, Done). Behavior: Enabled (✓) → Columns representing completed Sections are visible. Disabled → Columns belonging to Sections in the “Done” stage are hidden. Note: column visibility 4. Show Subtask as a Separate Task​ Determines how subtasks appear in Board View.

Subtasks appear as standalone task cards directly on the board. They appear in the correct Group By column based on their own attributes (Status, Assignee, Priority, etc.). Subtasks remain linked to their parent task.

Subtasks appear only inside the parent task card. They are visible when you expand the subtask icon on the card. Notes: Very useful when subtasks follow separate workflows or must be tracked visually. This matches agile/sprint workflows where subtasks move independently. 5. Save View​ Use Save View to save all the board configuration preferences currently applied, such as: Filters Sort order Group By selection Customize settings (field visibility / card layout) Show/Hide Completed Tasks Show/Hide Completed Subtasks Show/Hide Completed Sections Show Subtask as Separate Task Column order (Section-only), if supported in your product Any view-level preference that affects how the board is displayed 6. Set as Default View​ Allows the user to set the current Board View layout as their default for this project.

Every time the user opens this project, the chosen Board View will load automatically. The default view can include: Group By field Sort field Filters Customize selections Show Completed Tasks / Subtasks Show Completed Sections Subtasks as separate tasks setting Any display preferences previously saved 7. Reset to Default View​ Restores the system’s original Board View configuration for this project. This resets:​ All filters Sort order Group By selection Customize settings Subtask display options Completed tasks/subtasks/section visibility toggles Any additional unsaved or saved user configurations Use this option to clear all personal modifications and revert to the default Board view layout.

The Customize option in Board View lets you control what information appears on each task card. You can choose which fields to display, hide the ones you don’t need, reorder fields inside the card, and even create new custom fields when enabled for the project. Customization helps you create a clear, compact, and meaningful card layout that matches your workflow.
Open any project in Board View. Click the Customize button at the top-right corner. The Card Fields Panel will open, showing all available standard and custom fields.

Within the Customize panel, you will see two types of fields: 1. Standard Fields​ These are built-in task fields such as: Task Name Task ID Assignee Priority Status Section Start Date Due Date Progress Task Type Budget Type * Tags * Estimation * Story Point * Created By Created On Updated By Updated On * Fields marked with an asterisk appear only if the related project features are enabled. 2. Custom Fields​ All supported custom fields configured for the project will also appear here. You can: Toggle visibility of each custom field Drag and drop to reorder custom fields Create new custom fields (only when Custom Fields are enabled in the project) Supported Custom Field types that can appear visually on Board View include: Dropdown Rating Radio Button Text Box Number Date Time Date & Time Email What You Can Do​ 1. Toggle Visibility​ Turn fields ON or OFF using the switch. When ON, the field appears on every task card. 2. Reorder Fields​ Drag and drop fields to change the display order on the task card. 3. Pin Fields​ Click the pin icon (📌) to pin a field at the top of every card, ensuring it remains visible regardless of card layout. 4. Create Custom Fields​ Click + New Custom Field at the bottom of the panel to create a new field and apply it to the project’s tasks. (Custom Fields option only appears if the project has Custom Fields enabled.)

When you make any changes in the Customize panel: A banner appears at the top: “This view has unsaved changes.” A Save button and a Cancel (❌) icon will be shown. Click Save to apply your selected field visibility and ordering for this project. Changes will not take effect until saved.

Customization in Board View is user-specific: Each user can choose which fields to show or hide on their cards Field order is also saved per user Customization applies only to the current project When you return to the project later, your preferred card layout remains intact. Notes​ Feature-based fields (e.g., Tags, Budget Type, Estimation, Story Point) appear only if the related features are enabled in Project Settings. Adding a custom field makes it available to all tasks within the same project. Changing visibility or order does not affect task data—only how it is displayed on the card.

Filters in Board View allow you to narrow down tasks based on specific conditions so you can focus on exactly what you need. Whether you're trying to view tasks assigned to a specific person or filter by status, the Filter panel helps you refine your board efficiently. Filters are contextual, dynamic, and highly flexible. They support both standard fields (e.g., Assignee, Status, Due Date) and any custom fields configured for the project. Multiple filters can be combined using the AND operator, ensuring that only tasks matching all conditions appear on the board. Filter configuration is user-specific, meaning each user can apply their own filter set without affecting anyone else.

Navigate to any Project. Open the project in Board View. Click on the Filter icon at the top of the screen. The Filter Panel opens in an expanded view and shows: Currently applied filters (if any) A “No filters applied yet” message when empty The + Add button to create new filter conditions
documents.s: How to Access the Filter Panel

documents.t: When no filters are active: You will see the message: “No filters applied yet” A + Add button is available to start adding conditions The panel remains empty until your first filter row is added You can add filters immediately.
documents.s: Default State (When No Filters Are Applied)

documents.t: When you click + Add, a new filter row appears. Each filter contains three parts: 1. Field Selector (Where)​ Choose the attribute to filter by, such as: Assignee Status Due Date Start Date Priority Tags Task Type Budget Type Any Custom Field …and more. Once a field is selected, the Operator dropdown becomes active. 2. Operator​ Operators vary depending on the selected field. Examples include: Equals Not Equals Is One Of Is Not One Of On or Before On or After Before / After Is Empty / Is Not Empty (See the detailed operator table below.) 3. Value​ This is the value used to filter the board. Examples: Assignee → Jayesh Status → In Progress Due Date → 05–Nov–2025 Tags → SEO, Design Priority → High Values update dynamically based on the selected field.

Click + Add to add more filter rows. All filters use the AND condition, meaning: Only tasks that satisfy all filter conditions will appear on the board. Filters apply across all Board columns, regardless of Group By selection.
Click any dropdown (Field / Operator / Value) and update the selection. All validations are applied automatically.

Click the Delete (🗑️) icon next to a filter row. The filter is removed immediately. Clear All Filters​ Appears only when at least one filter is applied. Click Clear Filters at the bottom-right All filters reset instantly Board returns to its default unfiltered state

Filters do not require a Save button. They are automatically saved when you: Change a filter Click outside the panel Close the panel The filtered Board View updates instantly and stays active until you clear it manually.

Standard Fields​ Field Supported Operators Section Equals, Not Equals, Is One Of, Is Not One Of Assignee Equals, Not Equals, Is One Of, Is Not One Of Status Equals, Not Equals, Is One Of, Is Not One Of Priority Equals, Not Equals, Is One Of, Is Not One Of Task Type Equals, Not Equals, Is One Of, Is Not One Of Tags Equals, Not Equals, Is One Of, Is Not One Of Budget Type Equals, Is One Of Start Date On or Before, On or After, Equals, Not Equals, Before, After, Is Empty, Is Not Empty Due Date On or Before, On or After, Equals, Not Equals, Before, After, Is Empty, Is Not Empty Created On Equals, Not Equals, On or Before, On or After, Before, After Updated On Equals, Not Equals, On or Before, On or After, Before, After, Is Empty, Is Not Empty Custom Fields​ Custom Field Type Supported Operators Dropdown Equals, Not Equals, Is One Of, Is Not One Of Radio Button Equals Rating Equals, Not Equals Multiselect Dropdown Equals, Not Equals, Is One Of, Is Not One Of (Only the custom field types supported by Board View appear in the filter panel.)

When at least one filter is active: The Filter icon becomes highlighted A small indicator dot shows filters are in use This helps users quickly identify that the board is filtered — even when scrolling across multiple columns.

Filters are user-specific — your filters only affect your view. Filters are project-specific — filters applied in one project do not affect another. Filtering applies instantly and updates visible task cards in real time. Some columns may appear empty when filters are applied, depending on results. Filters only control visibility. They do not limit drag-and-drop. You can still move tasks between columns when filters are active.

The Group By feature in Board View organizes your tasks into vertical columns based on a selected field. Each column represents one value of that field—such as Section, Status, Assignee, Priority, Task Type, Tags, or supported Custom Fields. Grouping helps you quickly understand how tasks are distributed across categories, identify bottlenecks, and visually track progress using a Kanban-style workflow. Board View relies heavily on Group By for layout. By default, Board View is grouped by Section.

User-specific: Each user’s grouping applies only to their own view. Project-specific: Grouping is saved only for that project. One grouping at a time: Only a single Group By field can be active. Default = Section: When no grouping is selected or grouping is reset. Remove grouping: Selecting None shows all tasks in a single column titled None.

Open any Project in Board View. At the top of the board, click Group By : <current-value>. A dropdown appears showing all supported fields. Select the field you want to group tasks by. Save your view when prompted.

The board reorganizes into vertical Kanban columns, each representing one value of the selected field. Tasks automatically move into their respective columns based on their current values. You can drag and drop tasks between columns to update the field value instantly. If a project feature controls certain fields (e.g., Budget Type), related grouping options appear only when that feature is enabled. Empty columns remain visible to help with planning and clarity.
documents.s: What Happens When Grouping Is Applied

documents.t: Standard Fields​ You can group by the following built-in fields: Section Assignee Status Priority Task Type Budget Type * Tags * * Appears only if the corresponding project feature is enabled. Supported Custom Fields​ Only the following custom field types support Group By in Board View: Dropdown (single-select) Rating Radio Button Notes:​ Drag-and-drop automatically updates the underlying task field based on the Group By setting. For example, when the board is grouped by Task Type, dropping a task into a different Task Type column updates the task’s type. If the new type uses a different status workflow, the system prompts you to remap the status before completing the change. Tags are additive in Board View: Moving a task into a Tag column adds the tag while keeping existing tags. Status + Task Type rules: If a task type uses a different workflow, dragging into an incompatible status column fails and reverts automatically. Special Option: None​ Selecting None removes all grouping. Selecting None removes all grouping. All tasks appear in a single column titled “None.” Drag-and-drop is allowed, and while it does not update any task field (since no grouping is applied), it does change the visual order of tasks within the column. Sorting and filtering continue to work normally.
When you change the Group By option in Board View, a banner appears at the top of the screen saying: “This view has unsaved changes.” You will also see a Save button and a Cancel (❌) icon.
Click Save to store your selected Group By preference. Your selection is saved for: This project Your user account only
Click Cancel to discard the changes. Board View will return to the previously saved grouping.

Board View in 5day.io provides a visual, Kanban-style way to manage tasks. Each task appears as a card, and each column represents a group — such as Section, Status, Priority, Assignee, Task Type, Tags, Budget Type, or a supported Custom Field — based on the Group By selection you apply. Board View is ideal for teams who prefer a drag-and-drop workflow to track progress, update attributes, and quickly organize work. By default, Board View is grouped by Section.
Board View is available on all subscription plans.

What a user sees or can modify in Board View depends entirely on the roles and permissions assigned to them in your account. Users can only view or modify the tasks and subtasks they have permission to access. All task visibility rules and allowed actions in Board View follow the Task Roles & Permissions configuration. For complete details on task-level visibility and permissions, refer to the Task Roles & Permissions documentation: https://github.com/5dayGit/5day_Docusaurus/blob/main/docs/user-guide/5day.io Structure/Task/Roles and Permission of Task.md
Open any project. Click Board from the top view selector. Board View loads with cards organized by the currently selected Group By option (default: Section).

Each task is shown as a card that includes key information such as: Task Name Assignee Status Due Date / Start Date Priority Budget Type (if enabled) Progress Custom Field values (e.g., Rating, Dropdown, Number, Radio Button, etc.) If the task contains subtasks, a subtask icon appears on the card. Clicking this opens the subtask list inside the card. Clicking the card opens the Task Detail Panel, where all information can be viewed and edited.
You can drag a task card from one column to another to update values instantly.

Drag-and-drop is allowed across all Group By fields. However, if Group By = Status and the task type uses a different workflow, you can drop visually but the system reverts the move and shows an error. When Group By = Task Type, moving task from one task type to another type displays a status mapping screen to remap statuses.

Board View is driven by Group By, which determines how columns are structured. Supported Group By Fields​ Standard Fields Section Assignee Status Priority Task Type Tags Budget Type Custom Fields (Supported Types Only): Dropdown (single-select) Rating Radio Button Not Supported in Board Grouping: Multi-select dropdowns Text fields Number fields Date or Date/Time URL, Email, Checkbox, Time fields None All tasks appear under a single column titled “None”. Additional Rules​ Grouping is user-specific (does not affect others). Grouping is project-specific when saved. Notes:​ Group By = None shows all tasks under a single column titled “None”. Dragging a task into a tag’s column does not replace its existing tags. Instead, the system adds the new tag to the task while keeping the tags it already has. Custom field grouping only supports Dropdown, Rating, and Radio Button.

The Sort option in Board View helps you organize how tasks appear within each column of the board. Sorting allows you to order task cards by fields such as Due Date, Priority, Created On, Custom Fields, and more. This helps you view tasks in a structured order—such as earliest due date first—while keeping your Kanban-style workflow intact.

Open any Project in Board View Click the Sort button at the top-right of the screen Select the field you want to sort by Click the same field again to toggle between ascending and descending Tasks inside each column will reorder instantly.

1. Standard Fields​ You can sort by the following built-in task fields: Name Priority Start Date Due Date Estimation * Story Point * Created On Updated On Logged Time *Fields marked with an asterisk appear only if their related project features are enabled. 2. Custom Fields​ Sorting is supported for the following Custom Field types: Text Box Dropdown Rating Date Time Date & Time Email Radio Button Only custom fields enabled for the project and supported by Board View will appear.

Sorting in Board View is user-specific. Each user can apply their own sort order without affecting anyone else. Sort preferences are saved per project, and will remain active the next time the user opens the project’s Board View.

When you apply or modify sorting in Board View: A banner appears: “This view has unsaved changes.” A Save button and a Cancel (❌) icon are shown Click Save to store your sort preference for this project’s Board View. Notes​ Only one sort field can be applied at a time (single-field sort) Sorting does not affect drag-and-drop behavior Sorting does not override Group By — grouping always determines column layout
The ‘Discussion’ feature is available across all subscription plans in 5day.io.

Discussions are available at four levels of structure in 5day.io: Project Section Task Subtask At the Project and Section, the Discussion View needs to be enabled in the Project Settings under the Views section. At the Task and Subtask levels, the Discussion feature is automatically enabled.

By default, in all projects & section; discussion view is enable. Follow these simple steps to manage the visibility of discussion view in project/section views panel. Navigate to the Project Settings. Under the Views section, ensure that the Discussion View is enabled. Once enabled, discussions will be available at the Project and Section. For Task and Subtask, the discussion feature is auto-enabled and will be accessible without additional setup. You can also change the order of the view to display in project views panel.
Discussion View Permission: Users with view permissions for discussions can access them at all levels (Project, Section, Task, Subtask).

For Project/Section: Go to the specific Project or Section. Select the view Discussion from project's top bar. You will be able to view all comments. For Task/Subtask: Go to the specific Project/Section. Select the Task or Subtask. The task details page will open. Click on Discussion under the Task/Subtask details. You will be able to view all comments.
To Add a message, refer Add Message To mention someone in message, refer @mention in Message

A Message in the Discussion View allows team members to share their thoughts, updates, or feedback regarding specific projects, sections, tasks, or subtasks. Adding a message is a key method of collaborating and keeping communication transparent within 5day.io.
The ‘Discussion’ feature is available across all subscription plans in 5day.io.
Users who have the permission to add message can participate in discussions and contribute to the conversation.

Navigate to the relevant Project, Section, Task, or Subtask. Change the view to Discussion. Type your message in the text input box at the bottom of the discussion area. If you want to format your text, use the Rich Text Editor options. After typing your comment, click on the Save button to add the message to the discussion. Your message will be immediately visible to everyone who has access to that discussion.
To access Discussion View, refer Discussion View To edit a message, refer Edit Message

A delete option allows users to remove message they have posted at the discussion. However, only the person who added the message can delete it. Other users, even those with access to the discussion, cannot delete message made by others.

Hover over the message you wish to delete. Click on the Delete icon (usually represented by a trash can). Confirm the deletion when prompted. Quick Note Only the Message owner (the person who originally added the message) can delete the message.
To access Discussion View, refer Discussion View To add a message, refer Add Message To edit a message, refer Edit Message
An edit option allows users to modify the content of a message they have already posted. Like deleting, only the user who added the message can edit it.

Hover over the message you wish to edit. Click on the Edit icon (usually represented by a pencil). Modify the text of your message. After making changes, click on the Save button to update the message. Quick Note Only the message owner (the person who originally added the message) can edit the message.
To access Discussion View, refer Discussion View To add a message, refer Add Message To delete a message, refer Delete Message

In 5day.io, Discussion refers to the ability to engage in conversations, share comments, and collaborate within projects, sections, tasks, and subtasks. Discussions enable team members to communicate effectively and share insights, updates, or feedback directly related to specific elements of the project. By centralizing all discussions in one place, 5day.io helps keep communication transparent and organized.

It stops the endless email threads and Slack pings. Everything lives right where the work is - inside the task or section - so no one has to hunt for “what did we decide?” Context stays glued to the action. You see who said what, when, and why, which cuts confusion and speeds up decisions. Plus, clients or new teammates can jump in and instantly catch up without a recap meeting.

Threaded comments: Reply directly to a message so the conversation stays tidy and easy to follow. @mentions: Tag someone with @name and they get a notification - perfect for quick handoffs or approvals. File attachments: Drop images, PDFs, or links right into the thread; no more “check your email.” Rich text: Bold, italic, bullet lists, or code blocks - format your update so it’s clear the first time. Activity timeline: Every comment, edit, or file shows up with a timestamp and who did it.
To access Discussion View, refer Discussion View To add a message, refer Add Message
5day.io offers multiple features to enhance message functionality and improve communication in discussions:

Mentions allow you to tag other users in your message, notifying them directly about the message. This is useful for drawing attention to specific people or bringing them into a conversation. @mention User In the message text input box, type the @ symbol. Start typing the name of the person you want to mention. A list of people will appear, allowing you to select the correct user by clicking on their name. Once the person is tagged, they will receive a notification that includes a link to the message, allowing them to directly access the conversation. Quick Note Users tagged in message will also be able to reply directly from the notification.

Tagging of task/subtask allow a quick access from a message and also shows the reference. #Task/Subtask In the message text input box, type the # symbol. Start typing the ID/title of task/subtask. A list of tasks/subtasks will appear as per your searched criteria. Select the task/subtask.

The Attach File feature allows you to add files to your message. This can include documents, images, spreadsheets, or any other type of file relevant to the message. Attach a File Click on the Attachment icon (usually represented by a paperclip). Choose one of the following upload methods: Upload from Computer: Select a file from your local system to upload. Upload via Google Drive: Select a file from your Google Drive to upload. Upload via OneDrive: Select a file from your OneDrive to upload. After the file is uploaded, it will appear as an attachment under your message.

The Rich Text Editor in 5day.io provides a powerful and flexible way for users to create well-formatted, professional content across the platform. Whether you are writing a task description, adding a discussion message, or updating a document, the Rich Text Editor offers an extensive range of formatting tools to enhance your writing experience. Users can easily apply text formatting (such as bold, italics, underline), insert lists, quotes, and code blocks, and add advanced elements like links, videos, and emojis. Additionally, options like text direction, font size adjustment, background highlights, and cleaning formatting help maintain a clean and structured layout. The editor supports both basic and advanced editing needs, making collaboration and communication within 5day.io more effective and visually organized.

Whenever you are editing a text field (like Task Description or Discussion), the Rich Text Editor toolbar will be available on top. To access advanced features, click on the dropdown (...) to open the Rich Text Menu. Hover over each option to view a tooltip describing its functionality.

Below are the features available in the Rich Text Editor: Feature Description Bold Make your selected text bold for emphasis. Italic Italicize your text to highlight or differentiate content. Underline Underline important parts of your text. Strikethrough Strike through text to show completed or obsolete items. Bullet List Create a bulleted list for better organization of points. Number List Create a numbered list for sequential information. Blockquote Add a quotation block to highlight key quotes or references. Code Block Insert a block specifically for code snippets or technical content. Subscript Add subscript text for chemical formulas or technical data (e.g., H₂O). Superscript Add superscript text for footnotes or mathematical notations (e.g., x²). Indent Indent text to the right to structure the document better. Outdent Remove an indent to adjust the text back towards the left. Text Direction Change the direction of text, useful for right-to-left languages. Font Size Adjust the font size (increase or decrease) of your text. Header Insert header styles (H1, H2, H3, etc.) to structure the content into sections. Link Insert a hyperlink to direct users to an external or internal page. Video Embed a video by adding a video link. Color Change the text color to emphasize specific words or sections. Background Highlight text by changing its background color. Clean Remove any formatting applied to selected text and return it to default style. Undo Revert your last action or change made in the editor. Redo Reapply an action that was undone.
To access Discussion View, refer Discussion View To add a message, refer Add Message To edit a message, refer Edit Message
A reply is a response to an existing message, creating a thread under the original message. This allows for more detailed conversations within the same context.
To reply to a message, users must have permission to add message.

Hover over the message you would like to reply to. A Reply button will appear at the top of message. Click on the Reply button to open a text input box for the reply. Type your reply in the input box. Click on the Save button to add your reply. The reply will appear below the original message, creating a thread for easy tracking of conversations.
To access Discussion View, refer Discussion View To add a message, refer Add Message To edit a message, refer Edit Message
The Files feature is available to all subscription plans. However, the total file upload limit depends on your plan: Subscription Plan File Upload Limit Free 2 GB Growth 100 GB

In 5day.io, files can be managed and organized across four levels of hierarchy: Project Section Task Subtask At the Project and Section, the File View needs to be enabled in the Project Settings under the Views section. At the Task and Subtask levels, the Files feature is automatically enabled.
documents.s: Availability of File view in Structure

documents.t: By default, in all projects & section; file view is enable. Follow these simple steps to manage the visibility of file view in project/section views panel. Navigate to the Project Settings. Under the Views section, ensure that the File View is enabled. Once enabled, discussions will be available at the Project and Section. For Task and Subtask, the files feature is auto-enabled and will be accessible without additional setup. You can also change the order of the view to display in project views panel.
View Permission: Users with view access to the files can view them at all views (Project, Section, Task, Subtask).

For Project/Section: Go to the specific Project or Section. Change the view to ‘Files’ to view all the uploaded files for that entity. For Task/Subtask: Go to the specific Project/Section. Select the Task or Subtask. On the task details page, click on ‘Files’ under Task/Subtask details. All uploaded files related to that task or subtask will be visible here.
To access File view, refer File View To upload a file, refer Upload File
To permanently delete the uploaded file from your account. Deleting a file in 5day.io is quick - just click the trash icon next to the file.
Only the user who uploaded the file can delete it.
To access File view, refer File View To upload a file, refer Upload File
Grab the latest version instantly, whether it’s a PDF, image, or spreadsheet. Downloading a file in 5day.io is one click away - just hover over the file and hit the download icon.
Only users with file view permission can download files.
To download a file Access the file by navigating to the Files View in the relevant section. Click on the file. The file will be automatically downloaded to your local machine.
To access File view, refer File View To upload a file, refer Upload File

In 5day.io, Files refer to any digital documents, images, spreadsheets, PDFs, or other project-related assets that are uploaded and associated with projects, sections, tasks, or subtasks. These files can be accessed, shared, and managed by team members based on their permissions, helping to centralize project documentation and collaboration. The Files section is designed to store and organize these resources for easy retrieval, sharing, and management within your workspace.
